loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan un joven agricultor de 26 años de edad quien aprendió a trabajar en el campo gracias a sus hermanos mayores puesto que desde muy joven quedo huérfano. 
Es un hombre que vive solo, no tiene pareja su única compañía son sus 800 palos de tomate de árbol los cuales le dan una producción suficiente para mantenerse así mismo. 
Necesita un crédito para comprar insumos para re-abonar sus campos, la cantidad es considerable puesto que su precio es muy alto y en muchas ocasiones los campesinos no tienen como pagar de contado esta elevada suma. 
Sueña con seguir progresando y encontrar a alguien con quien compartir su vida que llene ese hueco que dejo la perdida de sus padres.
texts.en:
Juan is a young farmer, 26 years old, who learned to work in the countryside thanks to his older siblings since when he was very young he was orphaned.

He is a man who lives alone. He doesn't have a partner. His only company are his 800 tree tomato plants, which give him sufficient production to support himself.

He needs a loan to purchase supplies to re-fertilize his fields. The amount is considerable since the price is very high and many times rural people don't have the money to pay this elevated cost in cash.  

He dreams of continuing to progress and find someone to share his life with, to fill this gap that the loss of his parents left.

loans.use: to purchase supplements for his crops such as manure, irrigation, and fertilizer.

loans.name: José Fermín

texts.es:
José es un joven de 22 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado, está acompañado y su pareja es panificadora, trabaja en la panadería que ellos tienen, aún no tiene hijos y él vive su mamá.

Actualmente, tiene una panadería la cual ha estado funcionando por más de 3 años, trabajo que aprendió de un taller impartido a personas emprendedoras y se decidió entrar de lleno a esta actividad debido a que en su zona la demanda de pan es alta y no hay productores locales para satisfacer el mercado, además él se dedica a las estructuras metálicas y trabaja en el taller también para obtener ingresos. La panadería la tiene en su casa, su pareja y su mamá se involucran de modo que todos se apoyan para salir adelante.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar un motor y las poleas para adaptárselos a los cilindros amasadores para tener un proceso de elaboración de pan más rápido, ya que actualmente lo están haciendo con un molino y el proceso es tardado y costoso.

Su sueño es tener mejor maquinaria para elaborar pan, construir su casa tener algo que ofrecer a sus hijos cuando sea padre.
texts.en:
José is a 22-year-old young man. He went to school up to the seventh grade, is partnered, and his partner is a baker; he works in the bakery that they have.  He doesn't have any children yet and he lives with his mother.

Currently, he has a bakery which has been running for over 3 years. It is work he learned in a workshop given to entrepreneurs and he decided to take on this work since in his area the demand for bread is high and there are no local producers to meet the need. In addition, he works in metalworking and he works in the store also to earn income. The bakery is located in his house, his partner and his mother are involved so that they all help each other get ahead. 

The loan is needed to purchase a to purchase a motor and pulleys to fit them to the kneading cylinders to have a quicker process to make bread, since at the moment they are doing it with a mill and the process is slow and costly. 

His dream is to have better machinery to make bread, build a house, and have something to offer his children when he is a father.

loans.use: to purchase a motor and pulleys to fit them to the kneading cylinders to have a quicker process to make bread.

loans.name: José Dolores

texts.es:
José de 43 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, estuvo acompañado y es padre de dos hijos quienes viven con él, en casa de José también viven sus padres, por lo tanto son 4 personas las que dependen de él.

Por más de 20 años, José se ha dedicado a la agricultura sembrando granos básicos, este trabajo lo aprendió de su padre, trabaja fuertemente todos los días; de su casa camina 40 minutos por el sendero para llegar al terreno donde tiene su cultivo de maíz y de frijol su padre a pesar de la edad lo acompaña para realizar las diferentes labores que demanda el cultivo.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar 5 quintales de abono granulado, 3 litros de abono foliar y un litro de insecticida para combatir plagas en su cultivo; todo esto con el fin de tener una buena cosecha para que en su casa no falten los granos básicos para el consumo de la familia y además poder comercializar una parte.

Él planea con seguir trabajando para dar a su familia  las condiciones de vida que se merece, además poder remodelar su casa para vivir en un lugar más bonito y seguro y tener también algo que ofrecerles a sus hijos para que salgan adelante.
texts.en:
José, 43 years old, went to school up to the third grade. He was partnered, and is the father of two children who live with him. His parents also live in José's house, so there are 4 people who depend on him. 

For over 20 years, José has worked in agriculture, growing basic grains. He learned this work from his father. He works very hard every day. From his house, he walks for 40 minutes on a path to get to the land where he has his corn and bean crops. His father, despite his age, works with him to do the various tasks that the crops demand.

The loan is needed to purchase 5 quintales (approximately 500 pounds) of granulated fertilizer, 3 liters of foliant fertilizer, and a liter of insecticide to fight the pests in his crop.  All this is in order to have a good harvest so that the family doesn't lack basic grains to eat in the house and, in addition, to be able to sell some. 

He plans to continue working to give his family the living conditions they deserve. In addition, to be able to renovate his house to live in a nicer and more secure place, and also to have something to offer his children so they can get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase 5 quintales (approximately 500 pounds) of granulated fertilizer, 3 liters of foliant fertilizer, and a liter of insecticide to fight the pests in his crop.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es una señora de 48 años, esta acompañada tiene dos hijos uno de 12 y otro de 20 años de edad; el  hijo de 12 años estudia 6° grado y su otro hijo esta acompañado y tiene su propio hogar .

Su compañero de vida trabaja como albañil desde hace 10 años, sus hermanos se dedicaban al mismo trabajo y él aprendió de ellos, en su hogar vive un sobrino con ellos y este le ayuda a realizar dicho trabajo.

Ella se dedica al oficio del hogar, ya que no tubo la oportunidad de poder estudiar, de esa forma le ayuda a su esposo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar materiales para construir el techo de su casa, puertas  y para la mano de obra.

Ella en el futuro quiere obtener un crédito mas grande y así poder construir el muro alrededor de su casa, para un mejor bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Lidia is a 48-year-old lady. She is partnered and has two children, one is 12 and the other is 20 years old. The 12-year-old son is in 6th grade and the other son is partnered and has his own home.

Her life partner has worked as a bricklayer for the past 10 years. His siblings do the same work and he learned it from them. A nephew lives in the home with them and helps him with this work. 

She takes care of the household tasks, since she did not have the opportunity to be able to go to school. In this way, she helps her partner.

The loan that she is requesting is to purchase materials to build the roof on her house, doors, and pay labor costs.

In the future, she wants to get a larger loan and be able to construct a wall around her house for her family's improved well-being.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build the roof on her house, doors, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Dolores Isabel

texts.es:
Dolores de 22 años de edad,  es una mujer emprendedora que lucha arduamemnte para llevar el sustento a su familia, ella estudio hasta bachillerato, no pudo continuar sus estudios porque salio embarazada, teniendo que buscar un trabajo y dejar a un lado sus estudios, ella es madre soltera, actualmente vive con una hermana y un sobrino.

Dolores se dedica a cuidar a su pequeño hijo y a los quehaceres del hogar, su principal actividad productiva es la administracion de un negocio familiar que es una tejera, esta actividad la aprendio gracias a su padre y ahora en dia es ella quien esta a cargo del negocio.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar barro, sacate, leña, para la elaboracion de teja y el resto para consolidar unos compromisos economicos.

Su principal sueño es poder retomar sus estudios, para ello tiene que trabajar arduamente y ahorrar y ademas esperar que cresca un poco mas su hijo.
texts.en:
Dolores, 22 years old, is an enterprising woman who fights arduously to bring sustenance to her family. She went to school up to secondary. She couldn't continue her education because she got pregnant, having to look for work and abandon her education. She is a single mother and currently lives with her sister and a nephew.

Dolores works taking care of her little son and the household tasks. Her primary job is running the family business which is a tile-making business. She learned this work thanks to her father and today she is in charge of the business.

The loan that she is requesting it to purchase clay, turf, and firewood, for the production of tiles and the rest is to consolidate some economic commitments. 

Her primary dream is to be able to go back to school, for this she has to work arduously and save money and also wait until her son is a little older.

loans.use: to purchase clay, turf, and firewood to make tiles and the rest is to consolidate some economic commitments.

loans.name: Celia Del Carmen

texts.es:
El cacaraqueo de los gallos se convierte en su alarma matutina, cada día Celia emprende su viaje por las calles de su barrio, para ofrecer cuajadas, leña y granos básicos. Celia es una mujer emprendedora, determinante y con grandes deseos de superación, a sus 26 años, ya cuenta con su propio negocio, el cual ha sido un sustento en la economía de su familia. El mayor anhelo de Celia es que sus hijos se preparen y tengan una educación de calidad, de tal forma quiere brindarle los espacios necesarios y seguros de su hogar, cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja quien es su principal recurso de su morada.
Celia para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, solicita el crédito para la construcción de servicios higiénicos en su hogar, ya que no cuenta con las paredes de su servicio higiénico, teniendo que improvisar cubriendo con viejas latas de zinc y plástico. Lo que afecta la privacidad de su familia, poniendo en riesgo la seguridad de sus hijos. Celia deposita su confianza en el financiamiento de este nuevo proyecto que ayudara a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia proporcionando un entorno familiar agradable. Seguirá trabajando en su negocio y la extensión de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The roosters' crow is her morning alarm. Every day, Celia undertakes her trip through the streets of her neighborhood, selling curds, firewood, and basic grains. Celia is an enterprising woman, determined, and with great desire to improve herself. At 26, she already has her own business, which has been an economic support for her family. Her greatest desire is that her children are educated and have a quality education, in that way she wants to offer them the necessary spaces and security of their home. She has the help of her partner who is the principal resource of the home.

Celia, in order to improve her family's quality of life, asks for a loan to build a bathroom in her home, since she doesn't have walls for her bathroom, improvising by covering it with old zinc cans and plastic.  This affects her family's privacy and puts her children's safety at risk. She puts her confidence in the loan for this new project that will help her improve her family's quality of life, providing a pleasant family environment. She will continue working in her business and expanding her customers.

loans.use: She asks for a loan to build a bathroom in her home.

loans.name: Breihtner Eduardo

texts.es:
Breihtner junto a su pareja son los orgullosos padres de 3 hijos de 10, 9y 4 años de edad los cuales mantiene gracias a su negocio de venta de mercancía como perfumería y zapatería los cuales hace ambulantemente, desplazando por el barrio, pro pueblos por toda parte que pueda llegar con la esperanza de lograr una venta para llevar un alimento a su casa.
Breihtner siempre ha soñado con tener un local pues los largos desplazamientos que tiene que hacer para lograr una venta en muchas ocasiones lo dejan con poco tiempo para dedicarle a sus hijos, sentarse con ellos ver como progresan, ayudarles con una tarea o compartir solo una amena conversación, por eso esta tan decidido a tener su almacén y el camino más corto es trabajar y trabajar muy duro por dicha razón quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de mercancía básicamente lociones y calzado.
texts.en:
Breihtner, along with his partner, are the proud parents of 3 children, ages 10, 9, and 4, who they support thanks to his business selling merchandise such as perfume, and footwear, which his does as a street vendor, moving around the neighborhood, through towns, in every place where he can get with the hope of achieving a sale to bring food to the house.

Breihtner has always dreamed of having a retail space since the long distances that he has to travel to make a sale many times leaves him with little time to spend with his children, sit with them to see how they are progressing, help them with their homework, or just to share a friendly conversation. For this reason, he has decided to have a store and the quickest way to do this is to work, and work very hard. For this reason, he wants to ask for a loan to purchase merchandise, basically lotions and footwear.

loans.use: to purchase lotions and footwear to generate more income that will allow him to open a retail space and be closer to his three children.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie  is 38 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with three children. 

Rosalie  has an internet cafe that prints photos. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan to buy printing materials to increase her sales. Rosalie  has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. 

In the future, Rosalie  hopes to explore a new business for another source of income to sustain the studies of her children.

loans.use: to buy printing materials to increase her sales.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 31 years of age and from Mansabay Bajo, lopez Jaena. She and her partner have 3 school-age kids. 

This year, 2014, she joined Paglaum MPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the co-op. From her desire to help the family, she engaged in a retail business, displaying bleaching liquid in front of her house along the highway. Her source of income has existed for 2 years now. Maricel thought of expanding her inventory to cater more customers. Through this, she hopes to increase her income for the benefit of her family. 

Now, she is requesting financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in the amount of PHP 7,000 to purchase more gallons of bleaching liquid. Someday she will be happy that she can support her children's education which is her main priority.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of bleaching liquid to sell

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Hanifah

texts.en:
Hanifah is a single mother of four children. She buys and sells materials for tie and dye clothes. She sells to her customers to earn income to meet the needs of her family. 

She has been struggling with slow cash flow because of limited capital until she got to know about UGAFODE through a friend. She wants the loan to buy in bulk since, in that way, she will be able to save on transport and still access more clothing. This will increase her profit and income. 

She is hard working and looks forward to upholding the partnership.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials to sell.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 69 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children now at adult age. 

Nena has been engaged in goat raising and coconut production activities for 15 years already. She earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing a second-hand, single motorcycle for service use only. 
Nena has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. 

In the future, Nena hopes to expand her goat raising business.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand, single motorcycle for service use.

loans.name: Rhona

texts.en:
Rhona is a 39 year old, married woman and a mother of four children from Iloilo, Philippines. She earns a living through her retail business selling plasticware and household or kitchen utensils.

Rhona has been in the business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of her income.

Rhona is asking for a loan to buy more plasticware. With this, she will be able to improve her stock thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. 

Rhona hopes to make her business more stable and profitable. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more plasticware.

loans.name: Floride

texts.en: Florida is 43 years old and is married with eight children aged between 18 and three years, seven of whom go to school. She sells clothes for a living and has been in this business for the past 10 years. With the loan she has applied for, she would like to buy more shorts and shirts to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more shorts and shirts to sell

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi sells fish and has been in this business for five years now. She is 55 years old, married, and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with seven children. 

This is her third loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and she will use the loan to buy more stock of fish to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

She has paid her previous loans successfully, and her future hopes are to grow her business, be successful, and have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Ceciliah

texts.en:
Ceciliah is a middle aged, dairy farmer who hails from Sengera, a remote village in Kenyenya, Kenya. This lady who has now become a passionate crusader and practical dairy farmer who went into farming early, when their area was still in the dark about modern ways of profitable dairy farming. 

For the past five years she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been milk and some variety of crops she plants. Proceeds from dairy farming have always not been enough to support her two children. Ceciliah loves to take care of her dairy animals and has even nicknamed one of them “Birir,” which makes her a very proud farmer. 

Ceciliah is seeking a loan to buy an additional dairy cow so that she can fully utilize the space in her farm and so that she can seize the opportunity for the ready market for milk, that is in her village. Through increased profits Ceciliah will be able to comfortably provide for her children and will also be able to secure a future for her eventual grandchildren. Ceciliah is confident that if you invest in her, she will be able to turn around her life; and with the accumulated profits, she will be able to open a large milk shop that will sell to both wholesalers and retailers. 

Ceciliah is patiently waiting for your kindness

loans.use: to buy an exotic dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motor oil, tires and pay for vulcanizing.

loans.name: Hena

texts.en:
Hena is a 53-year-old married woman from Iloilo, Philippines. She earns a living through retail sales of ready to wear clothes. Hena has been in the business for more than 10 years now. Her husband earns a supplemental income through his farming business.

Hena needs more capital for her business. She is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell. With this, she will be able to improve her stock thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed has a carpentry business in Mombasa town and has been in the business for 14 years now. He is 35 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 3 children. 

He will use this loan to buy more stock of timber for use in his carpentry business. He will also buy painting brushes and nails. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy timber, nails and painting brushes.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna owns and operates a variety store business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for twenty years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income by focusing on rice selling, which she buys per sack.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting an amount of PHP 50,000 to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

In the future, Myrna desires to become more succesful both in business and life. She hopes that her family will always be healthy and happy. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Mealii

texts.en:
Mealii is married with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor running water. 

She has a business selling cashew nuts at the market to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to have a rental house in the near future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Zacharie

texts.en:
Zacharie is 36 years old. He is married with 2 children aged five and three years old. One of them goes to school. 

He is an artist and has been running a business for 9 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more ink, papers and colors so he can design the crafts that he sells. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more ink, papers and colors to design his crafts.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanasiti operates a stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
UGAFODE's structure of repayments for agricultural loans has been favorable for the rural farmers, especially the cattle keepers. These borrowers buy cows, especially the baby ones, that they feed and when they have fattened, they sell them. 

Stephen belongs in this category, and could not miss the opportunity of being funded given that he was in dire need for capital to expand the business.

He is hardworking and grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo is a 28-year-old father of a one-year-old son. He and his family are from Carles, Iloilo. For four years now, Leo has worked driving passengers using his motorcycle. This is his livelihood to provide for his family. 

Leo is requesting a loan to buy tires and fuel so he can continue to drive for a long time and be more productive. He will use the income from his loan for food and milk for his baby. In the future, Leo hopes to be able to have other business opportunities.

loans.use: to buy tires and fuel

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is 36 years old and married with three children aged between 18 and 14 years old, all of whom go to school. She has been running a mini market  for 10 years. With the loan she has requested, she would like to buy more water, juice, bread and soda to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 37 years old, married, and together with his spouse blessed with 3 children. He has a motorcycle transport business and has been in this business for 8 years. 

He will be using this loan to buy another motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his second loan term from VisionFund Kenya. In the future he hopes to grow his business, be successful, make more income, and have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Safa

texts.en: Safa is 46 years old, married, and has a son. Safa has more than 25 years of experience in the field of agriculture and he mostly grows wheat. In addition, he is involved in animal husbandry. His wife helps him to run the business. Safa sows wheat twice a year. He is now ready for the second planting season but he doesn't have enough money to buy mineral fertilizers and wheat seeds. He is taking a loan of 1,200 AZN  to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Lito

texts.en: Lito is 57 years old and has two children. His wife is engaged in a retail business that is a sari-sari store. With his desire to help his wife uplift their living conditions, Lito operates a motorcycle for passengers' transportation. His earnings from operating the transportation business are usually used to provide for the family's basic daily needs. Lito wishes to expand his wife's business for additional income. He is operating his motorcycle early in the morning to ensure that he transports more passengers and earns enough profit. Lito is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to repaint his motorcycle and invest in the sari-sari store business. He hopes that someday he will obtain his wish.

loans.use: to repaint his motorcycle and invest in a sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
A 44-year-old married woman, Gina earns a living through her fishing business. She earns additional income through her food-vending business. Gina works hard to support her husband in their business.

As of now, she is requesting a loan to buy plywood, nails, a hull, paint, adhesive, and fishing nets. Through this, she and her husband will be able to improve their daily catch which they can sell in the market for a good price.

Gina dreams of improving their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy plywood, nails, a hull, paint, adhesive, and fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a boat propeller, engine, fishing nets, paint, adhesives and a universal joint

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank is 27 years old. He is not married. He sells spare parts in a business for 4 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more spare parts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en: Jean Bosco is 24 years old and married with a four-month-old baby. He sells domestic animals and has been in this business for three years. With the loan he has requested, he would like to buy more goats and sheep to sell. The profits will be used to reinvest in the business and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more goats and sheep to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover medical expenses

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 44 years old and a resident of Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and has five children. The oldest is 22, while the youngest is 10. She engages in fishing. She sells fresh fish and this serves as her main source of income. Her husband is a fisherman. She is asking for a loan to buy materials for boat renovation like plywood, nails and epoxy glue. This will help improve her catch and eventually increase her daily earnings. 

Jenny would like to expand her fishing business to provide her children with quality education for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy materials for boat renovation like plywood, nails and epoxy glue.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy welding tools, body lotion, and perfume

loans.name: Floride

texts.en:
Floride is 55 years old and married with four children between the ages of 23 and 30. One of her children goes to school. For the past four years, Floride has been selling vegetables.

Floride is requesting a loan to buy more tomatoes, carrots, and cabbage to sell. She will use the profit from her loan to reinvest in her business and provide for her family’s welfare.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, carrots, and cabbage to sell

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en: Wilberforce is a young man who has had a passion for electronics since childhood. He repairs phones to earn some income. Since he did not have enough funds to buy phones, he started by buying and selling phone accessories because the cost was low, and then he was able to get a few cheap phones. He would like a loan to buy more phones which are in high demand by many people. And he is sure he will make a profit because the market is there. He is focused and hard-working.

loans.use: To buy phones and phone accessories

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is 19 years old. She is single and lives with her parents. She is a very ambitious young woman. 

Fotima is going to start a new café business. She will open a café in a local school in her village. She will sell chocolate, cakes, pies, hamburgers, etc.

Fotima will manage alone. Her parents are busy with farming. She is a very hard-working woman and she hopes her business will go well. Fotima is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy food items for organizing her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy food items for increasing working capital

loans.name: Chanthan

texts.en: Chanthan is a 19-year-old student at a university. He lives with his parents in Tbong Khmum province of Cambodia. Due to a lack of financial support, Chanthan would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fees. This loan will help him graduate. In the future, he wants to find a good job and have a house in the city.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees

loans.name: Carina

texts.en: Carina is happy to share that her business is managing well and still gaining profits. She and her husband have the eagerness to manage the business because she wants to achieve her dream. At present, she wants to save some of her earnings for the education of their children. Carina sells a variety of motorcycle parts and accessories in the market. She wanted to expand the items she sells to her customers by selling more tools and accessories for vehicles. To do this, Carina is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy tires, rims and other accessories for vehicles. She hopes to earn a higher income for the education of her children and for achieving her dreams too.

loans.use: to buy tires, rims and other accessories for vehicles.

loans.name: Velonique

texts.en:
Velonique, age 55, is married and has five children between the ages of 10 and 33, all of whom go to school. She has been farming for 25 years. With this loan form Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for maize production. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for maize production.

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en: Pascasie is 30 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 10 and 2 years, 3 of whom go to school. She has a mini-market and has been running the business for 6 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more soda, milk, juice and bread for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more soda, milk, juice and bread for sale.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is 55 years old.  She is married with 2 children aged between 20 and 26, all of whom go to school. She has been farming for 15 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for maize production. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for maize production.

loans.name: Benoni

texts.en:
Benoni lives in an area where cattle rearing is the major economic activity. There are so many cows that young bulls are sold when they are born so that there is no strife among them in the kraals.

These always sell cheaply. Since Benoni is a business man, he seizes the opportunity to buy them, feed them for 3 to 6 months and then sell them to the butchers at a good price. With the loan he will buy many of them, which will increase his sales and profit. He is grateful for the financial services extended to his community.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is 29 years old and from Carles, Iloilo. He is married and has four children. His eldest is nine and the youngest is one. For seven years now, Ramil has been working in the buying and selling of fresh fish and seahorses. Seahorses are usually dried and sold to be used for Chinese medicine. He usually buys and sells using his motorcycle. 

Ramil is asking for a loan to buy fresh fish and seahorses and to pay for a sidecar for his motorcycle. He hopes that with a loan he can improve his profitability and he can more easily move around with a sidecar for his motorcycle. In the future, Ramil hopes to expand his business and send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and seahorses and to pay for a sidecar for his motorcycle

loans.name: Dorocelle

texts.en:
Dorocella is 52 years. She is married and has four children between the ages of 9 and 28, all of whom go to school. Dorocella has been farming for 25 years. With this loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for maize production. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for maize production.

loans.name: Gerardine

texts.en:
Gerardine, aged 32 years, is married with 3 children aged between 3 and 9, 2 of whom go to school. She has been farming for 12 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for maize production.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for maize production.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a widower who lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and water. For the past three years, she has operated an agricultural selling business, selling produce from home to her neighbors and passersby. Christine faces a major challenge of disease outbreak leading to losses. She dreams of expanding her business to generate more income. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, Christine wants to purchase more seedlings and pesticides. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and pesticides.

loans.name: Matunda

texts.en:
Matunda is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Tehmine

texts.en:
Tehmine lives with her big family in Vedi town in the Ararat region. She is 35 years old and a mother of three children. Her two daughters attend school and her son is 6 years old. Tehmine works as a saleswoman in a local store and her husband works at a stone processing company. Together with her work, Tehmine and her parents-in-law are also engaged in farming. They keep three cows and a calf and also cultivate eggplant. The family is hard working, but Tehmine and her husband barely cover all their family's needs, sometimes with great effort and difficulty.

This loan of US $1500 is very important for Tehmine to purchase fertilizer and grass as forage for feeding her livestock. The family rely on lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and grass as forage for feeding her livestock

loans.name: Onua Do Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Onua Do and are four in number. They are inspired to have a better and higher quality life, not only for themselves, but for their families. They sell bread, food supplements, maize, beans, charcoal, groceries, cassava, plantains and yams. 

One of the members is Margaret, who is happy to be part of the group. She and her partners take advantage of the opportunity to work and generate their own earnings. Margaret works selling food supplements (medicine) and baking bread. She is seeking this loan to purchase flour, sugar, baking powder, etc. to bake bread and sell it to customers. She will also buy food supplements and sell them to customers.

Margaret and the other members are seeking this loan to increase their stock and they will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, baking powder, etc. to bake bread and sell it to customers.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 37 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children, 3 of whom are currently in school. For the past 15 years, Moses has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells drinks. 

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 4,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more beer, soda and spirits for sale, and will help Moses to generate greater profits and pay fees for his children. Moses hopes that in the future he will be able to own a bigger dancing club. 

Moses is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moses who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more beer, soda and spirits for sale.

loans.name: Wilmar

texts.en:
Wilmar is a 29-year-old man from the town of Carles, Iloilo. He is married with three children, ages one to four. For six years now, he has been engaged in a sari-sari store business and buying and selling crabs for a living. He is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy crabs and merchandise such as condiments, sugar, coffee, toiletries, canned goods and noodles. He is confident that with the improvement of the variety of his merchandise, he can attract more customers, thus improving his sales.

In the future, he hopes to successfully send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy crabs and merchandise such as condiments, sugar, coffee, toiletries, canned goods and noodles

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a married woman and a mother of six children from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for almost 30 years now. Fishing is their main source of income.

Violeta is asking for a loan to buy a boat propeller, nails, an engine, fishing nets, fishing weights and ropes. This loan will allow Violeta and her husband improve their fishing venture and augment their income.
 
In the future, Violeta hopes to make her business a success. She wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy a boat propeller, nails, an engine, fishing nets, fishing weights and ropes

loans.name: Lo Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mai, born in 1967, is a Thai ethnic person. She is currently living with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter) in Mai Son district, Son La province. She joined the program in 2010 and is one of the exemplary members of M7-MFI Mai Son branch.

Her family's main source of income comes from farming and livestock breeding. They work hard, but the income is just enough to cover the simple meals they eat every day. It is not enough for her children's education costs. For the new school year, she needs an amount of money to pay for all these costs.

She expects to use the loan to help cover school expenses for her children. Her children will learn knowledge and can support their parents in economic activities.

loans.use: to cover school expenses for children

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: From Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Pacita earns a living through her computer games. She sees to having her computer units in good condition to continuously provide services. For her capital needs, Paglaum MPC has stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds in business with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she applied for a loan to purchase additional computer accessories and wires. She deeply wishes to earn well each day to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional computer accessories and wires

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
José de 64 años de edad, logro estudiar hasta tercer grado, ya que al mismo tiempo de estudiar tambien tenia que ayudarle a su padres con la milpa de la casa, hoy en dia ya tiene bastante tiempo de experiencia en la siembra de maiz y frijol, se caso y ha procreado cuatro hijos de las edades de 42, 38, 36, 29 años de edad, su esposa se dedica a cuidar la casa y unos animalitos que tiene, gallinas y patos.

José lleva 54 años de experiencia en eso, esto lo aprendio de su padre quien se dedicaba a ser sobador y carpintero dice que cuando alguien lo busca a realizar cualquiera de estos trabajos él lo hace con todo gusto, ya que lo que su padre le enseño él lo aprendio a valorar.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar fertlizantes como sulfato, formula y una bomba que necesita para seguir abonando la milpa. De esta manera,  se vera beneficiado ya que es necesario para él tener todo ese tipo de materiales para su trabajo, sus deseos son siempre con la fé puesta en Dios que todo lo que siembre tenga buenos resultados para él y para su familia, ya que de todo lo que él cosecha es con lo que ellos pasan el año, un deseo en especial que él tiene es que su hijo se dedique a sobar.
texts.en:
José, 64 years old, managed to study up to the third grade, since at the same time he had to help his parents with the field in their home. He now has a long experience in growing maize and beans, is married and has raised four children who are now 42, 38, 36 and 29 years old. His wife takes care of the house and some animals, chickens and ducks.

José has 54 years of experience in this. He learned this from his father, who made a living as a bonesetter and carpenter. He says that when someone looked for him in order to perform any of these jobs, he did them gladly since his father taught him to value them.

The loan that he is now requesting is meant to buy fertilisers, such as sulphate, formula and a pump that he needs to continue enriching the field. In this manner, he will be benefitted since it is necessary to keep all these types of materials for his work. His wishes are always with faith in God, looking for good results for him and his family, since all that he harvests is used to sustain them for a year. A special wish he has is for his son to become a bonesetter.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers such as sulphate, formula and a pump that he needs to continue enriching the field.

loans.name: Lety Antonia

texts.es: Lety tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos de 22 años, 18 años, 16 años y 5 años de edad. Lety trabaja en un vivero desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como junto a su  esposo llevan el sustento a su hogar y mantienen la economía de su familia. Lety desea  construir un muro de contención en su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra del material necesario como: ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro, grava, y pago de mano de obra para la construcción del muro. Confía que con los ingresos que percibe de su trabajo logrará cancelar el crédito en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Lety is 37 years old and lives in an own house together with her husband and their 4 children, who are 22, 18, 16 and 5 years old. Lety has been working in a tree nursery for a long time, and in this manner together with her husband they support their home and their family's economy.

Lety wishes to build a retaining wall in their home, and so is requesting a loan to FUSAI which will be used to invest in the purchase of the necessary material, such as: bricks, cement, sand, iron, gravel, and to pay the necessary labour for the construction of the wall. She is confident that with the income from her work she will be able to pay the loan in the established time.

loans.use: to buy: bricks, cement, sand, iron, gravel and to pay the necessary labour for the construction of a retaining wall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood in order to change the roof of her house and to buy dirt to have adobe made.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Group

texts.en:
Lili, age about 29, is an active and head-strong woman of a remotely located village named Mohara of Nuapada district of Odisha, India, one of the drought-prone regions of India. She lives with her husband, one son and one daughter. 

Eighty percent people of this area depend upon paddy cultivation. Rain water is the only source for the cultivation. If it fails, then the people suffer a lot for their livelihood. So gradually people of this area are adopting alternative sources of income for a secure livelihood. 

Lili is one of them. Apart from cultivation, for the last five years, Lili has been doing a tent house business (renting bowls, tent, cloth boundary wall, etc. for various functions) with the help of her husband. She initially started this business with limited items like bowls, chairs, tarpaulin, etc. From her small income she is gradually adding new items to her business. She is earning a monthly income of INR 4,000. With these limited earnings, it is very difficult on her part to manage her household expenses, the educational expenses of her children and business investment. So for the development of her business, she and 11 members of her village have formed a SHG named Maa Santoshi. Her portion of the loan is 16,000 INR from Mahashakti Foundation. 

Considering the demand of the people, with the present loan Lili has decided to purchase a sound system, some more chairs, bowls, a water tank, mats, pillows etc. She hopes this will help her to generate a little additional income to meet her immediate requirements like providing better education to her children. 

She has a long-term vision to construct a go-down to keep the tent house materials with safety and to build a good house for her family.

Out of the other 11 members of the group, one member is running a general store, four members are doing cotton cultivation and six members are doing paddy cultivation.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of a sound system, chairs, bowls, water tank, mats, pillows etc.

loans.name: Ana Lidia

texts.es: Ana de 53 años de edad, se dedica desde hace 12 años a la venta y elaboración de quesadillas y pan de maíz, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa, pero también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias, Ana vive en casa propia con su esposo que es agricultor y su hija, ella está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de maíz, harina, azúcar, leche, moldes, etc. para continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, of 53 years of age, has worked for the last 12 years making and selling quesadillas and corn bread. Her business is located at her place of residence, but she also sells her products on the streets in different neighborhoods. 

Ana lives in her own house along with her husband, who is a farmer, and her daughter. She is requesting this loan to buy corn, flour, sugar, milk, molds, etc. to continue with her work and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, flour, sugar, mild, molds, etc.

loans.name: José Tomas

texts.es:
José de 57 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador, trabaja en un taller de estructuras metálicas desde hace más de treinta años, está casado por segunda vez  y no tiene hijos, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar lo cual depende directamente de él, José solo estudió hasta cuarto grado ya que su familia no lo envió a estudiar  por motivos de la guerra, además de eso que su familia era de bajos recursos económicos.

José se dedica al trabajo de estructuras metálicas, lo aprendió por su padre el cual le enseñó poco a poco, él trabaja todos los días y nadie más se involucra en el trabajo.

 El crédito lo necesita para comprar repuestos para el vehículo  con el que se transporta de un lugar a otro.

Su sueño es trabajar fuertemente para tener un ahorro con el cual sobrevivir cuando ya no pueda trabajar.
texts.en:
José is 57 years old, is a very hardworking man, has worked in a metal workshop for more than thirty years, is married for the second time and doesn't have any children. His wife dedicates herself to domestic tasks and his household depends directly on him. José only studied up to the fourth grade as his family didn't send him to study because of the war. His family also had few financial resources.

José makes a living in metalwork. He learned this from his father, who taught him little by little. He works every day and no one else is involved in his work.

He needs the loan to buy replacement parts for the vehicle he uses to transport himself from one place to another.

His dream is to work hard to have a savings that he can survive on when he can't work anymore.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for the vehicle he uses to transport himself from one place to another

loans.name: Maa Badi Bahalen Group

texts.en:
Kaishalya, the 28-year-old lady standing with raised hand in the photo, is a resident of Badi village of Nuapada district in Odisha, India. She hails from a poor family and resides with her daughter, a son and her husband in a small house. Her son is reading in 6th standard and her daughter has just started her study this year. 

Her main source of income is vegetable cultivation and vending. Kaishalya has two hectors of land. Currently, in one hector of land, she and her husband cultivate vegetables and other produce. They produce vegetables like brinjal, cauliflower, carrot, cabbage, chili, cucumber, papaya, ladies' finger, and onion in her farm. She sells her products in the daily market of the nearest town. Kaishalya earns 5,000 INR per month from this business, which is insufficient to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family, the farming expenses and also the educational expenses of her children. Due to this financial scarcity, Kaishalya is not able fulfilling her dream of constructing a good house. 

When Mahashakti started micro credit activity in her village, she decided to take a loan for farming the rest of the land. For this she motivated eight other women of her village, formed a Self-Help Group named Maa Badi Bahalen and availed a loan of 12,000 INR. From this loan amount she wants to purchase fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for expansion of her farming to another hector. She is also planning to purchase a diesel water pump for smooth water management. She expects a good return from her business by expanding her cultivation. Kaishalya now feels that she could fulfill her dreams of construction of a pucca house and give better education to her children. 

The other eight members of this group are doing vegetable cultivation and milk business.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for expansion of her farming to another hector.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, 34, is married and has four children between 13 and 5 years old. All of them go to school. 

She has a shop and has been working in her business for six years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, salts and soap for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salts and soap for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural products and pay workers for her rice crops.

loans.name: Aline

texts.en:
Aline is 32 years old. She is married and has two children between 5 and 3 years, and one of them goes to school. 

She sells food and has been running her business for eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, sorghum and maize for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more beans, sorghum and maize for sale.

loans.name: Tomas Jr.

texts.en:
Tomas Jr. is from Iloilo, Philippines. He is a married man and a father of three children. He earns an income through his sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in his place. 

Tomas Jr. is asking for a loan to buy chips, cooking oil, coffee, canned goods, seasoning, and toiletries. Through this loan, he will be able to improve the inventory of his store. 

In the future, Tomas Jr. hopes to expand his store so that it will generate more income necessary for their daily needs, like daily consumption and to pay their bills.

loans.use: to buy chips, cooking oil, coffee, canned goods, seasoning, and toiletries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, brick, sand, gravel, iron, and sheeting; and to pay labor costs for the construction of a room.

loans.name: Mwaro

texts.en:
Mwaro, age 28 years, is a married woman with one child. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwaro operates a vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to buy green vegetables, fruits and coconuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy green vegetables, fruits and coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Jairo Andres

texts.es:
Jairo es un productor agropecuario que no olvida sus raíces de campesino, tiene un terreno donde cultiva pero adicionalmente ejerce las labores de mantenimientos agropecuarios, razón que lo lleva a solicitar un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de una guadañadora y una motosierra por un valor de 2 mil dólares aproximadamente. 
Realiza este trabajo para darle a su familia el mejor beneficio posible tanto a su pareja (ver foto) como a su hija de 7 años y para ello trabaja 15 o 16 horas diarias matándose solo por esas dos mujeres que significan todo para él.
texts.en:
Jairo is a farmer who has not forgotten his rural heritage.  He has a plot of land that he cultivates, but he also works doing farm maintenance, which is why he is requesting a loan. He will invest it in purchasing a mower and a chain saw, valued at approximately two thousand dollars.

He does this work in order to provide the best possible income for his family, which is composed of his wife, who is seen in the photo, and his 7-year-old daughter.  That is why he kills himself working 15 to 16 hours a day--only for these two women, who mean everything to him.

loans.use: to purchase a mower and a chainsaw in order to carry out farm maintenance work.

loans.name: María Ana De Jesús

texts.es:
María de 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene cinco hijos, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, de sus hijos solo tres viven con ellos ya que los mayores ya se acompañaron, sus hijos pequeños estudian cuarto y tercer grado, María solamente estudió hasta tercer grado porque le quedaba muy lejos la escuela y también por motivos de la guerra.
María se dedica a la crianza de ganado, esta actividad la aprendió  de su mamá que hacía la misma actividad, ella trabaja todos los días, su trabajo lo realiza a poca distancia de su casa y su esposo le ayuda con esa actividad.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar una vaca  y también para comprar insumos agrícolas.
Sus sueños son que sus hijos estudien para que puedan lograr lo que ella no pudo hacer, también quiere mejorar su vivienda y ampliar su negocio de ganadería.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old, is married and has five children. Her husband works in agriculture. Only three of their children live with them, since the older ones are already in relationships. Her youngest children are studying in the fourth and third grades. María only studied up to the third grade because the school was very far away and also because of the war.

María makes a living by raising cattle. She learned this business from her mom, who did the same work. She works every day, does her work a short distance from her house, and her husband helps her with this work.

She needs the loan to buy a cow and also to buy agricultural supplies.

Her dreams are that her children study so they will be able to achieve what she could not. She also wants to improve her home and expand her cattle-raising business.

loans.use: to buy a cow and also to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Catarina de 58 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado debido a la falta de recursos económicos y por falta de un centro de estudios que estuviera cerca de donde ella vivía, está soltera y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales dos están acompañados, dos solteros y solo el menor estudia en la escuela. 


Catarina se dedica a los oficios domésticos, sus ingresos dependen de la ayuda de sus hijos, anteriormente ella elaboraba  pan y tamales para salir a vender de casa en casa en la comunidad.

Ella necesita el crédito para pagar una deuda que tiene con un familiar y con el resto pagará la hechura de una ventana de su casa.

Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda, pretende agregar otra habitación porque su familia va creciendo y es necesario más espacio, espera que su hijo siga estudiando y se prepare.
texts.en: 58-year-old Catarina studied through the second grade due to a lack of economic resources and the lack of a school near her home. She is single and has 4 children, of which 2 are marries, 2 are single, and 1 is studying in the school. Catarina works at home. Her income depends of the help of her children. In the past, she made bread and tamales to sell from house-to-house in her community. She needs the loan in order to pay a debt that she owes to a family member and pay for a new window with the rest. Her dream is to renovate her home and add another bedroom since her family is growing and more space is necessary. She hopes that her son continues studying and preparing himself.

loans.use: to pay a debt to a family member and pay for a new window with the rest.

loans.name: Noyaa Group

texts.en:
Simon has been a member of Noyaa since the establishment of the group and has been performing very well. The members are two who are into the sale of slippers and groundnut cake.

Simon is the group representative. He is 62 years old, married and has one child. He works selling slippers. He plans to use his loan to buy more slippers, which he will sell at the market and in the local area.

Simon will use his profits to increase his savings level with ID-Ghana, and to increase his working capital.

loans.use: to buy more slippers, which he will sell at the market and in the local area.

loans.name: Beeri Yem

texts.es: Beeri tiene 29 años de edad y habita junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 3 años de edad. Ella trabaja en una institución cercana a su localidad lo cual le permite apoyar en la economía del hogar. Berri desea construir un muro de retención por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar los materiales necesarios como: arena, piedra, cemento, grava, etc. Además, pagará la mano de obra para la construcción del muro.
texts.en:
Beeri is 29 years old and lives with her life's companion and her 3-year-old son. She works in an institution near her locality, allowing her to contribute to the household economy.

Beeri wishes to construct a vital retention wall and to do so, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to purchase the necessary materials, such as sand, stone, cement, gravel, etc. In addition, she will also pay the laborers who construct the wall.

loans.use: buy sand, stone, cement, gravel, etc., and pay the laborers to build a retention wall.

loans.name: Maa Mangala Shg Group

texts.en:
Basanti, the lady seated with her hand raised, is a 40-year-old widowed woman. She has four children who go to school. She runs a grocery store selling assorted items. She wants this loan to purchase goods in large quantities from wholesale shops in Nayagarh market to attract more customers in her village. Basanti is involved in business to alleviate the poverty levels in her family and to be economically empowered.

Basanti works from home and has been operating her business for nine years. She plans to expand her grocery store into a wholesale shop and to buy a secondhand vehicle for her family when she generates enough profits. Since she started accessing loans, she has seen herself making more profits. She hopes the training in business management (short-term training for small businesses) she received from People’s Forum will help her achieve her goals. As a woman, she is self-reliant, and she has managed to buy good clothes for her children.

Other members of this Maa Mangala Self-Help Group are engaged in different activities such as vegetable selling, flower and fruit selling, etc. All are happy with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items in large quantities from wholesale shops.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 23-year-old young man who lives with his parents for now. He is running his own tea house. He has rented a small space where he established his business. 

On his own, he was able to build a two-room house. Now, with the help of this loan, Hasan will be able to fulfill his dream. He plans to start to make repairs there and marry his girlfriend.

loans.use: to start repair work at his small house.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 34 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 3 and 1, who do not yet go to school. She sells fruits. She works with her husband, and they have been running the business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fruits for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for sale.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel  tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, el primer hijo que el tiene ya tiene familia separada y a sus tres últimos hijos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela que les queda cerca de la comunidad, los hijos de Miguel se han convertido en el motivo de la lucha de trabajar cada día para brindarles un futuro mejor y una mejor condición de vida.
	
Durante 20 años ha venido trabajando con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación en el trabajo de la venta de leña en su casa de habitación ubicado en su comunidad, también teniendo una segunda actividad como agricultor en su comunidad. 

Los fines con que el desea realizar un préstamo, es en la compra de leña para luego su respectiva venta en los alrededores de su comunidad ya que por medio de esta actividad el puede tener un ingreso económico para poder sostener a su familia y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. 

Una de las más grandes aspiraciones de Miguel es poder vender sus productos de leña en su comunidad para que las personas conozcan del trabajo que el y sus hijos realizan, he dar estudios a sus hijos para que lleguen a profesionales.
texts.en:
Miguel is 47 years old, married and has four children. His eldest son lives on his own with his family, and the other three children are excellent students in the school that they go to near their community. Miguel’s children have become the reason why he fights everyday to give them a better future and better life conditions. 

With a lot of effort and dedication, he has worked for the last 20 years selling wood in his own house. He also has a second activity as a farmer in his community. 

He is requesting this loan to buy wood and then sell it in the surroundings of his community. Through this activity he can have the enough incomes to support his family and improve their living conditions.

One of Miguel’s biggest aspirations is to sell his wood products in his community so people can get to know the work that he and his children do, and give them education so they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Grupo Las Emprendedoras De Santa María Group

texts.es:
Guatemala es reconocido por su gente trabajadora con el deseo de superación en la vida que toma las cosas como un reto en la vida para poder llegar a realizar grandes logros, es el caso de Regina que se a tenido que ingeniar en como tener un ingreso económico par su familia ella apenas tiene 28 años de edad casada y tiene 1 hijo por la cual ella realiza actividades artesanales para dar estudio a su hijo para que llegue a profesional en la vida. (Regina es la que se encuentra de 1ra de derecha a izquierda en la fotografía)

El trabajo que ella realiza en su comunidad donde vive es la venta y producción de productos artesanales ya que es una actividad que genera una ganancia económica para el sustento  de su familia y mejorar las condiciones de vida. La segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de refacciones en su comunidad pues ella lo hace para tener un ingreso extra del trabajo que realiza.

Regina es una persona reconocida en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se decidieron a unirse a Regina para realizar todo tipo de artesanías y solo así mejorar las condiciones de vida de ellas e tener ingresos económicos para el beneficio de sus familias. 

El uso respectivo que ella dará el préstamo que  está realizando es para la compra de productos artesanales para luego venderlas en su comunidad y en todos sus alrededores, las metas de Regina en la vida es la construcción de su casa para que ella y su familia tengan una condición de vida adecuada en un futuro no muy lejano.
texts.en:
Guatemala is known for it's hard-working people who want to get ahead in life. They take everything as a challenge so that they can come to produce great achievements. This is the case for Regina who had to devise a way to have an economic income for her family. She is only 28, married and has one child. She does handicraft work so she can provide her child education so that he becomes a professional in life. (Regina is the first to the right in the photo).

The business that she does in the community where she lives is the sale and production of handcrafted products. It is this activity that produces an economic gain that sustains her family and improves their living conditions. The second activity that she does is the sale of car parts in her community as it provides an extra income for the work she does.

Regina is a well-known person in her community and because of that a group of women decided to join together with Regina to produce all kinds of handicrafts. Doing this they can improve their living conditions and have economic income for the benefit of their families.

Regina will use the loan to buy handcrafted products to later sell in her community and the surroundings. Regina's goals in life are to build a house for her and her family and see that her family has adequate living conditions in the not too distant future.

loans.use: to buy handcrafted products.

loans.name: Jesus Alonso

texts.es:
Jesús un hombre de 54 años de edad que durante 10 años trabajo como ayudante de ebanistería y siempre había querido independizarse pero no encontraba la forma puesto que los créditos que ponían a su disposición era de los famoso “paga diarios” y había que pagar una cuota de interés muy alta. 
Gracias a la inclusión de la corporación Interactuar en su vida ve después de un largo periodo de tiempo la posibilidad de iniciar su negocio.
Solicita un crédito el cual invertirá en la maquinaría (ver foto) y con el espera hacer bellas piezas artesanales y los pedidos que le lleguen. 
Los principales beneficiados serán sus vecinos puesto que contaran con una persona de confianza para realizar sus acabados en madera y su familia conformada por su esposa y tres hijos quienes tendrán mejores ingresos aspirando a ser una empresa muy reconocida y muy solicitada en la ciudad.
texts.en: Jesús is a 54-year-old man who has worked as a carpenter's assistant for 10 years. He has also wanted to become independent, but he never had the means to do so since the loans available were the famous daily payment ones and he had to pay a high interest rate. Thanks to the arrival of Interactuar Corporation in his life, he can see the possibility of starting his business after a long time. He is applying for a loan to invest it in machinery (see picture) with the dream of making beautiful artisan furniture and any requests that come. The principle beneficiaries will be his neighbors since they will be able to count on a trustworthy person to make wood things and his family consisting of his wife and 3 children who will have a better income. He hopes to make a well-known business that is often sought after in the city.

loans.use: to buy the machines (see picture) to start his own carpentry business in the hopes of improving his home's economic situation.

loans.name: Samuel Alejandro

texts.es:
Samuel un sonriente y alegre panadero de 25 años de edad el cual le ha dedicado 10 años de su vida a su profesión y se siente realmente feliz de hacerlo pues es lo que lo apasionada, trabaja desde las 3 de la madrugada para tener pan fresco hasta horas de la noche todo por darle a su hija un buen bienestar ya que a su edad de 7 meses necesita mucho cuidado y el trata de brindarle todo para que crezca sana. 
Samuel quiere mejorar su negocio, ha asistido a cursos para hacer nuevas preparaciones y sorprender a sus clientes por dicha razón solicita un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de materia prima como harina, aceite, sal, azúcar, papillas de fruta, y demás suministros que necesita para realizar sus preparaciones. 
Su sueño es tener la panadería líder que se destaque por su calidad, precio y sabor generando buenos ingresos para el bienestar de todos aquellos que depende de él.
texts.en:
Samuel, a smiling and happy 25-year-old baker, has dedicated 10 years of his life to his profession and he really feels happy doing so because it's what he is passionate about. He works from 3 o'clock in the morning to have fresh bread until the night time, all to give his daughter a good quality of life. At seven months of age she needs a lot of care and he tries to provide her with everything so she can grow up healthy.

Samuel wants to improve his business, has attended courses on making new products, and wants to surprise his customers. For this reason he is asking for a loan to invest in buying raw material like flour, oil, salt, sugar, fruit pastes, and other supplies that he needs to make his products. 

His dream is to have the leading bakery known for its quality, price and flavor, generating good earnings for the well being of all who depend on him.

loans.use: to buy raw material to make new products he learned in a course, seeking to surprise his customers

loans.name: Gem

texts.en:
Gem is 36 years old and lives with his 7-year-old son in Carles, Iloilo. For seven years now, he has been engaged in buying and selling fish, especially the big ones like tuna. He usually uses his motorcycle and side car to sell fish. He is asking for a loan as additional capital to buy more fish.

With additional funds, he will be able to supply more fish to his customers and earn a better living for his son. He dreams of sending his son to school and of expanding his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with five children, ages 4-19. She and her family live in Carles, Iloilo. She and her husband find their livelihood in fishing. This started a year ago. In addition to that, she also owns a sari-sari (variety) store business. 

She would like to request a loan to buy fishing nets, an engine, and merchandise such as canned goods, detergent, coffee and soft drinks. Gemma hopes that with a loan, she can expand and improve their catch. 

She also dreams of sending all her children to school. Her income will also provide a healthy diet for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, an engine, and merchandise such as canned goods, detergent, coffee, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo is 57 years old and a resident of Iloilo, Philippines. He is married and has nine children. The youngest child is fourteen. He engages in a buy and sell business selling fresh and dried fish, and it serves as his main source of income. He has been engaged in the buy and sell business for more than ten years now. 

Rodolfo is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to have additional capital to buy fresh fish and dried fish. This will help Rodolfo to augment his daily earnings and to provide his family's daily needs. 

In the future, Rodolfo would like to expand his buy and sell business to be able to pay his loan dues, improve his livelihood, and send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and dried fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two fishing nets.

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae is a 35 year old merchant from Iloilo, Philippines. Mae is engaged in a sari-sari or variety store business selling various office supplies to the people in her area. Mae has been in the business for more than two years now. 

Mae is asking for a loan to buy office supplies. With this, she will be able to improve her stocks and sell more to her customers. 

In the future, Mae has hopes of making her business a sustainable one.

loans.use: to buy office supplies.

loans.name: Sadraddin

texts.en:
Sadraddin is 58 years old. He is married to a kind woman and he is raising three children. His eldest son helps him with his business, his daughters are married. 

Sadraddin is a very good, happy, hardworking and purposeful man by nature. As a main source of income for his family, he works with field crop  pomegranate. Sadraddin has worked in the agriculture business since 1980. He grows pomegranates on his own land.

He receives a total income in the amount of 170 (AZN) per month. With an aim to further develop his business, he turned to the Aqroinvest CU for a loan in the amount of 1000 AZN. He will use this money to harvest pomegranates which he plans to sell wholesale, to buy fuel, and employ workers.

loans.use: to harvest pomegranates which he plans to sell wholesale, to buy fuel, and employ workers.

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
