Rhea is a mother of three children ages 2-10. She is from Carles, Ilo-ilo. For a few years now, she has been engaged in buying and selling fresh fish in the community of Carles. This is the way to provide for her children's needs and to help her husband who works as a laborer.

Rhea is requesting a loan to buy more fish from fishermen that she can resell at a profit. This way, she also helps the livelihood of fishermen in her community. 

In the future, she hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en:
Shushanik is from Meghrashen village in the Shirak region. She is a mother of two sons (her elder son is a migrant worker). 

Together with her husband and son, Shushanik runs a farm. On the farm they keep livestock (sheep, calves, cows and hens) and also cultivate wheat, barley and potatoes. Thanks to the number of cattle on the farm, Shushanik sells a lot of milk to dairy-products production factories, and also meat to city butchers. The harvest of her land mainly services the family's needs.

Shushanik will be grateful and sincerely thankful if Kiva lenders help her to have this loan in the amount of USD 3000 which she will use for the purchase  of two calves and pay for the renovation of the barn.

loans.use: to pay for two calves and renovation of the barn.

loans.name: Anibal Ramiro

texts.es: A sus 53 años de edad Ramiro es un señor casado, tiene 5 hijos pero de ellos solo vive con una hija y un nieto y su esposa, el se dedica a trabajar de albañil y también se dedica a l acrianza de pollos desde que era muy joven, el crédito lo necesita para comprar pollos y tenerlos en un corralito, criarlos y venderlos para ayudarse con algo mas de dinero aparte de su trabajo   y asi  darle lo necesario a su hija de 17 años que asiste al colegio y a su nieto de 7 años que asiste a la escuela.
texts.en: At 53 years old, Ramiro is a married man. He has five children but only one daughter and one grandson live with him and his wife. He makes a living working as a stonemason and has also made a living by raising chickens since he was very young. He needs the loan to buy chickens to keep in a small corral so he can raise and sell them to help with a bit more income outside of his job. In this way he will give his 17-year-old daughter who is attending high school and his 7-year-old grandson who is attending elementary school what they need.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 19 years now. 

Elena is asking for a loan to buy plywood, fishing nets, fishing weights, a hull, bamboo and ropes. With these, Elena and her husband will be able to improve their catch thus augmenting their income. Elena has hopes of expanding their fishing business in the future.

loans.use: to buy plywood, fishing nets, fishing weights, a hull, bamboo and ropes

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita, 54 is a married woman and a mother of seven children from Ilo-ilo, Philippines. The youngest child is 17 years old. She engages in fishing and she sells fish.This is the family's main source of income. She has been into fishing for more than 10 years. 

Lolita is asking for a loan to buy nylon rope, an engine, fishing nets and fishing weights. With these, she could now improve her catch and create higher earnings.This is the time she can provide her family with good food and better living condition.

Lolita hopes of expanding her business and making it a success for the college education of her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy nylon rope, an engine, fishing nets and fishing weights

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, cigarettes, etc

loans.name: Binyomo Group

texts.en:
These women are part of the group called Binyomo and they are dedicated to developing their revenue-generating businesses. The women are from the same women’s group in the district. Their main work involves small-scale commerce, soft drinks and smoked fish. 

Grace is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and her children are all grown up. She is a vendor of smoked fish at the central market. She has been in this business for over ten years and enjoys good experience in this domain. 

With her new loan, Grace envisions purchasing four cartons of fish from the fishermen, also buying firewood to smoke the fish and sell it to customers. 

With the profits, she is planning to expand her business and increase her savings with ID-Ghana, also ensure good healthcare and clothing for her family.

loans.use: To purchase four cartons of fish from the fishermen and buy firewood to smoke the fish

loans.name: Gregorio De La Paz

texts.es:
Gregorio de 40 años de edad, padre de 3 hijos quienes ya formaron su propia familia. Actualmente vive con su mamá y su padre pues por circunstancias él se separo de su familia.

 Gregorio se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y también ropa nueva, ademas invierte parte de su capital en compras de yinas, y zapatos de bajo precio. Él se dedica a este oficio desde los 15 años trabajo que realiza junto a su madre.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar mas ropa blusas, pantalones, licras, faldas, camisas entre otras prendas que son muy demandadas por sus clientes y por supuesto las que están de moda.

A futuro Gregorio desea ver su local de ropa en una instalación mas grande, moderna y con facilidades de precio para sus clientes, pues él sabe que la situacion económica de muchas personas es un poco dura y pues busca el bienestar para todos. Ademas esto le generara ingresos continuos a su negocio.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 40 years old and the father of three children who form his own family. At present he lives with his mother and father as he has separated from his family for certain reasons. Gregorio works selling used clothing and also new clothing. Also he has invested part of his money in buying sandals and shoes at low prices. He has been doing this work for 15 years and works together with his mother.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy more clothing: blouses, pants, Lycra clothing, skirts, shirts amongst other clothing that is in great demand by his clients and of course very much in fashion. In the future Gregorio would like to see his clothing business in a larger modern space with good prices for his customers. He knows that the economic situation of many people is a bit tough so he is looking out for the well-being of all. Also this will generate sustained income for his business.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, Lycra clothing, skirts, shirts and other clothing.

loans.name: Alvaro Ramiro

texts.es: Ramiro tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijas de 3 y 7 años de edad que la mayor esta estudiando, el se dedica a la actividad que se le presente por ejemplo pinta casas, trabaja de albañil, en ocasiones  se va de chofer  y también cria pollos  pero el caso en ver la manera de tener un ingreso para darles lo necesario a sus hijas, con el dinero del  crediro crédito Ramiro va a  comprar pollos y va  a rehacer   un galpón, la aspiración de Ramiro es mejorar su negocio y sus ingresos todo para  bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en: Ramiro is 25 years old and lives with his wife and their two daughters aged 3 and 7, the older of whom is in school. He makes a living from odd jobs like painting houses and stonemason work. Sometimes he works as a driver and he also raises chickens, but he needs to find a way to have an income to give his daughters what they need. With the money from the loan, Ramiro is going to buy chickens and renovate a barn. Ramiro's aspiration is to improve his business and his earnings, all for his children's well being.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina  de 53 años de edad, no estudió ningún nivel académico, está casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo es albañil, su primer hijo de 20 años está realizando sus estudios universitarios, su segunda hija se encuentra en la primaria y el último aún no estudia.

Marina trabaja en un restaurante desde hace 4 años con el objetivo de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, su horario de trabajo es de 12:00 MD a 8: PM todos los días.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos para vender pasteles de maíz, enchiladas, chilate, etc. Junto a sus hijas.

Sus sueños son tener fuerza y salud para seguir trabajando y apoyar a sus hijas en este nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Marina, age 53, doesn’t have an academic degree, is married and has three children. Her husband is a construction worker, her eldest child is 20 years old and is currently attending to college, her daughter goes to elementary school and the third child doesn’t go to school yet. 

Marina has worked at a restaurant for the last 4 years with the purpose of helping her husband with the household expenses. Her work schedule is from 12:00 pm to 8:00 pm every day. 

The loan she is requesting is to buy supplies that will allow her to sell corn cake, enchiladas, chilate (a drink made with chili, roast corn and cocoa), etc. along with her daughters.

Her dreams are to be strong and healthy enough to continue with her job, and to support her daughters in this new business.

loans.use: to buy supplies in order to sell corn cake, enchiladas, chilate, etc. along with her daughters.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
Gumercinda tiene 47 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar porque sus padres no podían brindarle las  facilidades, está casada y su esposo es jornalero y en ocasiones trabajaba comprando y vendiendo ganado, tiene 6 hijos, 3 de ellos trabajan y se dedican a diversas actividades productivas, y los tres menores se encuentran estudiando en la escuela.
 
Gumercinda se dedica a trabajar elaborando petates y los tiene  a la venta en su casa, tiene alrededor de 20 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, sus padres le enseñaron porque no tenían otras actividades más que realizar, antes solo se dedicaba a los oficios del hogar. Los petates los hace en su casa no tiene que salir para para trabajar, sus hijas mayores son las que le ayudan en el negocio, y trabajan de 7:00 A.M a 12:00 M.D.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para fertilizar los cultivos que tiene su esposo, comprará abono, sulfato, herbicidas, y también pagará mano de obra que le ayudará a realizar las labores. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos sigan adelante y se superen en la vida.
texts.en:
Gumercinda is 47 years old. She did not have the opportunity to study because her parents were not able to provide her with the means to do so. She is married, and her husband is a day-laborer.  He also works buying and selling livestock occasionally. 

She has 6 children. Three are working and devoting themselves to various productive occupations, while the three younger children are studying in school.

Gumercinda works making woven sleeping mats, which she has for sale in her house. She has been devoting herself to this occupation for about 20 years.  Her parents taught her to do this because there were no other occupations available.  

Before this, she only devoted herself to housekeeping. She makes the sleeping mats in her house and she doesn’t have to go out to work.  Her older daughters help her in the business, working from 7:00 A.M. until Noon.

She needs the loan in order to purchase agricultural supplies to fertilize her husband’s crops. She will purchase fertilizer, sulfate, and herbicide; and she will also pay workers who will help him to carry out his work.

Her dream is that her children may get ahead and be successful in life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies in order to fertilize her husband's crops. She will purchase fertilizer, sulfate, and herbicide; and she will also pay workers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been operating a fishing business with her husband for more than 12 years now. This is their source of income. Grace is asking for a loan from CEVI to buy a fishing boat and fishing nets. With this loan, Grace and her husband will be able to improve their catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Grace hopes to make their fishing business more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat and fishing nets

loans.name: Silvia Araceli

texts.es: Silvia tiene 40 años de edad, ella es divorciada y tiene 4 hijas de 5, 16, 22, y 23 años de edad de la cuales las 3 menores viven con Silvia y están estudiando, Silvia se dedica  desde hace 20 años a atender un local de comidas que es suyo pero que tiene que pagar arriendo por el local, ella necesita el crédito para comprar cuyes y luego venderlos asados, también vende sopa de pollo y otros platos típicos de su tierra, la aspiración de Silvia es mejorar su negocio atraer mas clientela y asi lograr algo mas de ingreso y educar, vestir y alimentar a sus hijas.
texts.en: Silvia is 40 years old, she is divorced and has four daughters ages 5, 16, 22 and 23 of which the three youngest live with her and attend school.  For the past 20 years, Silvia has worked tending to her restaurant that she leases.  She is in need of a loan to purchase guinea pigs that she will later sell grilled.  She also sells chicken soup and other traditional dishes.  Silvia's dream is to improve her business and attract more customers so that she can increase her income in order to educate, clothe and feed her daughters.

loans.use: purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kabale in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past 12 years, Arthur has been working hard to manage his bar, where he sells drinks. 

To help expand his business, Arthur has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more beers, sodas and spirits for sale, and will help Arthur to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. Arthur hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business and earn enough income. 

Arthur is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Arthur who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more beers, sodas and spirits for sale

loans.name: Grorge

texts.en:
Grorge is married and a father of three children. They live in a two-bedroom house in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. He has been involved with Ghape for four years. He has faced so many challenges in life: financial difficulties, sickness and death of family members and loved ones, to name a few.

With this newly requested loan, he will buy planks, firewood, weirs and nails for his workshop. He believes so much in the success of his business because he has been working in the workshop for a long time, the demand for chairs and tables is significant, and people are building houses which he will roof. Furthermore, he is a trained carpenter. The community will benefit from his moderate prices and his goodwill, and he will also provide furniture for their houses.

As for the profit made from this loan, he will use that money for his children's education and medication, and to extend his house both for his family's use and to rent. He prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and because the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy planks, nails and work tools and to pay the workshop rent

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 52 years old. She is married to John and together they have been blessed with two children. The children are in school. Lucy is a farmer, a business she has done for the last 12 years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 7,200.

Lucy has requested a loan of Kshs. 15,000 which she will use to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds to plant.

With the anticipated profits, Lucy will be able to pay school fees for her children, This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya, after successfully repaying her previous loan.

Lucy's hope and dream for the future is to have a blessed life together with her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds to plant

loans.name: Lenny

texts.en:
Lenny is 47 years old. She has operated a sari-sari store for many years now. This business provide for her three children, two of whom are now adults while the youngest is 16 years old. She is asking for a loan to buy canned goods, chips, toiletries, seasonings, sugar and soft drinks. 

Lenny hopes that with her loan she can easily replenish her inventory and better serve her customers.

In the future, she hopes to continue her business and make it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, chips, toiletries, seasonings, sugar and soft drinks

loans.name: Cleta

texts.en:
Cleta is 61 years old. She is from Carles, Iloilo. She is married with six adult children. At her age, she still works hard to earn a living through her Sari-sari store. This business started three years ago and enabled her to make ends meet. She would like to replenish her stock but she has difficulty doing so with her limited funds.

She is asking for a loan to buy rice, soft drinks, canned goods, soy sauce, cooking oil, bath soap and detergent. Cleta hopes that this will pave the way to better sales and more customers buying from her instead of going somewhere else. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and buy more stocks that she has not previously carried.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks, canned goods, soy sauce, cooking oil, bath soap and detergent

loans.name: Jessica Belen

texts.es: Belen es una señora muy positiva, ella vive con su esposo que es chofer y con sus 2 hijos de 3 y 5 años de los cuales el mayor asiste a la escuela, Belen se dedica a la  crianza y comercialización de cuyes, ella tiene un negocio con su madre o sea Belen le vende a su madre los cuyes vivos y para que los ase y los venda preparados, Belen va a invertir el crédito en la compra de cuyes para comercializar en mayor cantidad, de este negocio Belen aspira que crezca cada dia mas y obtener ganancias  con las que pueda aportar a los gastos del hogar y en un futuro quisiera comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
Belen is a very positive woman.  She lives with her husband who is a driver and their two children, ages 3 and 5.  Their eldest son attends school.  Belen works raising and selling guinea pigs.  She is in business with her mother, meaning that Belen sells her mother the live guinea pigs, and her mother grills them and sells them prepared.  

Belen will use this loan to purchase guinea pigs to sell in bulk.  Belen hopes that this business will continue to grow everyday so that she can generate earnings with which to cover her household expenses because in the future she would like to purchase a house.

loans.use: purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Pedro Florencio

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 54 años de edad, estudió hasta 3er grado en la escuela, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar y a atender una tienda, tiene 4 hijos que se encuentran estudiando, además en casa de Pedro vive su hermano.

Pedro se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda que administra con su esposa, hace 7 años solo tenía venta de dulces de atado, con el paso del tiempo amplió su negocio comprando más mercadería y así es como ahora tiene en funcionamiento su tienda, además  de ser comerciante  se dedica a trabajar en la siembra de granos básicos como maíz, frijol y maicillo del cual obtiene otros ingresos y el lugar está a 20 minutos de su casa y se va a pie.

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar más productos para su tienda como frijoles, azúcar, arroz, etc. ya que hay productos que se le están agotando y que los clientes necesitan.

Su sueño es que el negocio crezca, ayudar a sus hijos a que sean profesionales y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida y construir su vivienda de bloque.
texts.en:
Pedro is 54 years old and attended school until third grade.  He is married and his wife tends to their home and also works in a store.  They have four children who are in school.  Pedro's brother also lives with them.  Pedro is a businessman who has a store that he runs with his wife.  Seven years ago, they only sold honey, but as time passed, they expanded their business by purchasing more merchandise, which is how they created the store they have now.  In addition to running the store, he also works growing basic grains such as corn, beans and sorghum, which allows him to generate additional earnings.  The field where he works is 20 minutes away from their home, and he walks there.

He is in need of this loan to purchase more products for their store such as beans, sugar, rice, etc because these products are running out in his store and his customers need them.  His dream is for his business to grow so that he can help his children become professionals, have better living conditions, and be able to build a brick home.

loans.use: purchase more product for his store such as beans, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is married with five children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells used shoes on a retail basis by walking door-to-door.She has been in this business for two years.  

Teopista has applied for a loan of 300,000 from MCDT-SACCO  to buy a bale of used shoes. She works six days a week.  Her major business challenges include transportation costs which increase her operational costs. She is aspiring of buying a plot of land and building her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used shoes

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a 57-year-old woman from Ilo-ilo, Philippines. She ia engaged in the fish vending business. Aside from fish vending, she also runs a sari-sari (variety store) business selling various goods and commodities to the people in her area. She has been operating a variety store for almost seven years. These are the sources of her income. Emelia is asking for a loan buy merchandise such as noodles, condiments, candies, diapers, canned goods and fresh fish to resell. This will help Emelia augment her income, and see to her family's daily needs.

Emelia hopes of expanding her business and making it a success for sustainable livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as noodles, condiments, candies, diapers, canned goods and fresh fish to resell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married and a mother of four children. They live in a two bedroom house in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, including sickness, death and, worst of all, the death of her beloved mother.

With this newly requested loan, she will expand her farming activity by buying more bean seedlings, maize, ans yam seedlings. Part of the loan will be used to buy fertilizer and to pay for labour and transportation of the crops from the farm to the house and possiblely to the market.

She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has a good farm and the road is assessable from the market. Furthermore, the demand for food crop is high.

With this business activity, the community will benefit from her moderate prices, the constant supply of food items and lastly the reduced distance from buyinf from the market.

As for the profits made from this loan, she will expand her business, pay her children's school fees and save some in order to undertake bigger investments and also provide medication for her family. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and the fact that the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as bean seedlings, yam tubers, coca yams, and to clear the farm, pay for labour and buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Henry Santiago

texts.es: Santiago es un joven que vive con sus padres, el tiene 25 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo de años al que lo quiere mucho y del que se hace responsable, Santiago trabaja en una panadería  en un cuarto donde le sobra espacio, entonces nació la idea de poner mas vitrinas y ofrecer  bebidas y productos lácteos que vienen a ser propios suyos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos lacteos para que su local quede mas llamativo y variado, de este negocio Santiago aspira mejora sus ventas y por ende sus ganancias para mantener  a sus bebe.
texts.en: Santiago is a young man who lives with his parents.  He is 25 years old, and has a son who he loves very much and is responsible for.  Santiago works in bakery in which he has a lot of spare room.  Therefore, he has the idea of adding more display cases and offering drinks and dairy products.  He will use this loan to purchase more dairy products so that his store will be more diverse and appealing.  Santiago hopes to improve his sales and his earnings so that he can continue to support his child.

loans.use: purchase beverages.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos inicio hace 20 años en el mundo de la ebanistería se dedica a restaurar muebles del hogar, pintarlos etc. y hace 10 años decidió iniciar su propio negocio, lo tiene ubicado en su casa pero su gran sueño es tener un local independiente puesto que los gases que emite pueden intoxicar a su más amado familiar su hija de 10 años. 
Carlos trabaja todos los días 8 horas y se encuentra solicitando un crédito el cual invertirá en herramienta de mano para mejorar los tiempos de producción y su inventario ofreciendo un servicio más ágil y de mejor calidad. 
Carlos se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con cumplimiento pues sabe que el apoyo que le pueden brindar ayudara a mudar su negocio a un local propio y evitar las emisiones de gas en su hogar y asegurar el bienestar de su hija.
texts.en:
Carlos started working as a carpenter 20 years ago.  He works restoring and painting household furniture, and 10 years ago he decided to start his own business.  His business is located in his home, but his dream is to have his own space because the fumes emitted while working can be toxic to his 10 year old daughter whom he loves.  Carlos works 8 hours everyday.

He is seeking a loan to purchase hand tools so that he can improve his production time and his inventory so that he can offer faster and higher quality service.  Carlos is committed to making his loan payments on time because he knows that the support that he is receiving can help him to move his business out of his home and avoid emitting fumes in his home so that he can ensure his daughter's wellbeing.

loans.use: Purchase hand tools and repair his old tools.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg Group

texts.en:
Nandini is a 44-year-old widowed woman, and she belongs to the Maa Santoshi Shg group. Her husband passed away after three months of her marriage, and from that time on, she has been living with her parents and siblings. She owns a food stall selling idli, pakoda, bada papad, and other Odisha traditional food items. 

She is requesting this loan to boost her capital, whereby she will purchase maize flour, rice flour, and edible oil in greater quantities to reach more customers in her village. Nandini started her business to be economically empowered and to be able to support her family. Her ambition is to diversify her business by selling grocery items and to satisfy her family's basic needs when she makes more profits. 

Nandini believes that the business management training offered by the People’s Forum will assist her to achieve what she wants in her life. As a woman, she is able to feed her family three meals a day, and she has managed to build a small house for her parents.

In the picture, the lady seated with her raised hand is Nandini.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice flour, and edible oil in greater quantities to reach more customers.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
To be young and starting a new family with a fragment of land is a challenge for people in the Kericho area of Kenya. Josephine, age 26 and the mother of two boys and one girl, has overcome this challenge and has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary source of income has been selling eggs, tea and milk, and some personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income.

Josephine, who is an ever-smiling farmer, has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans that farming is for the older generation. She passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early-riser and she wakes up every day in the morning to go and milk her cow.

Although this humble mom has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk.

Josephine is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. Through the loan she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 litres of milk a day. This will help fully satisfy the demand.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a field partner, she attended training sessions and was taught the best financial management skills. This will help her save more money to repay the loan fully and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa lives in Geghakert village of the Armavir region. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and 3-year-old granddaughter. Larisa is engaged in farming. She cultivates haricots, cabbage and greens and sells the gathered harvest locally.

The requested loan of USD 1,500 is very important for Larisa to purchase potato seeds, fertilizer and wires for the greenhouse. Larisa hopes to develop her farming business and earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, fertilizer and wires for the greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay for labor to support her coffee plantings.

loans.name: Elisaberth

texts.en:
She is married and a mother of five children, living in a three-room apartment in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced some challenges in life amongst which are, accidents, thieves and challenges facing her sister and brother.

This loan she requested is to help her buy some items like garri, corn, onions, cassava, dry fish and dry groundnut to increase her business. Her business will always succeed because her location of business is accessible, she has been in this business for a long time, so she has good customers, and the items are always available for her customers at cost. Her business will reduce poverty in the community, provide good health to those who cannot afford fresh fish but who can at least afford dry fish. It will also reduce transportation which would be required to buy the items elsewhere.

The profit she will make from this business will be used to educate her children, cultivate a farm land and cater to her family's needs. She will also save some of the profit.

She prefers a loan from Ghape rather than elsewhere because of its low interest rate, methods of payment and the encouragements given to members.

loans.use: To buy garri, corn, onions, dry fish, and groundnut.

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with eight children. Seven of her children go to school. She takes care of one additional family member.

She lives in her own house. The family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

Kasifa sells yellow bananas wholesale at the market. She works seven days a week and has been in this business for the last 15 years. Kasifa has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of yellow and green bananas . Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality which hinders her movements. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy bunches of yellow and green bananas

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en:
Jean Paul is 27 years old. He is married with one child, who is 9 months old. He is a music producer and has been working in this business for six years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more mix machines and speakers for producing more quality songs. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more mix machines and speakers for producing more quality songs.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine lives in Goris town with her husband and two children (ages 9 and 2 years old). 

A teacher by profession, Armine works at a local school. Besides the work in the school, Armine also runs a small family farm. It includes eight cows, and 45 colonies of bees.
 
 Armine's husband sells the gathered honey in the local market. 

For developing their agricultural business, Armine is asking for this loan of USD 3000 to purchase  eight more colonies of bees and forage for feeding the livestock. 

This young family will be very grateful and thankful to lenders for their support to the agricultural business.

loans.use: to pay for eight colonies of bees and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Shanti is a 39-year-old married woman and mother of three children (two sons and one daughter). Her children go to school. She is from a small town of Maynaguri, in Jalpaiguri district.  

Her husband, Sipen, is a mason by profession, engaged with a shuttering business of centering work for houses. Centering is a type of framework where the temporary structure upon which the stones of an arch or vault are laid during construction. 

Shanti is a housewife who always supports her family and her husband. She is active and energetic. She wants to go ahead and get over all the financial hurdles. They need to expand the business in order to strengthen their economic condition. Now, her husband wants to buy some tools and wood for his business. Shanti has decided to help her husband and take a loan to purchase materials for the business.

So she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). With the help of the loan, her husband will be able to buy wood and necessary tools to prepare foundations for many houses. With the profit, she hopes to enhance her husband’s business and earn more, which will increase her family’s financial status. She wants to save money to give higher education to her children.

Shanti and her husband are thanking BJS and Kiva for supporting them financially.

loans.use: to purchase wood and necessary materials for her husband's shuttering business.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is 26 years old.  She is from Maynaguri. She studied till grade 5 in a village school. Now she is married and is a housewife. She is blessed two young kids, who have not yet been admitted to school. They live in their own house in West Khagrabari in Jalpaiguri district. 

Sabita's husband, Biswanath, is associated with a decorator business. He uses this business to generate an income to support his family. He started the business on his own initiative following his innate creative abilities in the area of design and decoration. His customers request his decoration of weddings, children's birthday parties, religious and political gatherings, etc. Every day he works at his business so that he can achieve his goal to provide financial sustenance to his family. His greatest challenge is obtaining customers in his small village.

Now Sabita is applying for a Kiva loan through their field partner BJS, and she will use it to buy tablecloths, tables and chairs, mattresses, flower vases, etc. She intends to decorate the furniture in her husband's small shop, which he runs from their house, and rent them out. With this loan, she plans to offer a higher quality lifestyle to her family.

She wants to reinvest the profit to further grow the business.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase decorating materials to grow her husband's decorating business.

loans.name: Khusaboo Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en:
Jahiran, Khuteza, Sajan, Mejun, Jahiron and Jebun live in the rural part of Rupsagr village, Deoghar district, Jharkhand, and they have formed a group called “Khusaboo Mahila Samuha” to help each other improve their livelihoods and standard of living. They work hard to support their families and each has their own aspirations that they hope to realize. They want to educate their children, and improve their standards of living. 

Jahiran lives with her husband and five children. Her husband is working as daily-labor wall painter, and his income is around INR 300 per day. Jahiran has been selling bangles for the past three years. She works 20 days in a month and earns around 200 per day. 

The income she and her husband are generating now is not sufficient for her family’s maintenance. Therefore, Jahiran plans to improve her bangle business by taking a loan from Kiva. With the loan, she will buy a colorful variety of bangles to attract customers, which will increase her income.

Like Jahiran, the other members are also seeking the loan to improve their livelihood. They are willing to work hard and do what it takes to uplift their families.

To make improvements to their small businesses, these women need sufficient capital, so they seek a group loan which they will invest in their respective endeavors. Your loan will help six hardworking and deserving families take a big step toward improving their livelihoods and lives.

loans.use: to buy bangles in bulk

loans.name: Amiran Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en:
Jetun, aged 29, shown here with her hand raised, is the group leader of “Amiran Mahila Samuha” Self-Help Group with other five women in Rupsagr village, in Deoghar district, Jharkhand. The group is engaged in varied small businesses. 

Jetun owns a grocery store. She started the store with a small amount. Since then, Jetun and her husband have been running the store together for the last 10 years. At present, they earn about INR 400 per day from the store. However, this amount is not sufficient to meet all the family's expenses. The couple has five children; among them, two are attending school and three are in their childhood. 

With the objective of increasing their family's income, Jetun is requesting an enterprise development loan. The loan would help her expand her business by purchasing additional condiments. With the additional income Jetun wants to give a good education to her children and she wants to improve their standard of living.

The other members of her group will similarly use their share of the loan to develop their own enterprises. 

Your loan will not only help in expanding the businesses of six small entrepreneurs in Jharkhand, but will also improve the overall standard of living of all six members and their families.

loans.use: to add more condiments

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is a 24-year-old lady and hails from Maynaguri. She is married to Kamal. She lives with her husband in Upen Palli in the district of Jalpaiguri.  

Her husband is a laborer and works on a daily wages basis. His income is very much inconsistent and low. Sabita is an active and energetic woman. For additional income for her family, she started a milk business. She sells milk to her locality, and through her hard work, she has achieved great success in her business and now earns a monthly income which is adequate for their family. Sabita sells good quality milk, which is in high demand among local residents. 

Now she wants to grow her business and income.

Since demand is growing, she has turned to BJS (Kiva's partner) for a loan to buy an additional milking cow. She plans to use the profits from the loan to further develop her business and to upgrade their mud and straw made house to a concrete made one. She is grateful to her lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to increase her milk selling business.

loans.name: Sanchita

texts.en:
Sanchita, 34 years old, is a widow and mother of one daughter. She lost her husband a few years back. She is from the rural village Anandanagar of Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She sends her daughter to school; she is in grade 11 in a local village school. Sanchita wants to see her daughter in a good position with a good education. 
 
After her husband’s death, Sanchita decided start her business of selling saris to generate income for her family. A sari is a ladies garment consisting of a length of cotton or silk elaborately draped around the body, traditionally worn by the women of India.

Sanchita started her business from her house. She is taking the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy different varieties of saris from the wholesale market to fulfill the demand of her customers. Her neighbors, relatives and friends are her main customers. 

With the growing needs of her family and the increasing educational expenses of her daughter, she decided to grow her business. She is a successful entrepreneur. She expects a boost in her earnings with this loan, and her plans are to use the profit of her business for the betterment of her daughter and also go ahead with her business.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a wide variety of saris to expand her business.

loans.name: Norma Yaneth

texts.es: Norma tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 17 años, 14 años y 6 años de edad. Ella es propietaria de un vivero y una pequeña tienda la cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y dar a su familia lo necesario. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones solicita este crédito  a FUSAI para encementar el corredor de su vivienda y así poder contar con un espacio más adecuado para sus platas. Con el monto comprará cemento, arena, grava, etc. y además, pagará la mano de obra necesaria para la construcción.
texts.en: Norma, 35, lives with her husband and three children, 17-, 14-, and 6-years old, respectively, in a house that they own.  Norma operates a plant nursery and small general store, both of which help to support the family.  She is applying for a FUSAI loan that she will use to lay a concrete floor for her plant sales business.  The investment will allow her to buy the labor and supplies she needs--cement, sand, gravel, etc.--to carry out the work.

loans.use: to make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Gad

texts.en:
Gad is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kabale in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has four children with two of them currently in school. For the past eight years, Gad has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential goods like sugar, salt and water.

To help expand his business, Gad has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential items he is lacking in the shop, and will help Gad to generate greater profits and improve on his family's standard of living. Gad hopes that in the future he will be able to put his children in better schools.

Gad is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gad who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential items he is lacking in his shop.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru: Валентина, 42 года, замужем, есть взрослая дочь, сейчас Валентина с супругом воспитывают внучку. У Валентины - средне-специальное образование, по специальности ветеринар. Больше 20 лет работает по специальности, также уже 5 лет на местном рынке у нее есть свой небольшой магазин, где Валентина продает ветеринарные препараты. На сегодняшний день прибыль Валентины составляет около 13,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от бизнеса Валентина старается вкладывать в увеличение товарооборота в ее магазине, однако в этом году, так как с Валентиной живет ее трехгодовалая внучка, появилась необходимость отремонтировать дом, утеплить его. Валентина обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на установку теплого пола, потолков, покупку гипсокартона и линолеума,  а также внутреннюю и внешнюю отделку стен. Улучшенные жилищные условия и утепление дома, позволят экономить на оплате коммунальных услуг, а также воспитать внучку здоровой.
texts.en:
Valentina is 42 and married with an adult daughter; Valentina and her husband are currently raising their granddaughter. She has a specialist high school education as a veterinarian. She has been working in her field for more than 20 years and for the past five has also had her own small shop in the local market where she sells veterinary preparations. Her current profit is about 13,000 KGS per month, which covers her family's food and everyday living expenses. Valentina tries to put profits from the business into increasing her working capital; however, this year, since her three-year-old granddaughter is living with her, she needs to renovate her home and heat it.

Valentina has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to install ceilings and heated floors and to buy drywall, linoleum and interior and exterior finishing for the walls. By improving her living conditions and heating her home she will be able to save on costs of communal services and to keep her granddaughter healthy.

loans.use: to install a ceiling and heated flooring and to buy drywall and linoleum

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medications and pay for medical tests and consultations for his wife.

loans.name: Delmy Fidelina

texts.es:
Delmy es una joven de 24 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, es madre soltera de una hija de 2 años y vive junto con sus abuelos.


Desde que terminó sus estudios, Delmy consiguió trabajo en una ferretería, en donde laboró por 4 años, luego inició a trabajar en un negocio de venta de pupusas. Actualmente ha iniciado a trabajar junto a su madre en la venta de ropa, en donde viaja a las ciudades cercanas para comercializar su mercadería. 


El crédito será invertido para comprar más mercadería (ropa) y así tener más opciones que ofrecer a sus clientes, y sobre todo continuar con su trabajo para tener ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su hogar.

Ella sueña con tener su propia casa, tener un local donde poder ofrecer su mercadería para así aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y que a su hija no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Delmy, 24, completed high school.  She is a single mother with a 2-year old daughter and lives with her grandparents.  

After high school, Delmy worked in a hardware store and then a corner grocery for several years before starting a clothing sales business with her mother.  They are traveling saleswomen now, going out to surrounding towns to sell their merchandise.

Delmy is applying for a loan that she will use to expand her business.  She wants to buy a wider variety of clothing items so that she can attract more customers.  The investment will allow her to carry on her business and, in turn, provide her with the income she needs to support herself

For the future, Delmy wants to buy a house of her own and open a store where she can operate her clothing business.  She hopes to make the best possible life for herself and her young daughter.

loans.use: to expand her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional poultry

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: A  sus 72 años de edad Miguel es un señor casado que tiene 9 hijos de las que solo 2 viven con el y sus esposa, Miguel desde que era niño  se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura  ya que juntamente con sus padres vivía en al campo y todos aprenden de aspas dos actividades, el crédito lo necesita para comprar una vaca, lo que Miguel espera es seguir con su rutina,  de ordeño de las vacas y obtener ingresos de la venta de leche, para seguir luchando en la vida como lo viene haciendo hasta ahora.
texts.en: At the age of 72, Miguel is a married man with 9 children, of whom only 2 live with him and his wife. Since he was a boy, Miguel had dedicated himself to livestock raising and farming, since he lived in the country together with his parents, and everyone learned about these two activities. He needs the loan to buy a cow. What Miguel hopes for is to continue with his routine, milking the cows and obtaining income from the sale of milk. In this way he will continue to work hard to get ahead in life, as he has been doing up to now.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goats and sheep

loans.name: Fanny Nohemi

texts.es: Fanny es una señora de bajos recursos económicos, ella esta casada y tiene  3 hijos de 8, 11 y 14 años de edad que en la actualidad se encuentran asistiendo a la escuela, Fanny al igual que su esposo se dedica a trabajar en la cuadrilla que es cuando se reúnen algunas personas y esperan a que alguien les lleve a trabajar al campo, y también se dedican a criar animales, con el dinero del crédito  Fanny va a comprar 2 chanchos para criarlos y al momento de venderlos  obtener algo de ganancia y de ahi darles a sus hijos por lo menos que en la escuela se compren un chupete, la mayor aspiración de Fanny  es mejorar su negocio de crianza de chanchos y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en: Fanny is married.  She has 3 children, 14-, 11-, and 8-years old, all now in school.  Fanny is a woman of very modest means.  Both she and her husband make a living "en la cuadrilla", that is doing temporary farm labor with no guarantee of regular work.  They also raise farm animals.  Fanny is applying for a loan that she will use to buy piglets that she will raise and sell.  The income will help her to keep her children in school and provide them with the barest of necessities.  For the future, Fanny wants to grow her animals-sales business and provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs for her animals-sales business.

loans.name: Ma. Cleofe

texts.en:
Ma. Cleofe is 42 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Cleofe's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She is taking out a bridge loan to restart her business.

Ma. Cleofe has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business. She is using the new loan to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Cleofe is committed to rebuild, and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, coffee, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Gulcin

texts.en:
Gulcin is 29 years old, married and has two kids. Gulcin is a business-minded woman who always dreams of succeeding. She has a store that she rents, and has to pay every month so as to have somewhere to sell her goods. 

The store is her means of earning a living. Gulcin sells statuettes, picture frames, puzzles and school stationary accessories. She would like to increase revenues from the business and improve the living conditions of her children. After all, the goal of this business is for the sake of their future. 

Gulcin requests a loan to purchase industrial and household goods wholesale. The sum she needs is 1,200 AZN. Please support her.

loans.use: to purchase industrial and household goods wholesale.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a 34-year-old single lady from Jenin city. She works as an accountant in a local company. She loves her job. Hiba is still a student in a local university in her last semester. She would like to take the BA degree and improve herself.

Hiba took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the last university installments. By taking this loan, Hiba will pay part of her urgent expenses.

Hiba appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the last university installments.

loans.name: Johnie

texts.en:
Johnie has a poultry business which he has been running for the past 10 years. He is 46 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with one child. He also takes care of 2 members of his family.

He will use this loan to buy poultry feed and more chicks to rear. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. 

This is his fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he paid back his previous loan successfully. His future hope is to have a successful business, educate his child and have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed and chicks to rear.

loans.name: Samera

texts.en:
Samera is a 58-year-old widow woman from Tulkarem city. She is a mother of seven sons. She has a store where she sells stationary and gifts in the city. it is a good business but the income is not high. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Samera took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more items to sell in her store. By taking this loan, Samera will increase her sales and improve her store conditions. 

Samera appears in the photo in her store.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 28 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde, in the Mbarara region of Uganda. For the past 7 years, John has been working hard to manage his clinic, which sells drugs. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. He will use the loan to buy more drugs and surgical items for the clinic. This will help John to generate greater profits and take care of himself and pay for his medical bills. John hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his clinic business. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drugs and surgical items for the clinic,

loans.name: Santo Domingo De Onzole Group

texts.es:
LAURA mujer trabajadora de 25 años de edad –vive en Santo Domingo de Onzole  en  una pequeña casa con su esposo y su hijo de 3 años.
Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura cultivando cacao para vender a los intermediarios.
LAURA  vende calzado para toda edad y ocasión – esta actividad la realiza desde hace un año y dice le va muy bien.  
Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito en una financiera y le gusta la forma como FODEMI ayuda a la gente pobre para que emprenda su idea de negocio.
Se entero de estos créditos por parte de la líder de grupo – quien la invito a participar conociendo su responsabilidad y amabilidad.
Con este préstamo de $500. Dólares ella comprará calzado para niños de edad escolar – zapatos y zapatillas para niñas. asi servira a sus vecinos y no tendran que salir a comprar a otra ciudad.  
Al cabo de 4 años ella espera haber ahorrado lo suficiente para comprar un terreno y hacer su propia casa ya que la casa en que está viviendo es prestada.
LAURA se describe como una mujer trabajadora y comprometida a superarse – es dinámica alegre y le gustan los desafíos. 
Junto a su esposo luchan por conseguir un mejor día para su hijo.
texts.en:
Laura is a hard-working, 25 year-old woman.  She lives in Santo Domingo de Onzole in a small house with her husband and her 3 year-old son.  Her husband works in agriculture, farming cacao to sell to brokers. Laura sells footwear for all ages and occasions.  She has been doing this work for one year and says that it is going very well.  

This is the first time that she is requesting a loan from a bank and she likes the way that the FODEMI bank helps poor people to take off with their business ideas. She heard about these loans through the leader of her group, who invited her to join knowing how responsible and kind she is.

With this $500 loan, she will buy footwear for school-aged children: casual shoes and tennis shoes for girls.  She will sell them to her neighbors and they will not have to leave to shop in another city.  

In 4 years she hopes to have saved enough to buy land and have her own house since she rents the house in which she is living.  Laura describes herself as a hard-working woman and determined to excel.  She is dynamic, cheerful and likes challenges.  Together with her husband she is fighting to obtain a better life for her son.

loans.use: to buy children's shoes to sell.

loans.name: Galacticas Group

texts.es:
Reina es una mujer de 34 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es independiente, emprendedoras, buena madre, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un sitio caracterizado por el constante crecimiento del comercio en todas las áreas y por el asentamiento de indígenas del occidente que escogieron ese lugar para realizar sus vidas.
Reina es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el guaraní por herencia familiar (la segunda de la izquierda, polera gris obscuro, pantalón floreado), debido a la necesidad de abastecer a sus hijos y cumplir con todas su necesidades, formó una banca de personas con negocios diferentes y necesidades similares para solicitar un préstamo y poder continuar con sus actividades comerciales. Su vida la comparte con su pareja y sus tres hijos que asisten a la escuela primaria. Su negocio es el comercio de ropa de segunda mano de forma ambulante, su sueño es comprarse un puesto de venta para no seguir ambulando con sus bolsas de ropa. Ella desea aumentar su capital de trabajo y realizar la compra de ropa para niños y adultos por mayor, así generaría mejores beneficios económicos y podría pagar los gastos de sus tres hijos con mayor comodidad.
Es por esos motivos que Reina solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor y con los beneficios pagar los gastos de sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Reina is 34-years old and lives with her husband and three children. She sells secondhand clothing. She is independent, enterprising, a good mother, responsible, and very hardworking. Her business is located in the Plan 3000 neighbourhood, an area where businesses are constantly growing, and where native Indians from the west chose to spend their lives.

Reina has dark skin, long dark hair, and is of medium height. Her mother tongue is Spanish, but she also knows Guaraní because of her family background. (In the photo she is located second from the left and is wearing a dark grey top and flowery pants).

Because Reina needed to support her children and fulfill all her responsibilities, she formed a community bank whose members have a variety of businesses and whose needs are similar. Together they are seeking a loan so they can continue their businesses.

Reina shares her life with her husband and their three children who attend primary school. To earn her living she sells secondhand clothing in the street. Her dream is to buy permanent premises so she doesn't have to walk around carrying bundles of clothing. She plans to use the loan to buy clothing for children and adults at wholesale prices. Then she will earn more money and be able to pay for her children's expenses more easily.

It is for these reasons that Reina is seeking a loan.

loans.use: Buy secondhand clothing at wholesale prices

loans.name: Roxana Margarita

texts.es:
Roxana de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañada y su pareja es radiotécnico y tienen un hijo de 5 años de edad.


Roxana desde que terminó sus estudios se ha dedicado a los quehaceres del hogar, pero tiene año y medio de dedicarse a la venta de ropa para dama y niños, por lo cual sale a vender en los alrededores de comunidad. 

El préstamo será invertido para comprar mas ropa y así surtir más su negocio.

Roxana tiene el sueño de tener un negocio propio de venta de comida, de igual forma le gustaría incrementar y ampliar su negocio para ayudar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Roxana, 27, completed high school.  She and her husband, a radio technician, have a 5-year old son.  

Roxana has spent years making a home for her family and only started her business a year-and-a-half ago.  She's a traveling saleswoman, selling clothing for women and children to local buyers.  

Roxana will use the loan to stock her business with clothing items.

For the future, Roxana wants to open a food sales business.  She would like to grow her income so that she can help her husband with the family's expenses.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is 48 years old and lives in the town of Lyatonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is widowed and has one child. For the past 10 years, Peace has been working hard to manage her business, where she sells goats. 

To help expand her business, Peace has requested a loan of 4,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs for the goats so as to get more milk to sell, and will help Peace to generate greater profits and take care of her child. Peace hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger farm. 

Peace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for the goats so as to get more milk to sell.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
She is a married woman with six children, living in apartment house of four rooms in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced some challenges in life amongst which are accidents, sicknesses, and most especially the death of her son.

With this loan requested she will be able to acquire food items like corn, beans, garri, rice,  cassava, groundnut, salt, onion, maggi, and eggusi. She thinks this business will succeed because she has good customers, a convenient place for her sales and she buys directly from the producers; she has the capital and experience. 

Her business will help her community because the items are always available at their disposal. They will benefit from her moderate price sales and most especially distance will be reduced compared to going directly to the producers. 

The profit she will realize from this business will help pay her children’s school fees, cater for family needs. She will plough back part of profit into the business. She prefers Ghape loans because they are her only source of finance, they under go training before the money is disbursed, and also because of the low interest and that reimbursement is done gradually.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, garri, rice, cassava, groundnut, salt, onion, maggi and eggusi.

loans.name: Dhirobala

texts.en:
Dhirobala is a 25-year-old housewife who lives in the small town of Mouyamari in Maynaguri in their own house. She is married to Gopal, who is 51 years old. Both Dhirobala and her husband are illiterate, they can only sign their names. They are blessed with three little children; two of them go to school and the other works as a day laborer.

Dhirobala's husband is a cycle-van puller. He carries loads and people from one place to another on his cycle-van and earns for the family. A cycle-van is a kind of carriage which is pulled using a bicycle and is widely used in rural areas by the regional people. But the income of her husband is very small and it is difficult to maintain the family. They decided to purchase another cycle-van and give it out for rent from which they will get a bigger income. 

Then Dhirobala came to hear about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and has taken a loan to purchase a cycle-van for carrying people and goods in their locality so that her husband can earn more than previously. Their future dream is to strengthen their family economy and enroll their children in renowned schools to provide them with a good education.

Her full thanks go to BJS as well as Kiva for giving the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van for carrying goods and people.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for auto spare parts.

loans.name: Kadijatu

texts.en:
This is fifty-eight year-old Kadijatu. She is married. In 2004, Kadijatu established her beer, stout, soft drinks and cement business. She began her business because she wants to live a sustainable life. Her business is located in the outskirts of the town and her main customers are all ages. 

Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,182,500 every month from this business. She would like a loan of an amount of SLL 5,000,000. Kadijatu requires a loan in order to buy additional beer, stout and soft drinks. 

She hopes that this loan will increase her stock and generate more income. In the future, Kadijatu plans to do an extension at the back of her business place to accommodate more customers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for beer, stout and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for perfumes, body spray and shampoo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new sewing needles and yarns for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en:
Hazem is a 26-year-old married man from Khan Younis. He is a father of one small kid. He works as an employee in the public sector with a low income. This income is barely cover all the family needs. Hazm would like to find an additional job to improve the family living conditions. He decided to work on transferring goods using a rickshaw.

Hazam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw that he can use for work. By taking this loan, Hazem will be able to work extra hours and improve the family living conditions.

Hazem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Mandle Group

texts.en:
Georgina (standing in the middle of the photo), age about 27 years old, is the group representative of a 5-member group from Teshie township situated in Accra, Ghana. Her family is comprised of her husband, herself and one child. 

Georgina is maintaining her family by selling foodstuffs, cassava dough and brooms. Her husband helps her selling part of the products from home where Georgina take her part from door-to-door to sell. She is a very active lady, who wants some more money out of her own efforts.

At present, Georgina's monthly income is good but not sufficient to maintain her family. So she, along with 4 members, decided to come and avail themselves of a loan from ID-Ghana to improve their businesses. From the present loan, she will purchase plantain cassava, cassava dough and brooms to sell to customers. She will earn some extra income to maintain a better life. 

The other 4 members of her group are Millicent, Lydia, Gloria and Rita. They are doing different businesses in their locality.

loans.use: To purchase plantain cassava, cassava dough and brooms, sell to customers.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 55 years old. She is married with seven children between 5 and 33 years old, all of whom go school. She has been farming for 30 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for her maize production. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for her maize production.

loans.name: Ana Ingrid

texts.es:
Ana de 26 años de edad, estudió hasta 5° grado, está acompañada y su pareja es taxista, tiene 2 hijos que asisten a la escuela.

Ana es una persona que tiene muchas ganas de superarse es por eso que se ha dedicado a trabajar en diferentes actividades, trabajó 3 años en una venta de ropa, también en en un comedor y actualmente ha iniciado a trabajar en un negocio propio, el cual es venta de tortillas.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar maíz para continuar con la venta de tortillas. 


Su sueño de mejorar su vivienda, también espera que en su negocio le vaya bien para que a sus hijos no les falte nada y puedan prepararse académicamente.
texts.en:
Ana is 26 years old and has a grade five education. She is married; her husband drives a taxi. They have two children who attend school.

Ana has a great desire to get ahead so she has earned her living doing three different jobs. She worked for three years selling clothing and has also worked in a restaurant. Now she has opened her own business selling tortillas.

She needs a loan to buy maize so she can continue her tortilla business. Her dream is to improve her house, and she also hopes that her children lack for nothing and she can provide them with a good education.

loans.use: Buy maize for her tortilla business

loans.name: Kenedy

texts.en:
Kenedy is 27 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. For the past three years, Kenedy has been working hard to manage his timber business where he sells timber. 

To help expand his business, Kenedy has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more timber to sell, and will help Kenedy to generate greater profits and take care of his parents' medical bills. Kenedy hopes that in the future, he will be able to improve on the market. 

Kenedy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Kenedy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more timber to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy pants, blouses, shirts, skirts, underwear etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 47 years old. She is married to Kanai, and together they have been blessed with five children.

Susan runs a butchery, a business she has done for the last 14 years, earning a monthly income of KES 7,000. Susan has requested her 2nd loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 20,250 which she will use to buy goats to slaughter.

With the anticipated profits, Susan will be able to educate her children for life. Susan successfully repaid her previous loan.

Susan's hope and dream for the future is to live a prosperous life.

loans.use: to buy goats to slaughter.

loans.name: Bridget C.

texts.en:
This is thirty-four year-old Bridget. She is single. In 2010, Bridget established her drinks and food stuff business. She began her business because she wants to take care of her family and her personal needs. Her business is located in city center and her main customers are adults. 

Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about SLL 500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of an amount of SLL 3,000,000. Bridget requires a loan in order to buy additional drinks (beer, stout, malt and soft drinks). She hopes that this loan will increase her principal and generate more income. 

In the future, Bridget plans to educate her children to university level and to open another outlet doing the same business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for drinks (beer, stout, malt and soft drinks).

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Hello! Meet Pamela, a 36-year-old caring, loving, and adorable mother of three children. She resides in the Kericho area of Kenya. Due to the lack of funds, Pamela never got an opportunity to further her education so that she could get a white-collar job, but that did not kill her dream of succeeding in life. She has been farming for the last 10 years on a small piece of land. Pamela enjoys working on her farm so much and has always been able to put food on the table for her family. Through practicing mixed farming (that is, crop and animal farming), she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Pamela enjoys dairy farming a lot and has even nicknamed her cow “Tuyai.” This means that the cow produces a lot of milk. Pamela is seeking a loan of 60,000 KES to purchase farm implements and increase the poultry on her farm. There has been an increase in egg consumption in her area and the supply has always been low. This is why Pamela wants to take advantage of that and make good profits by selling more eggs and poultry products. Pamela will also use the farm implements to increase her crop production levels. Products such as fertilizers will be used to improve the production output. It can be said with confidence that if you invest in Pamela, you are investing in someone who will want to transform her life and the lives of those in society. In the next year, Pamela is projecting that she will have more poultry and be able to meet the demand in her area. Through the profits gathered, Pamela can comfortably pay off the loan and invest the other profits in her children's education. Pamela hopes for your kindness

loans.use: To purchase farm implements and additional poultry

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 54 years old and a single mother of one child. She has a food stall business which she has been running for the past five years. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of milk, sugar, rice, beans and cooking oil for use in her business. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

This is her fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loan well. Her future hopes are to grow her business, be successful, make more income and have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of milk, sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kpangmanga - Chaalam Group

texts.en:
Sana is a 60-year-old hard working woman from Chaalam in the Northern region of Ghana. Sana is married and has seven children with 4 of the children attending school. Sana is the individual pictured 2nd on the right among members standing.

Sana is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the last 3 years. The name of the group is ‘Kpangmanga - Chaalam’. Sana earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea butter processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the local and non-local markets.

Sana and ‘Kpangmanga - Chaalam’ have asked for a loan of GHS 4,200. Sana’s share of the loan will help her to buy 4 bags of shea nuts for processing. Sana aspires to earn more income as well as to repay this loan and support her children with food and educational materials.

Sana thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy 4 bags of shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 33 year-old Zainab. She is married and has 2 children aged 10 and 4 years. 

In 1999, Zainab established her business selling jeans, t-shirts, ladies' dresses, skirts, and slippers. She began her business to assist her husband with the upbringing of their children. Her business is located in the city center and her customers are both men and women. Her business operates 6 days a week and 11 hours a day. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL to buy more of the same stock. With this additional stock, she will grow her business and increase her profit.

She was able to move to a much better business place where she has erected a wooden stall much to her convenience and also that of her customers and she has employed one sales assistant. Now her items are of better quality than the previous items and as such enable her to open a special account for her children with the proceeds of her loan. 

Zainab is planning to have a bigger stall or kiosk, she is very grateful to Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers, ladies' dresses, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Brighton

texts.en:
Brighton is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 3 years, Brighton has been working hard to manage his bar, where he sells drinks like sodas, beer, wine and spirits. 

To help expand his business, Brighton has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more beers soda and spirits to sell, and will help Brighton to generate greater profits and take care of his family's basic needs. Brighton hopes that in the future he will be able to buy another motor cycle that will help him in transporting the goods. 

Brighton is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Brighton who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase for more beers soda and spirits to sell.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Ibrahim. He is married, and has 3 children aged 4, 7 and 10. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him helping with the household chores. 

In 2007, Ibrahim established his DVD and VCD disk business. He began his business just to engage himself in an economic activity after coming from the mines. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about SLL 5,000.000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of an amount of SLL 3,000,000. Ibrahim has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more empty DVD and VCD disks. In the future, Ibrahim plans to complete the payment of his plot of land and to rehabilitate his shop. 

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy empty DVD disks, VCD films, and extension cords.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is a hard-working woman, 43 years old, living in the village of Haykadzor, Shirak region. Lida used to work as a cook, but currently the main activity she is involved in is agriculture. Lida's elder daughter (22 years old) is a hairdresser. Lida's only son has returned from the army and now helps his mother with farming activities.
