On the farm Lida keeps cows, sheep, and some hens. They also cultivate wheat and sell the harvest in local markets. 

Lida has now applied for this loan of USD 2,000 to purchase wheat seeds, fuel for land cultivation and cover cultivation costs. She will be very grateful to lenders for their support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds, fuel for land cultivation and cover cultivation costs.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and has nine children. The family  lives in an eight-room apartment house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. Esther has faced some  problems in life, like ill health, which has caused her to be inactive for a long time, and the death of her son.

This requested loan will help Esther to buy piglets, goats, feed, vaccines and seedlings, to repair pig and goat fencing, to rent a piece of land for cultivation, and to pay for clearing, mulching and weeding of her farm. She feels that this business will succeed because of her good experience and a high demand for pigs and goats. The manure will be used on the farm. Esther also thinks this business will help her community in development, reducing food shortages and leading to price reductions as the community will buy directly from her, the producer.

The profit Esther will realize from this business will help pay her children’s school fees, cover the family's needs, and expand her business. She prefers her loan from GHAPE because she trusts them, their low interest on loans, and the gradual repayment interval.

loans.use: to buy piglets, goats, feed, vaccines and seedilings, to repair fencing, and to pay for clearing, mulching and weeding

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Ismael de 62 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, debido a la situación económica que vivía su familia en ese tiempo no pudo seguir estudiando, es casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen 7 hijos que ya están casados y trabajan, con Ismael solo viven 3 de ellos con sus parejas. 


Ismael es jornalero, trabaja para otras personas además siembra sus cultivos como maíz, frijol y maicillo, en esta actividad tiene 40 años de trabajar de realizarla y la aprendió por sus padres que todo el tiempo se dedicaron a lo mismo, el lugar donde ahora trabaja está a 15 minutos de su casa y se va a pie.


Este crédito lo solicita para comprar los insumos agrícolas como 3 quintales de abono, 7 quintales de sulfato, 1 galón de herbicidas para controlar la maleza y pagar la mano de obra que ayudara a realizar estas actividades agrícolas.

Su sueño es comprar una vaca lechera que le proporcione parte de la alimentación para su familia, también quiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda porque hay partes del techo que ya están dañadas y cuando llueve se fuerte filtra el agua.
texts.en:
Ismael is 62 years old. He went to school up to the second grade. Due to his family's financial situation, he was unable to keep going to school at that time. He is married and his wife is a housewife. They have 7 children who are married and working. Only three of them with their spouses live with Ismael.

Ismael is a day laborer. He works for other people in addition to working for other people, he has crops such as crops, beans, and sorghum. He has been working in this activity for 40 years. He learned it from his parents, who always did the same work. The place where he works is 15 minutes from his house and he gets there on foot.

The loan he is asking for is to buy agricultural materials such as 3 quintals of fertilizer, 7 quintals of sulphate, 1 gallon of herbicide for weed control and to pay for labor costs to help him do the agricultural activity. 

His dream is to buy a dairy cow that will give food for the family. He also wants to improve his living conditions because part of the roof are damaged and when it rains water leaks in.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials such as 3 quintals of fertilizer, 7 quintals of sulphate, 1 gallon of herbicide for weed control and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Freddy Antonio

texts.es:
Entre su trabajo y sus estudios Freddy ha logrado coordinar su tiempo, los días de semana se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas y manejo apícola y los días sábados va a clase, está en tercer año de ingeniería industrial en la Universidad de Managua con sede de en León. Está soltero y tiene 20 años de edad.
Escogió la carrera porque le gusta mucho y los conocimientos adquiridos los aplica en su actividad económica que realiza. Solicita el crédito para la compra de una computadora y una impresora que necesita. Estos equipos le facilitaran la realización de sus trabajos así como mejorar la entrega de estos, brindándoles un crecimiento tanto personal como profesional. Su plan futuro es llegar a ser un profesional de éxito. Su meta principal es mantener sus notas y tener un buen rendimiento académico.
texts.en:
Freddy is single and is 20 years old. He has managed to organiset his time between weekdays, when he takes care of vegetable production and beekeeping, and Saturdays, when he attends classes. He is in his third year of industrial engineering studies at the University of Managua at the León site. He chose this degree because he really enjoys it and because the knowledge he acquires can be applied to his economic activities.

He is asking for a loan to buy a computer and printer that he needs. This equipment will help him carry out his work and will improve how he hands it in, which will help him both personally and professionally. His plan for the future is to become a successful professional. His main goal is to keep his grades up and to perform well academically.

loans.use: to buy a computer and printer.

loans.name: Sofan

texts.en:
Sofan is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kabale in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children. For the past 2 years, Sofan has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential goods like sugar, salt and water. 

To help expand his business, Sofan has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential items lacking in the shop, and will help Sofan to generate greater profits and take care of his family's basic needs. Sofan hopes that in the future he will be able to improve more on his business. 

Sofan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sofan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential items lacking in the shop

loans.name: Veronica Alexandra

texts.es: Alexandra es madree soltera, tiene 22 años de edad y su hija tiene 5 años y ya asiste  a la escuela, Alexandra vive en el campo y por este motivo ya tiene experiencia la crianza de animales ya que su madre le enseña de esta actividad y también trabaja en la agricultura, Alexandra comenta que va a invertir el credito en la compra de chachos para  mejorar su negocio y readecuar una chanchera y asi trabajando duro es que espera poder darle a su hila lo que el padre de la niña no le ofrece.
texts.en:
Alexandra is a single mother, and she is 22 years old. Her daughter is 5 years old, and is already going to school. Alexandra lives on a farm, and for this reason she has experience raising animals since her mother taught her how. She also works in agriculture.

Alexandra mentions that she is going to use the loan to buy pigs to improve her business and revamp her pig farm. By working hard, she hopes to be able to give her daughter what the father of her child does not offer.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 2 years, Carolyne has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential goods like sugar, salt and water. 

To help expand her business, Carolyne has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential items lacking in the shop, and will help Carolyne to generate greater profits and pay her parents' medical bills. Carolyne hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build shops on it. 

Carolyne is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Carolyne who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential items lacking in the shop.

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi has a food selling business and has been running it for 10 years now. She is 33 years old, married, and together with her spouse has been blessed with 3 children. She will be using this loan to buy more stock of wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar for use in her business. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. 

This is Mwanaharusi's third loan from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar for use in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in snacks, soap, detergent, pastries, coffee, rice, etc.

loans.name: Melody Women Group

texts.en:
In 2014, Melody Women Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to be trained in financial management and savings mobilization to improve their livelihoods. They are mostly involved in casual farming activities.

The person raising her hand in the photo is Nancy, who is thirty years old and has one child. She does poultry farming, and has applied for a loan to buy poultry feed. She hopes this will increase her supply of eggs and poultry and hence improve her income. This will help her to pay her child’s tuition fees.

All members in this group are very happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase poultry feed.

loans.name: Kahindi

texts.en:
Kahindi is 30 years old and single. He runs a bicycle repair business and has been running it for 10 years now. He will use this loan to buy more spare bicycle parts for use in his business. These include tubes, wheels, brakes and rims. He will be able to serve more customers well.

This is Kahindi's second loan from VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to have a successful business and a happy family.

loans.use: To buy spare bicycle parts.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
O sr Alberto, pai de um filho de 04 anos de idade.  ele trabalha  nos caminhos de ferro de Moçambique,  e para aumentar as suas receitas construiu uma loja de venda de  material de canalização no mercado perto de sua casa.
 Com o emprestimo pretende comprar material de canalização diverso  como tubos, colas ,  carrinhas de mao, torneiras, arrames, tomadas, lampadas, caleiras, dobradiças,unioes para revender.
O seu maior sonho é se tornar um negociante de reconhecimento nacional, gostaria tambem de aumentar o tamanho de sua casa e comprar uma viatura.
 Seu maior desafio é pagar o empréstimo com rapidez de forma a solicitar outro.
texts.en:
Mr Alberto is the father of a 04 year old son. He works for Mozambique railways and to increase his income he built a shop selling plumbing material at the market near his house.

With this loan he plans to buy various plumbing supplies like pipes, glue, wheelbarrows, taps, wires, plugs, lightbulbs, gutter piping and hinges to sell on.

His biggest dream is to become a nationally renowned businessman and he would also like to expand his house and buy a vehicle.

His biggest challenge is to pay back this loan quickly so that he can solicit another one.

loans.use: buy various plumbing supplies like pipes, glue, wheelbarrows, taps, wires, plugs, lightbulbs, gutter piping and hinges to sell on.

loans.name: Tulaga Muruaki Self Help Group

texts.en:
Pauline, raising her hand in the photo, is a member of Tulaga Muruaki Self Help Group. She is aged forty-two years and has five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to gain skills in business management, record keeping, and financial management. She practices mixed farming (dairy and vegetables).

Pauline is taking a loan to boost her farming by buying hybrid seeds. She hopes that the crop yield will improve and hence increase her income level due to improved supplies. She will achieve the goal of ensuring her children get a quality education. 

All members of the group are happy for this loan and grateful to Kiva for its help and support.

loans.use: To buy hybrid seeds.

loans.name: Chynar

texts.ru: Чынар 49 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование - средне-специальное, работает в школе. Также Чынар в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, стартовав в 1994 году с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Чынар, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы, 1 лошадь, 1 теленок, 10 овец и 9 коз. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чынар обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Чынар планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, так как она хочет приобрести автомобиль для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Chynar is 49 and married with three children. She has a specialist high school education and works in a school. She also works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began in 1994 with 5,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she now has two cows, one horse, one calf, 10 sheep and nine goats.

With the goal of further developing her business, Chynar has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase sheep for fattening and resale. She plans to put profits from the loan into further expanding her business, since she wants to buy a family car.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for fattening and resale in order to invest in the growth of her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Mercy. She is fifty-six years old, married and blessed with three children; all are in school. She is happy with Hand in Hand Eastern Africa for their great training which has positively impacted her life as it equipped her with business skills which she applies in her enterprise.

Mercy does poultry farming as her economic activity. Her greatest goal is to do it in large scale. She is constrained financially hence needs a loan to buy more poultry. This will ensure that she maintains a steady supply of chickens and eggs in Limuru, Kenya. She hopes for increased income which will enable her to pay school fees for her children.

Mercy is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida lives with her daughter in the Shirak region. Her husband and two sons left the country last year, with the hope of finding well-paid jobs and supporting their family financially. 

To overcome financial difficulties, Aida has been running a farm. On the farm she keeps two cows and two calves, and cultivates potatoes. The land where she cultivates potatoes is not her own; Aida has to rent it from her co-villagers each year to be able to cultivate it and gather income. 

This requested loan of USD 3,000 will greatly help this hard-working woman to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer, and cover cultivation costs. She will be very grateful if lenders support her farming business. 

Aida dreams of having a big and profitable farm so her family will not have to live separately.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and fertilizer, and cover cultivation costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: pigs, chickens and feed.

loans.name: Anara

texts.ru: Анара, 49 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. Старшему сыну 17 лет, младшему - 5 лет. У Анары среднее образование, в качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав бизнес 20 лет назад. На данный момент в хозяйстве Анары имеется 2 коровы, 3 лошади, 10 овец и 1 бычок. Также на 2,23 ГА собственной и 1 ГА арендованной земли Анара выращивает картофель и многолетние травы. Дополнительно на ежедневной основе сдают 8-10 литров молока. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анара обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы, 1 бычка и 2 тонн ячменя для корма скоту.  Доходы от кредита Анара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Anara is 49 and married with three children. Her oldest son is 17 and her youngest is five. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry and agriculture as the primary source of income for her family, a business she started 20 years ago. She currently has two cows, three horses, 10 sheep and one steer as well as 2.23 hectares of her own and 1 hectare of rented land where she grows potatoes and hay. She also gets about eight to 10 litres of milk every day.

With the goal of further developing her business, Anara has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 KGS to purchase one cow and one steer as well as two tons of barley to feed her animals. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a steer as well as two tons of barley to feed her animals

loans.name: Yehowa Akwe Group

texts.en:
Daniel (standing second from the left in the photo), aged about 41 years old, is the group representative of a five member group from Teshie township situated in Accra, Ghana. His family is comprised of his wife, himself and two children. 

Daniel is maintaining his family by selling phone credits and toilet rolls. He has been selling credits and toilet roll on a pavement. He is a very active gent, who wants some more money out of his own efforts. At present, Daniel's monthly income is good but not sufficient to maintain his family. So he, along with four other members, decided to come and avail themselves of a loan from ID Ghana to improve their businesses. From the present loan, he will purchase different kinds of phone credits and toilet rolls to sell to customers. He will earn some extra income to maintain a better life. The other four members of his group are Gifty, Salami, Salomey and Janet. They are doing different businesses in their locality.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of phone credits and toilet rolls to sell to customers.

loans.name: Kymkatay

texts.ru: Кымкатай, 44 года, замужем, 4 детей. У Кымкатай средне-специальное образование, по специальности технолог. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается гостиничным бизнесом на протяжении 11 лет. У Кымкатай есть 15 двухместных коттеджей, они очень удобные и уютные, есть номера с трехразовым питанием. Также Кымкатай занимается садоводством, выращивая и перепродавая в сезон груши и яблоки. Ежемесячная прибыль Кымкатай составляет до 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на ремонт и благоустройство коттеджей для клиентов. Доходы от бизнеса Кымкатай вложит в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса и образование детей.
texts.en:
Kymkatay is 44 and married with four children. She has a specialist high school education as a technologist. For 11 years she has been running a hospitality business as the primary source of income for her family. She has 15 double-occupancy cottages, very comfortable and cozy, some of which come with three meals a day. In addition, Kymkatay works in agriculture, growing and selling apples and pears in season. Her monthly profit is around 25,000 KGS per month.

With the goal of further developing her business, Kymkatay has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to renovate and make improvements to her rental cottages. She will put profits into further expanding her business and educating her children.

loans.use: to repair her rental cottages and make some improvements to be more competitive and attract more clients

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis de 59 años de edad, estudió hasta 3 grado debido a que sus padres no contaban con los recursos económicos para darle esta oportunidad, está acompañado y su pareja realiza los oficios del hogar y tienen 3 hijos. 


Luis inició a trabajar desde los 12 años en la agricultura, dado de que su padre fue agricultor de profesión y de ahí él aprendió esta actividad, además realiza el oficio de carpintería y de albañilería gracias a sus tíos quienes le enseñaron estas otras actividades.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas y así realizar la siembra de frijol.

Luis sueña con mejorar su vivienda, además le gustaría tener ganado y así tener otra fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Luis, 59 years old, studied through third grade since his parents didn't have the financial resources to give him more opportunity.  He is in a relationship and his partner does the work at home.  They have three children.

Luis started working at farming when he was 12 years old, since his father was a farmer and thus he learned this work.  Besides this, he works as a carpenter and mason thanks to his uncles who taught him these other skills.

He needs the loan to buy farm supplies and be able to plant beans.

Luis dreams of improving their home; he also would like to buy cattle and have another source of work.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for planting beans

loans.name: Alexandra Aracelly

texts.es: Alexandra es una joven de 21 años de edad, vive en el campo con sus padres  en una finca donde cuidan ganado  de su patrón, son ya 5 años que ella sabe cómo se criar  ganado y  sabe que es buen negocio, el dueño de esta finca les hace tener 3 vacas y no les cobra de la hierba, Alexandra necesita el dinero para la compra de una vaca, y de este negocio lo que Alexandra aspira en mejorar sus ingresos para pagar lo que  le cuesta estudiar  semipresencial, y espera logras culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Alexandra is a young woman, aged 21. She lives in the country with her parents on a farm where they take care of the cattle of their landlord. It's already been 5 years since she learned how to raise cattle and she knows that it's good business. The owner of this farm gives them 3 cows and does not charge them for the grass.

Alexandra needs the money to buy a cow, and from this business Alexandra aspires to improve her income to be able to pay what it costs to study part-time, and hopes to achieve completing her studies.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 41 years old and lives in the town of Masindi, located in the Hoima region of Uganda. A married father of four children, three of whom are currently in school, for the past four years he has been working hard to manage his retail shop which sells essential goods like sugar, salt and water. 

To help expand his business, Mohamed has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more essential items for the shop. This will help him generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Mohamed hopes that in the future he will be able to establish a maize milling factory in Masindi. 

Mohamed is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mohamed who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy essential items for his shop

loans.name: Aminda

texts.es:
La señora Aminda  de 54 años de edad vive con su esposo tienen un hijo que depende de ella  vive en una colonia  que está ubicada en la cuidad de San Lorenzo en la parte sur de Honduras, se dedica a la actividad de venta de abarrotería, desde hace 17  años y sus clientes son  sus  amigos y vecinos de la comunidad.
Doña Aminda  es una mujer trabajadora con mucha ganas de sacar adelante a su familia, también se dedica a la cría de cerdos para vender y a la cría de ganado de leche en la actualidad vende golosinas y desea ampliar su negocio.
Doña Aminda  está solicitando el préstamo para compra de frescos,  papas, yuca,  plátano, mínimo verde, jugos, etc. Con el préstamo desea invertir más en su negocio y  obtener más  ganancias que le permitan salir adelante en su negocio y con su familia.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando y mejorando más su negocio y también seguir  mejorando su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Septiembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Aminda, 54, lives with her husband. They have a son who depends on her. They live in a neighborhood that is located in the city of San Lorenzo in the southern part of Honduras. She has been working at the activity of selling groceries for the past 17 years. Her customers are her friends and neighbors of the community.

Aminda is a hardworking woman eager to get her family ahead. She also works raising pigs to cell and raising milk cattle. Currently, she sells snacks and wishes to grow her business.

Aminda is applying for the loan to buy soda, potatoes, yuca, plantains, green bananas, juices, etc. With the loan, she wishes to invest more in her business and obtain more income that will allow her to get ahead with her business and with her family. Her dream is to continue working and improving her business more and also to continue improving her house.

loans.use: to buy soda, potatoes, yuca, plantains, green bananas, juices, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Burulbubu

texts.ru: Бурулбубу 47 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Бурулбубу среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она вместе с супругом занимаются животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Бурулбубу, ее хозяйство на сегодняшний день насчитывает 3 коровы, 45 овец и 2 лошади. также есть 2,0 ГА собственной и 2,0 ГА арендованной земли, где Бурулбубу выращивает картофель, ячмень и сено, заготавливая их на зиму в качестве корма для скота. Бизнес в целом приносит до 5,000 сом (KGS)в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурулбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Бурулбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а в ближайшем будущем - достроить дом.
texts.en:
Burulbubu is 47 and married with three children. She has a high school education and works with her husband in animal husbandry and agriculture as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she now has three cows, 45 sheep and two horses as well as 2 hectares of her own and 2 hectares of rented land where she grows potatoes, barley and hay, which she prepares for winter to feed her animals. The business brings in a total of 5,000 KGS per month.

With the goal of further developing her business, Burulbubu has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to increase her head count of livestock by buying steers for fattening and resale. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her number of animals and, in the future, into finishing her house.

loans.use: to buy steers for fattening and resale

loans.name: Zhyldyzhan

texts.ru: Жылдызхан 51 год, замужем, дети все взрослые и самостоятельные. У Жылдызхан средне-специальное техническое образование. На протяжении 18 лет занимается торговлей женской одеждой. Также имеется доход от животноводства, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 1 лошадь, 2 коровы, 15 овец.  Жылдызхан решила увеличить ассортимент одежды в товарообороте, поэтому обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS), также часть средств будет потрачена на покупку сена и корма для скота. На сегодняшний день, ежемесячная прибыль составляет примерно 10,000 сомов, а товарооборот свыше 160,000 сомов (KGS). Доходы от кредита Жылдызхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на образование ее внуков.
texts.en:
Zhyldyzhan is 51 and married; her children are all grown and live on their own. She has a specialist high school education and has been working selling women's clothing for 18 years. She also earns a living from animal husbandry, and currently has one horse, two cows and 15 sheep. Her current monthly profit is about 10,000 KGS and her working capital more than 160,000 KGS. 

Zhyldyzhan has decided to increase her assortment of inventory and therefore has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS. Part of the sum will also be used to purchase hay and feed for her animals. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and to save toward her grandchildren's education.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale in her shop and to purchase hay and feed for her livestock

loans.name: Benancio Ovidio

texts.es: Benancio tiene 37 años, vive con su padre y hermanos , pero no con su madre ya que es fallecida, y es por eso que Benancio se quedo siéndole compañía a su padre, ellos viven en el campo y saben muy bien el proceso de crianza de ganado ya que en este lugar se aprende  por la experiencia, Benancio va a invertir el crédito en la compra de una vaca para vender la leche y de ahí tener sus ingresos para los gastos de sus hogar y sus gastos personales, lo que el aspira es comprarse un lotecito de terreno para ahí criar a sus ganado.
texts.en:
Benancio is 37 and lives with his father and siblings although not with his mother, who is no longer living. This is why Benancio stayed - to keep his father company. They live in the country and understand the process of raising livestock very well, because there you learn through experience.

Benancio plans to invest the loan into buying a cow to sell milk, and in this way earn a living to cover household costs as well as his personal expenses. He dreams of buying a small plot of land to be able to raise his livestock.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
This is Hannah, forty years old, and a single mother blessed with four children who are in school. She has undergone training provided by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa which has positively impacted her farming activities. She does vegetable farming. She needs a loan to help improve her crop yield by applying fertilizer. This will lead to a bounty harvest and more income. She hopes the business returns will help her provide for her children so she can offer them a good education.

She is very grateful for Kiva lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 57 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Corazon runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for five years.

Corazon would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, cigarettes, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
This is Peter, forty-four years old, married and blessed with two children. He has benefited from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training as he acquired entrepreneurial and financial management skills.

He rears sheep and also operates a butchery that sells mutton. He is borrowing a loan to expand his farming by buying more lambs, which after maturity will be slaughtered for sale in the butchery. He hopes this will enable him to meet the demand of mutton in the market and improve his sales. This will lead to increased profits which he hopes to use in educating his children.

He is grateful to Kiva and the lenders for the support.

loans.use: to buy lambs.

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik lives in Meghrashat village with her husband and three children. The family runs a farm. It includes livestock such as cows, sheep, hens and two colonies of bees. Near the house where Astghik lives she also cultivates wheat and barley and grows apple and pear trees.

Astghik's husband is an army officer so she alone has to take care of the farm and their children.

Like any farmer, Astghik is also getting prepared for the coming winter season. She is asking for this loan of USD 3000 to purchase forage to feed the livestock.

She hopes for lenders' support and ensures responsible monthly payments.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Virginia Juliana

texts.es: Juliana es una joven positiva de 18 años de edad , ella salió del colegio desde hace un año, y se puso a criar pollos mientras reúne el dinero para entrar a la universidad, ella vive con su padre y con su madrastra ya que su verdadera madre la abandono hace 5 años, lo que va a hacer Juliana con el dinero del crédito es comprar pollos, lo que Juliana aspira es mejorara su negocio para asi quedarse con algo de ganancia y reunir el dinero que implica ingresar a la universidad, lo  que mas aspira Juliana es entrar a  estudiar una carrera universitaria y seguir con su  sueño de ser una artista profesional, y que en la actualidad canta como aficionada.
texts.en:
Juliana is a young, positive 18-year-old woman. She left school a year ago and began to raise chickens whilst saving money to go to university. She lives with her father and step-mother as her real mother abandoned her 5 years ago.

Juliana is asking for a loan to buy chickens. She hopes to improve her business to make a profit and get together enough money to be able to go to university. What she really wants to do is study for a degree and follow her dream of becoming a professional artist, as she currently sings recreationally..

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a strong, resilient, 52-year-old Kikuyu farmer who has been running a mixed-farm for close to two decades. Her primary income sources are eggs, tea, and a side business.

This mother of four loves horticultural farming. However, she is taking a step further to diversify in order to increase her income and reduce her income vulnerability. She is seeking a loan to purchase dairy goats. 

Dairy goat farming is a very profitable business in Kerugoya. Goats need to be milked at least once a day, seven days a week, rain or shine, cold or hot, until they dry off. Lucy has always wanted to keep dairy goats to provide her with fresh and free goat milk, goat meat, goat cheese and goat yogurt. The good thing about goat milk is that you don’t have to worry about antibiotics and hormones in the milk. 

This investment is bound to bring Lucy great sustainable profits which she will use to pay her loan and other farming expenses. When asked how her family will benefit from the loan, she replied, “'I will be able to educate my child and also provide food for the family".

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is married with six children, four of whom go to school. She has a business selling Irish potatoes and cassava. She has been in this business for 11 years. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings  from MCDT-SACCO to purchase bags of sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, oranges, tomatoes and cassava. Irene generates additional income by selling used clothes. She works at the market seven days a week on a retail basis. The major challenges to her business include transportation and seasonality. Irene aspires to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy sweet potatoes, cassava, Irish potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married with two children. Both of her children go to school. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. She also takes care of additional family members. Monthly expenses include rent, medication, school fees and feeding the family. 

She owns a shop selling second-hand clothing. Besides this clothing business, she also sells soft drinks and passion fruits. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for eight years and her business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She would like to buy bales of second-hand clothes, crates of soda and passion fruits. In the future she would like to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 31 years old, married to Noel and blessed with one child. She has been in the tailoring business for the past three years and earns a monthly income of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

She has applied for her third loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy fabric materials for dressmaking.

Josephine will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy fabric materials for dressmaking.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year now.

Betty requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers.

In the future, Betty would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mukeu Unity Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Monica, a member of Mukeu Unity Women Group. She is a mother, aged thirty-six years old, and has three children attending school. Monica does mixed farming of vegetables and dairy. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to learn more about business management, record keeping and financial management.

She is borrowing a loan to help boost her farming activities by buying certified seeds. She hopes for a bountiful harvest. This will lead to an increase in the level of income, thus ensuring she maintains food security in her household and also pays for her children's school fees.

All members in this group are happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva for their help and support.

loans.use: to pay for planting seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay for qualified labor to tend to her coffee plants.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives in Verishen village with her husband and two sons. She is involved in farming activities. More specifically, Anna keeps livestock that includes a cow, calves, hens, and 60 colonies of bees. Because she works hard, Anna harvests high-quality agricultural products. Her husband helps to sell them in the market.

Besides agriculture, a year ago Anna started working in a local kindergarten. Although they both are working, Anna and her husband barely cover all their family's needs, sometimes with great effort and difficulty. Despite all of their hardships, Anna always takes care of their farm with great pleasure and care.

Anna has decided to ask for this loan of USD 1,500 to be able to purchase one more cow to add to her livestock.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married with two children and both her children go to school. 

She has a retail shop business and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. She works in her shop seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. 
Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. 

She aspires to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care and timely loans. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, cooking oil and cartons of salt.

loans.name: Domiana

texts.en:
Domiana is a married lady. Together with her spouse they have been blessed with 4 children who are all grown up. Domiana is a farmer, a business she has done for the last 9 years, earning a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

Domiana has requested a loan of 20,000 KES which she will use to buy fertilizers, planting seeds and paying laborers.

With the anticipated profits, Domiana will be able to improve her family's living standards.This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya.

Domiana's hopes and dreams for the future are to expand into large scale farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, planting seeds and paying laborers.

loans.name: José Vicente

texts.es:
José es un joven de 22 años de edad, solo logró estudiar hasta 9° grado, debido a la situación económica tuvo que dejar la escuela para ayudar a su padre en los gastos del hogar, está soltero y  vive en casa con sus padres y un hermano.   

José ha trabajado como vendedor de una tienda desde hace 6 años, anteriormente trabajó de panificador y en la agricultura. Desde hace un año José tiene su propia tienda, él se levanta a las 4:00AM, para llegar donde tiene el negocio camina 30 minutos y cierra a las 7:00 PM.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar jabón, detergentes, 4 quintales de frijol, 3 de arroz, 4 de azúcar, 20 galones de aceite, 6 quintales de maíz, 20 fardos de papel y más.

Él sueña con comprar un solar y construir su propia casa ya que hoy vive con sus padres.
texts.en:
Jose is a young man, 22 years old, single and living at home with his parents and a brother.  Due to his family's financial situation, he only studied through 9th grade, leaving school to help his father with household costs.

Jose has worked for six years as a sales clerk at a store.  Before that he worked as a bread maker and in farming.  Jose has had his own store for one year. He gets up at 4 AM; to get to the business location he walks 30 minutes.  He closes the store at 7 PM.

Jose will use the loan to buy soap, detergents, 4 quintals of beans, 3 of rice, 6 of corn, 4 of sugar, 20 gallons of oil, 20 bundles of paper and other items to sell.  (Quintal=about 100 pounds)

Jose dreams of buying a piece of land and building his own house since now he lives with his parents.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergents, 4 quintals of beans, three of rice, 6 of corn, 4 of sugar, 20 gallons of oil, 20 bundles of paper and other items

loans.name: Noranush

texts.en:
Noranush is 48 years old. She is a widow, and she lives with her son. Noranush's daughter is married and lives separately with her family.

For many years, Noranush has worked in farming, with her main crops being wheat, barley and potato. The work is going very well as she has many years' experience and because she always worries about giving her customers the highest quality products. The requested loan of USD 2,100 is very important for Noranush to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer and to hire workers for organizing cultivation work. 

Noranush is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, she will be able to develop her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and fertilizer and to hire workers for organizing cultivation work

loans.name: Madhabi

texts.en:
Madhabi is 27 years old and the proud mother of two very young children. Her son read in grade three and her daughter goes to local nursery school to groom herself for a formal schooling system. Madhabi studied up to class 10 but could not complete her study due to poverty. Now she runs her incense-making business, which may help to make her family's income a little bit higher. With this small business, Madhabi may try to increase their quality of daily life. But the earnings of Madhabi do not always meet every necessary expenditure of her family.

So Madhabi’s husband is associated with a wood business. He purchases wood from the wholesale market and sells it to different furniture shops and to local people.  Now they want to expand their business and decided to take a loan with nominal repayment conditions, which will help them to expand their existing wood business. 

For this reason, Madhabi has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BJS. Since Madhabi’s husband is a well-educated person, he may able to review the present trend of fashion and the current market rate. This will help him to think differently to develop his business with the Kiva loan. Madhabi is thankful to Kiva and BJS. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood to expand her husband’s existing wood business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 44 years old and has a live-in partner with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, detergent soap, coffee, candies, shampoo, noodles, etc. to sell.

She has borrowed and paid back 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Juanita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, detergent soap, coffee, candies, shampoo, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Jacqueline Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 22 años de edad, vive con sus 3 hermanas, su padre y su madrastra ya que su madre propia las abandono desde hace 5 años,  Elena se dedica a la crianza de pollos ya que su tía le enseño a esta actividad, con el dinero del crédito Elena va a comprar pollos para tenerlos y criarlos en un galponcito que construyo con su padre, lo que Elena aspira es seguir adelante con su negocio y ayudarse en los gastos diarios y de ser posible quisiera entrar a la universidad por medio de sus propios esfuerzos ya que a su  padre  no le alcanza lo económico para darles el estudio a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Elena, age 22, lives with her three sisters, her father, and her step-mother.  Her own mother abandoned them five years ago.

Elena raises chickens, and her aunt taught her this business activity.  Elena will use the loan to buy chickens to raise in a chicken coop that her father built.  

Elena aspires to get ahead with her business; to help with the daily expenses; and, if possible, to go to the university through her own efforts.  This is because her father does not financially have enough to give his daughters an education.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Ramisha

texts.en:
Ramisha is an enterprising woman of 41 years from the small village of south Mouyamari in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter) who are students in college and in grade 8. She and her husband Bachchu have an elementary education. Her husband is engaged in vegetable vending in the local market and is hardly able to earn sufficient money to meet all the family's expenses.
 
The poor economic conditions of her family required Ramisha to do something for the sake of her family and she started her milk supply business. Ramisha has a dairy cow. She supplies milk from door to door to her neighbors. In order to increase her business, she needs to purchase one more cow. But the biggest challenge she faces is limited funds.

Ramisha is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. It will produce enough milk to enable her to supply more and satisfy her customers. With this expanded business, she will be able to earn more.  So she has decided to take a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS.  The loan will greatly help her to organize her business in more useful ways. Ramisha wants to help her husband economically and try to contribute in an effective way to educate her children properly.

She gives her heartfelt thanks to her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her existing milk supply business.

loans.name: Freddy Noel

texts.es: Freddy combina su carrera de Contabilidad con sus cursos de inglés. Tiene 21 años y está soltero. A Freddy le gustan los números y siente que cada día aprende algo nuevo en su carrera. Su hermana lo apoya en sus estudios e igual se apoya de remesas que recibe de su familia. Solicita el préstamo para retomar sus cursos de inglés y comprarse una computadora. Los cursos le serán de mucha ayuda ya que podrá hablar otro idioma y la computadora también le ayudara ya que usa diversos sistemas contables en su clase. Dentro de sus planes futuros está terminar su carrera y desempeñarse como profesional en el mundo laboral.
texts.en:
Freddy combines his accounting studies with English courses.  He is 21 years old and single.  Freddy likes numbers, and he feels that he learns something new in his studies each day.

His sister supports his education, and he receives the support of remittances from his family.

He is requesting the loan to once again take up with his English courses and to buy a computer.  The courses will be a great help because he will be able to speak another language.  The computer will also help him because he uses different accounting systems in his class.

His plans for the future include finishing his degree and practicing as a professional in the working world.

loans.use: to take English classes and to buy a computer.

loans.name: Ratna

texts.en:
Ratna is a 51-year-old widow who lives in Kathalbari village in Jalpaiguri district. She studied up to grade 10 and she has only one son who is now engaged in a small service. To run the family smoothly and to establish her son in life, Ratna started her own dairy business.

Ratna has been actively involved in the dairy business. She supplies milk to her neighbors to generate additional income for the family. Now she wants to expand her business and satisfy the demands of her customers. But the major challenge she faces is a lack of business resources that make dairy farmers more fruitful.

To solve this problem, Ratna is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via BJS to purchase an additional dairy cow. Having an extra cow will provide her with a lot of realistic profit.  She will be able to produce more milk and increase her sales volume. Also, she will manage her savings for her future from these additional earnings.

She gives her sincere thanks to her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her existing business .

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 28 years old and married.  She has four children and three of them are currently in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lorena requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lorena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Chikondi Group

texts.en:
Marita and Harod are husband and wife; together they have four children who go to school. Marita operates a grocery store, selling assorted items, and is requesting this loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase various goods in bulk from wholesale shops to satisfy her customers' needs.

She started this business to improve her family's living standards and to be able to pay school fees for her children. Marita plans to use any profit generated to expand her business by adding stock that is not currently available, such as milk and soft drinks. 

Marita also hopes to have enough food for her family throughout the year. Before she started the business she was unable to support her family, and now she has managed to buy solar lights for her home and is independent.

loans.use: To buy assorted groceries.

loans.name: Vughose

texts.en:
Vughose is married and a mother of six, living in a five-room house in Bamenda, North West region of Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life, among them are inadequate finances to pay the children’s school fees, being attacked by thieves and the death of her twin sister.
 
With this new loan requested, she will buy three-week-old chicks and feed for her fowl. She will also buy farm supplies such as bean seeds, corn, and yams. Part of the loan will be used to buy fertilizer for her farm. 

Vughose holds a positive view of this business succeeding because of her good farm and a good road linking the farm and the market. Also, the demand for food crops is high. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her moderate selling price, and the distance to travel to buy from the market will be reduced. 

With the profit made from this loan, she will expand her business, pay her children’s school fees, provide medication for her family and save some in order to undertake a bigger investment.

She prefers a GHAPE loan because of the low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and also because the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy fowl, seeds, fertilizer, and feed for the fowl.

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Forty-two-year-old Jayanti is a woman of courage and strength. She is a day laborer. She hails from Maynaguri. She is married with two children (a son and a daughter). They live in a small village called Khagrabari in Jalpaiguri district.

Jayanti's husband is a cycle-van puller whose income is hardly sufficient for the family. So, to help her husband financially, Jayanti works as a day laborer. But this is not sufficient to support her family financially. So she wants to purchase a cow and sell cow milk to her neighbors. By running her own business, she can manage to generate more money and be able to support her family and save for a secure future. However, this ambitious and energetic lady does not want to stop here; she wants to expand her business by selling milk products like butter, curd and cottage cheese.

Jayanti seeks a loan from BJS to buy a dairy cow. With this business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Jayanti will be able to reach her goal, which includes providing a better education to her children to reach to a successful future and ensure her financial stability.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 48 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Marcelina is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Janaki

texts.en:
Janaki is a young woman from Maynaguri.  She is only 27 years old, married and a mother of one little son.  She is married to Lakshindra, a 39-year-old car driver.  They live in a South Khagrabari village in the district of Jalpaiguri, West Bengal. Janaki is engaged in farming. She is a homemaker, looks after her child, does all the household work and in her spare time, she cultivates to support her husband financially.

She has been doing the work of agriculture for many years. She grows different vegetables, rice and fruit and sells them in the local market.  To cope with the growing price increase in essential commodities, she needs to cultivate more crops.  Thus, she decided to cultivate potatoes on their farmland because the vegetable is in high demand in the market. Also, potatoes are a very profitable crop, so she decided to cultivate potatoes to earn more profit. 

In order to purchase seeds, insecticides and pesticides, Janaki applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). This would help her to grow more crops, which will ultimately help in generating more income. This way, she can increase the profitability of her business and ensure her financial stability so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life and a better education for her child to reach a successful future. She thanks her lenders for their help.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 47 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 1 child. He has a hotel business which he has been running for the past 5 years. 

He plans to use this loan to buy more stock of milk, sugar, rice, beans and cooking oil for use in his business. This will enable him to serve more customers well and thereby make more income. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loans well. His future hopes are to grow his business and be successful, make more income and have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy food stock for his business.

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti, age 26, is a married woman.  She is from Maynaguri . She is a day laborer who is blessed with two children. One of her children reads in grade two and the other is too young to go to school. She lives in the small village of Khalpara in Jalpaiguri district with her family. Jayanti and her husband attended school until grade six. But they want to provide a higher education to their children. But due to a lack of money, they cannot afford that. 

Her husband Dipak is a cycle-van puller, rented from a local owner. His income is too scant. From the beginning, they have faced many problems running the family. Then Jayanti came to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and took a loan to purchase a cycle-van for her husband. Like a rickshaw and an auto rickshaw, a cycle van is one kind of transport to carry people from one place to another, especially in rural areas. They hope their financial condition will improve from their earlier situation.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for giving the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van for her husband.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is married and a mother of three children. They live in a two bedroom house in Bamenda in the North West region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are the death of an uncle, as well as having inadequate finances to start a business or to provide her family's needs.

With this new loan requested, she will buy cassava and ginger tubers and yellow yams to cultivate, and also day old chicks, feed and vaccine for her chickens. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has a good business location for selling her crops, she has regular customers, and she also has a vast area of land for the cultivation of her food crops. 

With this farming activity, the community will benefit from her moderate selling prices, and also because she will reduce food shortages in the community.

With the profit made from this loan, she will expand her business, pay her children's school fees, provide medication for her family, pay for a plot of land, plow some of the profits back into the business, and also save some in order to undertake a bigger investment. 

Racheal prefers a GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also because the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy cassava and ginger tubers and yellow yams to cultivate, and to buy day old chicks and feed for them.

loans.name: Tukolerehamwe Group

texts.en: Zeridah, a member of this group, is a widow and hardworking. Her daughter, who is in her last year of college, is stranded because of lack of tuition. Having no collateral, Zeridah could not borrow money from any bank, nor did she have a relative to borrow from. Her friend advised her to join the group that helped to guarantee her for the loan. She is forever grateful for the rescue. Her daughter will be able to graduate.

loans.use: To pay tuition.

loans.name: José Wilian

texts.es:
José de 24 años de edad, estudió hasta 7° grado, dejó la escuela para dedicarse al trabajo en la agricultura, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a vender frutas en los buses, tienen 2 hijos y uno ya está en el kinder.


José desde hace 2 años trabaja en una tienda repartiendo gas, fue la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia la que lo llevó a buscar este empleo, antes trabajaba  en la agricultura con su papá pero llegó esta nueva oportunidad y no la desaprovechó, él se levanta a las 5:30 AM para hacer algo en casa antes de irse a sus labores, para llegar a donde labora tiene que caminar un kilómetro, entra a las 7:00 AM y sale 5:00 PM.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar una docena de lámina y reparar la casa y con el resto comprará una motocicleta para conducirse a su trabajo.  

Su sueño es tener una casa propia ya que hoy vive en casa de un familiar y tener 3 vacas pues siempre le ha gustado el ganado.
texts.en:
Jose is 24 years old. He studied through 7th grade, and dropped out of school to work in agriculture. He is in a relationship, and his partner makes a living selling fruits on buses. They have two children, and one of them is already in kindergarten.

For the past 2 years, Jose has been working in a store distributing gas. The need to move his family forward is what prompted him to look for this job. Before, he worked in agriculture with his father, but he got this new opportunity and did not let it go to waste. He wakes up at 5:30 AM to do things at home before going to work. To get to the place where he works, he has to walk a kilometer. He arrives at 7:00 AM and leaves at 5:00 PM.

He needs a loan to buy a dozen sheets of metal to repair his home. With the rest, he will buy a motorcycle to drive to work. His dream is to have his own house, since they currently live in the house of a family member, and to have 3 cows because he has always liked cattle.

loans.use: to buy a dozen sheets of metal to repair his home. With the rest, he will buy a motorcycle to drive to work.

loans.name: Mamina

texts.en:
Mamina, a 46-year-old housewife, wants to increase her family's income for the smooth running of their daily life, which has become harder day by day. Mamina has three children who are all engaged as daily laborers to earn more and more. Mamina is literate but due to poor financial condition, she was not able to send her children to school.

Mamina’s husband is the key breadwinner for their family and by pulling a cycle-van, he tried to earn income enough to run his family successfully. To increase his income, they thought of buying one rickshaw for him but they were constrained by the lack of enough funds. So they decided to take a loan from Kiva via BJS and improved their daily income by pulling the rickshaw every day.

Mamina gives thanks to BJS and Kiva because they provided a sustainable asset that not only helps them at present but in the near future also. A fruitful investment makes Mamina and her family happy and relaxed and now they are capable of saving something for them and for their children’s future.

loans.use: To purchase a rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, none of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other family member. She lives in a rented house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and rent.

She has been selling fruits and vegetables from the market at retail prices for five years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

Susan has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT- SACCO to stock more avocado, tomatoes, oranges, pineapples and watermelon to sell. Her challenges include thieves and her products' short life span. 

Her dream is to acquire land and plant avocado trees and other fruits. She joined MCDT because of the low interest charged on their loans.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, oranges, watermelon, avocado and pineapples.

loans.name: Chrislie

texts.en:
Chrislie is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Chrislie is 37 years old and has four children who are currently in school. She has a business of selling ready to wear clothing in the Philippines and has been in this business for 5 years.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready to wear clothing to sell. In the future, Chrislie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready to wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Athman

texts.en:
Athman is 33 years old and single. He has a barber shop and has been in this business for the past 5 years. He also sells movies and phone charging services and it has been profitable. 

He plans to use this loan to buy shaving machines, hair cream and hair oil for use in his business. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to grow his business, make more income, and be successful.

loans.use: to buy shaving machines.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Emelda requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Emelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Githunguri United Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Leah, a member of Githunguri United Women Group. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. She is 48 years old, married and blessed with four children.

Leah earns her living by practicing vegetable farming. After being trained by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa she acquired skills on better ways of managing and improving her farming business. She is requesting a loan to purchase farm inputs such as pesticide and fertilizer. She hopes her income will improve so she can use the anticipated profits to pay for her children's education.

Leah appreciates Kiva and their lenders for the loan and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Fausta lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children who all go to school. She is not looking after any other family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and rent.

She has been selling fruits and vegetables from the market at retail for 6 years, working 7 days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

Fausta has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT- SACCO to be able to buy more stock of avocado fruits, tomatoes, oranges, pineapples and watermelon. Her challenges include thieves and their short life span. 

She joined MCDT to save money and because of the low interest charged on loans. Her dream is to acquire a plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more stock of avocado fruits, tomatoes, oranges, pineapples and watermelon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy five trammel nets.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.pt:
A senhora  Virginia é pensionista e comerciante de 51 anos de idade viuva mae de 5 filhos 3 dos quais ja sao independentes e os restantes 2 frequentam o ensino primario nao sustenta mais ninguem alem dos filhos  vive na casa propria.
O valor do empréstimo irá efectuar o pagamento de uma carruagem para transportar produtos do campo para a vila onde vive para o reforco do seu negocio.
Tem como projectos e sonhos crescer no seu negocio responder todas as necessidades de seus clientes e terminar a construcao de sua casa e formar seus filhos.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros  e faz xitique (poupanca rotativas) como forma de guardar o seu dinheiro e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Virginia is a pensioner and a vendor. She's 51 years old and a widow. She has five children, three of whom are already independent and the other two are in elementary school. She doesn't support anyone else other than her children, and she lives in a house that she owns.
With the amount of the loan she will pay for a carriage to transport merchandise from the countryside to the village where she lives. That way she'll stock her business.
Her projects and dreams are to make her business grow, meet all of her customers' needs, finish building her house and see her children graduate.
She states that the main challenges she has faced are financial. She also states that she uses rotating credit as a way of saving her money, and that she'll apply for more loans so she can achieve her plan.

loans.use: to pay for a carriage to transport merchandise.

loans.name: Moises Antonio

texts.es:
Moises de 35 años de edad, agricultor. Su esposa se dedicada a los oficios domésticos de su hogar y son padres de 3 hijos. 

 Moises se dedica a la agricultura desde muy joven, hoy para la temporada se ha dedicado a la siembra de maíz, maicillo y el frijol. Este trabajo le permite llevar lo que es el sustento al hogar. Ademas de esta labor tan importante tambien tiene un trabajo formal con una empresa privada en la que trabaja desde hace 2 años el se encuentra en el área de mantenimiento de infraestructura.

El dinero del crédito lo utilizara para comprar herbicidas, pesticidas, formula y sulfato para sus cultivos.

El objetivo principal de Moises es mantener su trabajo formal,  porque este le permitirá brindarle una mejor educación a sus hijos de igual forma dice que siempre seguirá cultivando la tierra pues es un medio de sustento que le permite garantizar la seguridad alimentaria de su familia.
texts.en:
Moises is a 35-year-old farmer. His wife performs household chores, and they are parents to 3 children. Moises has been making a living in agriculture from an early age. During this current season, he has been growing corn, sorghum, and beans. This job allows him to take home the daily bread. In addition to this very important work, he also has a formal job with a private company, where he has been working for the past 2 years. He works in the infrastructure maintenance department.

He will use the money from the loan to buy herbicides, pesticides, fertilizers, and sulfate for his crops. Moises's main goal is to keep his formal job, for this will allow him to give his children a better education. Nevertheless, he says that he will always continue cultivating the land because it is a livelihood that allows him to guarantee food security for his family.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, pesticides, fertilizers, and sulfate for his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional pigs.

loans.name: Margarida

texts.pt:
A senhora  Margarida é professora de 37 anos de idade casada mae de 3 filhos 1 frequenta o ensino secundario e 2 frequentam o ensino primario nao sustenta mais ninguem alem dos filhos  vive na casa propria.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento,  barrote chapas de zinco varoes para dar continuidade a sua obra .
Tem como projectos terminar sua obra para dar um lar condigno a sua familia.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros e  que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Margarida is a 37-year-old teacher. She's married and has three children, one of whom is in secondary school and two are in primary school. She doesn't support anyone else other than her children, and she lives in a house that she owns.
With the amount of the loan she'll purchase cement, beams, zinc plates, and rods so that she can continue the construction work.
Her projects are to finish the construction work and provide a decent home for her family.
She states that the main challenges she's been facing are financial. She also states that she will apply for more loans in order to achieve her plan.

loans.use: to purchase cement, beams, zinc plates and rods.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy lives in Kampala, Uganda and is married with seven children, three attend school. She is not looking after any other family members.

She has sold fruit and vegetables from the market for five years and works seven days a week. She earns additional income from poultry farming.

She has requested 300,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to buy bags of charcoal and bunches of green bananas. Her challenges include transportation costs and perishing products. Her dream is to build for room for poultry farming. She joined MCDT because of low interest charged on loans and to save money. 

She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 61 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Estrella has borrowed and repaid twenty loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elvira Leonor

texts.es:
Elvira de 45 años de edad, estudió hasta 5º grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y con ganado de repasto, tienen 5 hijos de los cuales 3 están estudiando y 2 trabajan junto con su padre, por lo que son 3 personas que dependen económicamente de Elvira.

Elvira actualmente tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad en su casa, tiene 15 años de ejercer esta actividad, además ha trabajado en comprar y vender mariscos y lo aprendió de sus padres que eran pescadores. En el negocio de la tienda le ayudan sus hijos, horario de trabajo no tiene ya que a la hora que llegan los clientes ella los atiende.

El dinero del préstamo sera utilizado para comprar mercadería para surtir su tienda y así obtener mayores ingresos económicos, pues hay momentos que no vende porque no tiene productos suficientes.

Los sueños de Elvira son darles el estudio que ella no tuvo a sus hijos y así ellos puedan tener una mejor oportunidad de trabajo, ademas desea tener una tienda fuerte que le puedan generar suficientes recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Elvira is 45 years old and studied up to Grade 5. She is married and her husband works in agriculture with cattle. She has 5 children, 3 of whom are studying and the other two work with their father. So 3 people are economically dependent on Elvira.

Elvira presently has a store selling basic need items in her house. She has been in this business for 15 years and she also works buying and selling sea-foods. She learned this from her parents who were fishermen. Her children help her with the store. She has no schedule as she takes care of the customers when they come to her store.

The money from the loan will be used to buy merchandise to stock her store so she will generate greater economic income. There are times when when she doesn't sell as she doesn't have enough product. Elvira's dreams are to provide the education that she never had to her children so that they have better employment opportunities. She also wants to have a robust store that can generate sufficient economic resources.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Veronika, a young farmer from the village of Meghrashat, lives with her parents-in-law, husband, and young son.
 
Veronika's husband and father-in-law are migrant workers in a neighboring country. She and her mother-in-law take care of their family farm. They keep cows, calves, sheep, and hens. They also grow barley and wheat.  Veronika and her mother-in-law  prepare for the coming winter season and request 3,000 USD to develop the farm. She plans to purchase wheat and barley seeds and feed for the livestock. 

This hard working woman relies on lenders' goodwill and hopes to receive their support.

loans.use: to pay for wheat, barley seeds and feed for  the livestock.

loans.name: Jhumpa

texts.en:
Jhumpa is a 28-year-old rural woman who lives with her husband and two daughters.  She was deprived of an education due to the poor economic resources of her family. She is a homemaker who resides with her husband and daughters in the small village of South Khagrabari in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Her husband Harindra is a 42-year-old farmer who is unassuming and hardworking. He learned to work the fields as a child. This has enabled him to make progress. He grows paddy and vegetables on his farmland. Jhumpa helps her husband in his farm work after managing her household activities, especially at the time of harvesting and selling the produce in the market.

In order to grow their agribusiness, they decided to cultivate potatoes on their farmland as the crop is in high demand in the market. Potatoes are a very profitable crop, so she cultivates more potatoes to earn more profit.  Thus, Jhumpa requested a loan from BJS. With the support of this loan, she will buy agricultural supplies (seeds, chemical and organic fertilizers, pesticides, and other supplies). With these supplies, she will continue to care for her crops and she will get a better harvest, with which she can generate more income when she goes to sell her crops.

With this loan, they will definitely expand their business and increase their income level. Jhumpa is very much hopeful that with the help of the loan, she can prosper with their business.

She appreciates the financial help of her lenders.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers to cultivate potatoes

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia lives in Oecusse and she is a businesswoman so she always finds ways to improve her business. She has a kiosk that she opened a year ago. She started to do business with her own working capital of $ 200.00. 

She wants to adds more items but the money is not enough, so she is requesting a loan of $ 800.00, and she wants use the loan to buy goods to keep in her store such as slippers,  noodles, detergent, biscuits, coffee, sugar, and other things to sell, including soft drinks. Anastacia is taking this loan because she wants to improve her management in the future.

loans.use: To buy slippers,  noodles, detergent, biscuits, coffee, sugar, and other things to sell, Including soft drinks.

loans.name: Banani

texts.en:
Banani is a very young and energetic woman of 29 years.  She is married and a housewife.  She is blessed with three daughters who are students in different grades in secondary school.
