Banani attended school up to grade eight and could not continue pursue any further education due to the poverty of her parents. She lives with her husband Chandan and her daughters in the small village of Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri district.

Banani's husband has a business farming paddy and selling his crops in the local market.  As rice is the staple food for the local people, this is a lucrative business.  He works hard on his land and Banani helps him, especially at the time of harvesting and selling the products in the market. They already have had the business for more than five years and it is going well.  Now they want to expand the business further.

Banani is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to buy fertilizers and seeds for farming.  She says this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demands. This improvement in the business will supply an additional profit, with which Banani wants to fulfill her goals.  She wants to give financial security to her family and provide better education to her daughters.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, seeds and other agricultural inputs to cultivate paddy.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza is a farmer from Sapang Dalaga. She felt she had found the right place when she joined Paglaum MPC. She took a loan for the next farming season. She borrowed to purchase farm supplies and fertilizer to increase her farm's production. Liza works hard and always believes she will reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and fertilizer to increase farm production.

loans.name: Luis

texts.pt:
O senhor Luis é militar e comerciante, casado pai de 7 filhos a estudarem sustentanta tambem um sobrinho vive na casa propria.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar arroz, acucar em sacos, acucar embalagens para reforcar o seu negocio.
Tem como projectos e sonhos crescer no seu negocio responder todas as necessidades de seus clientes e construir uma mercearia maior e comprar uma viatura para facilitar nas deslocacoes para o negocio.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros  e faz xitique (poupanca tradicional) como forma de guardar o seu dinheiro e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Luis is a serviceman and a vendor. He's married and has seven children who are in school. He also supports a nephew. He lives in a house that he owns.
With the amount of the loan he'll purchase rice, bags of sugar, and packets of sugar in order to stock his business.
His projects and dreams are to make his business grow, meet all of his customers' needs, build a larger grocery store, and buy a vehicle to make it easier for him to commute to his business.
He states that the main challenges he's been facing are financial. He also states that he uses rotating credit as a way of saving his money, and that he will apply for more loans so that he can achieve his plan.

loans.use: to purchase rice, bags of sugar, and packets of sugar.

loans.name: Vergine

texts.en:
Vergine  lives in the village of Zuygaghbyur  in the  Shirak region. She lives with her daughter-in-law and three grandchildren. Her only son has migrated to  the Russian Federation in hopes of finding a well paying job to financially support his family. 

Vergine runs their family farm and her daughter-in-law takes care of the household and children. 

Vergine raises sheep, cows, calves, and hens and grows potatoes and cabbage. 

She will use 2,000 USG to purchase a calf and feed for the livestock. 

She will be very thankful to the lenders for their support and trust.

loans.use: to purchase a calf and feed for the livestock.

loans.name: Erias

texts.en:
Erias is a 32-year-old Ugandan male who is married to Kyomuhendo Rose.   They have three children who are 10, 7 and 4 years old.Two attend school. 

The major business for Erias is transportation he is a boda boda (motorcycle taxi) rider. He supplements his income through farming. He has applied for a loan of 1,800,000 UGZ from Ugafode to buy a motorcycle.  He hopes to repay the loan in a short time. He hopes to create employment and increase his income. 

His plans for the future include acquiring more land and buying another motorcycle. He faces challenges of poor roads and mechanical breakdowns. He is hard working and innovative.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Maa Samaleswari Group

texts.en:
Maa Samaleswari is a Self Help Group (SHG) formed in August 2014 by nine active women entrepreneurs of Chanabeda village of Nuapada district in Odisha, India. The main objective of forming this SHG is to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their existing business. 

Puspamanjari, the simple but confident lady, is one of them who hails from a poor, landless family. The lady standing with her hand raised in the photo is Puspamanjari. She is twenty-eight years old and lives with her husband and a son of four years.

Puspamanjari has been running a pressed paper plate and bowl making unit in her house for last five years with the help and support of her husband. Now she has two paper plate pressing machines. She supplies her products to the retailers of the nearest town and other villages in a ten mile radius. 

She purchases raw materials like paper and polythene from the nearest whole sale market, 200 kilometers away, on a monthly basis.  She gets a monthly income of 5000 INR  from the above business. Out of this income she is hardly able to manage her household and business expenses. 

For her quality product and timely delivery the demand of her unit is increasing day by day. But she is unable to meet the demands of the customers due to insufficient production. So she wants to expand her business by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. From the present loan, Puspamanjari has planned to purchase bulk of raw materials and purchase another press machine for making plastic glass. 

She assumes, apart from getting additional income, this will also help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs as well as attract more customers. Puspamanjari hopes to save enough to build a workshop for her business and provide a better education of her son. 

The other eight members of the group are doing milk business, general store, chart and fry gram selling, rice vending and sugarcane juice selling.

loans.use: To purchase bulk paper  and another press machine for making plastic glass

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en: Domingas is requesting a loan of US $1,200 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies to sell in her kiosk such as water, sardines, biscuits, lighters, candies, and cigarettes. Domingas opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital of US $300. She is happy with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to increase her working capital to buy more goods. She hopes to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy water, sardines, biscuits, lighters, candies, cigarettes and other things to sell.

loans.name: Kabita

texts.en:
Kabita is a very young woman of only 19 years.  She lives with her husband and one little daughter in the small village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She studied up to grade 10 and got married at a tender age due to her parents' poor economic resources.  Her husband Gautam is a farmer of 26 years. They have a small kachha house (made of straw, bamboo and mud).

Kabita's husband has been involved in vegetable farming for a long time. He has a small plot of land where he cultivates different crops and sells them in the market. He started with a limited supply of vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes, beans, etc. He has developed a very good relationship with his customers as he sells fresh and high quality vegetables.  Now he has a new idea to do paddy cultivation, for which he needs capital.

So, Kabita has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner).  The loan will help her purchase paddy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. She hopes to get a good profit from this new business to reach her goals to strengthen the family's economy.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase the necessary agricultural inputs to cultivate paddy rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is 56 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Lida works very hard to provide for them.

Lida's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Lida needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 9,092 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Lida is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling shellfish in the Philippines, and earns additional income from selling fish.  Evelyn is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish and shellfish to sell.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and shellfish to sell.

loans.name: Mariannie

texts.en:
Mariannie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct sales products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more products like detergent soap, body spray, and blouses to sell.

Mariannie has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from selling frozen foods.

Mariannie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products like detergent soap, body spray, and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 50 years old and married with nine children, two of whom are in school. Marilou works very hard to provide for them.
 
Marilou's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Marilou is taking out a bridge loan to restart her dried fish vending business.

Marilou has requested PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF.

She is using the new loan to purchase additional stock for her business. 

Marilou is committed to rebuilding, and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Tamin Ampah

texts.en:
Tamin is a second year student at the Methodist University College, a private tertiary in Ghana. He is studying  banking and finance. He requests this loan to pay his tuition fees and rent an apartment.

Prior to this loan, he paid his fees with his personal savings.

His inspiration comes from his branch manager because of his humble beginnings and how he was able to become one of the top five managers in his company.

Completion of his studies would enhance his skills and help him earn more money to support himself and family, and also be a blessing to others.

“Ghana is a great country with vast economic potential which encourages investors to come and invest in  mining, agriculture, and education. I also want to thank the investors of this initiative for the good work they are doing to help see dreams come true”, he says.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and rent.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  goats, saws,  and feed.

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.pt: O Senhor Alexandre é casado e vive com a esposa e 2 filhas.  Ele é policia. Com o presente empréstimo quer adquirir mercadorias para revender tais como cervejas trazidas da vizinha Africa do sul. Tem  sonho de continuar com os negocios e abrir um estabelecimento comercial. Tem como desafios  terminar o presente emprestimo e beneficiar-se de varios outros
texts.en: Alexandre is married and lives with his wife and two daughters. He's a police officer. With the current loan he wishes to purchase merchandise for re-selling, such as beer brought in from neighboring South Africa. His dream is to move forward with his business and open a store. His challenges are repaying the current loan and applying for many others.

loans.use: to purchase beer for re-selling.

loans.name: Caetano

texts.pt:
O senhor  Caetano é militar de 58 anos de idade casado pai de  5 filhos  dos quais 2 a estudar 2 ja sao  independentes nao sustenta mais ninguem alem dos filhos  vive na casa do servico.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento em quantidade para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Tem como projectos e sonhos  terminar a construcao de sua casa adquirir uma viatura para uso pessoal
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros  e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Caetano is a serviceman. He's 58 years old and married. He has five children, two of whom study and two are already independent. He doesn't support anyone else other than his children. He lives in military housing.
With the amount of the loan he'll purchase cement in bulk so that he can continue the construction work.
His projects and dreams are to finish building his house and buy a vehicle for personal use.
He states that the main challenges he's been facing are financial. He also states that he'll apply for more loans in order to achieve his plan.

loans.use: to purchase cement.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cecile is 32 years old--both of her children are in school.

Cecile has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fruit and root vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Cecile has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and root vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She is taking a $600 loan because she wants to buy additional supplies such as coffee, sugar, cigarettes, tofu, eggs, candies, sardines, perfume, cooking oils, milk and beverages to sell. 

Francisca has been in business since 2003 with her own working capital of $300. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. She hopes to run a bigger store in the future.

loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar, cigarettes, tofu, eggs, candies, sardines, perfume, cooking oils, milk, beverages and other things to sell.

loans.name: Nurije

texts.en:
Nurije (wife) and Serret (husband)  seek your financial help of 50,000 ALL to make emergency home repairs. They have three children and recently retired.  

They have been living under difficult situations at home where it has been very cold these past days. In their city and region, it is extremely cold and snowy. The winter is almost seven months long and the summer is very chilly. “Being old and living in the cold is very difficult. We hope that lenders will understand our situation and help us,” said Nurije. 

Kindly notes that they have been VisionFund Albania clients for a very long time in good standarding.

loans.use: to make repairs to their house.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.pt:
A senhora Violeta  é enfermeira  tem de 54 anos de idade  mae viuva  de  4 filhos  um a estudar  os restantes ja sao maiores de idade sustenta tambem dois netos que vivem com ela e vive na casa propria.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, varoes,  chapas de zinco, barrotes, fechaduras, areia para dar continuidade a costrucao de sua casa.
Tem como projectos e sonhos  terminar a construcao de sua casa, mobilar e continuar a sustentar os estudos de sua filho.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros, diz ainda que tem uma conta onde faz depositos  mensais para poupar o seu dinheiro e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Violeta is a 45-year-old nurse. She's a widowed mother of four children, one of whom is in school and the others are already adults. She also supports two grandchildren who live with her. She lives in a house that she owns.
With the amount of the loan she'll purchase cement, rods, zinc plates, beams, locks, and sand in order to continue building her house.
Her projects and dreams are to finish building her house, furnish it, and continue to support her children's studies.
She states that the main challenges she's been facing are financial, and that she has an account in which she makes monthly deposits to save her money. She also states that she'll apply for more loans so that she can achieve her plan.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rods, zinc plates, beams, locks, and sand.

loans.name: Nikoll

texts.en:
NIkoll is a 63-year-old villager shown with his turkeys in the background.  He requests a  loan to buy feed. 

Nikoll is married and has one living child.  His oldest son passed way in a tragic accident  two years ago. He raises turkeys to earn an income.  He has almost 1500 turkeys. He sells the turkeys to the supermarkets in the capital city. He is happy with his business and the money he earns.

Almost all villagers in his region raise turkeys as a primary source of income and also raise goats, cows and sheep.

loans.use: to buy food for his 1,500 turkeys.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in colored threads, pieces of smooth fabric, etc.

loans.name: Rabeca

texts.pt:
A senhora Rabeca  é comerciante  tem de 48 anos de idade  mae solteira de  5 filhos dos quais  3 a estudar um no nivel primario e restantes ja sao maiores de idade alem do filho sustenta dois netos que vivem com elas ela vive na casa propria.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, varoes,  chapas de zinco, barrotes, pranchas, areia para dar continuidade a costrucao de um casa de banho melhorada.
Tem como projectos e sonhos  terminar a construcao de sua casa de banho, fazer um muro de vedacao de seu quintal.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros  e saturacao do mercado, diz ainda que faz xitiques como forma de poupar o seu dinheiroe que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Rabeca is a 48-year-old vendor. She's a single mother of five children, three of whom study - one is in elementary school - and the others are already adults. Aside from her son, she also supports two grandchildren who live with her. She lives in a house that she owns.
With the amount of the loan she'll purchase cement, rods, zinc plates, beams, planks, and sand in order to continue building a nicer bathroom.
Her projects and dreams are to finish building her bathroom and build a fence wall around her yard.
She states that the main challenges she's been facing are her finances and an overcrowded market. She also states that she uses rotating credit as a way of saving her money, and that she'll apply for more loans so she can achieve her plan.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rods, zinc plates, beams, planks, and sand.

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lucia de 45 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de uso personal desde hace 21 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas ropa y productos (perfumes, desodorantes, lociones, cremas, etc.) todo por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Lucia, who is 45 years old, has been selling clothing and products for personal use for 21 years. Her business is located in her place of residence. She lives in her own house along with her life companion and their two children. She is applying for a loan to be able to buy more clothing and personal products (perfumes, deodorants, lotions, creams, etc.), all at wholesale, in order to continue with her sales and thus be able to have a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and personal products (perfumes, deodorants, lotions, creams, etc.), all at wholesale

loans.name: Ndue

texts.en:
Ndue is a villager and father with six children.  He lives in northern Albania and requests a loan to buy a dairy cow.

Ndue   has been doing agriculture/livestock to earn a living for very long time.  He has an  older, non-milk producing cow, one saw, and twenty chickens. He sells eggs and piglets to the local market.  In addition to the animals/poultry business,  he grows corn, beans, onions, and seasonal vegetables. 

 He is happy with what he does.

loans.use: to buy a new dairy cow.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a 56-year-old married woman who works very hard to provide for her family.

She has run a general store for 23 years and requests 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo and groceries.

In the future Alicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo and groceries to sel.l

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel works hard to support her family and has had a chain saw operator business for 10 years.

Maricel requests  8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a chainsaw for her business.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw.

loans.name: Marte

texts.en:
Marte is a villager and mother of seven children.  She wants to purchase tiles for her home.  

She is in agriculture and livestock to earn a living. She raises pigs and chickens and sells piglets, eggs, and hens.  She has  land and plants seasonal vegetables , has grapevines, and sells fresh produce. 

She lives with her younger son who contributes financially and works in a copper plant.

loans.use: to purchase tiles for her damaged family home.

loans.name: Laura

texts.pt:
A senhora Laura é assistente geral de vendas e cabelereira  tem de 36 anos de idade  mae de  3 filhos  todos a estudar um no nivel primario e dois no nivel secundario alem do filho sustenta sua mae e uma irma que vive enviando apenas ela vive na casa propria.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, varoes,  chapas de zinco, barrotes, pranchas, areia para dar continuidade a costrucao de um salao de cabeleireiro.
Tem como projectos e sonhos  terminar a construcao de sua casa, ampliar o seu salao como forma de satisfazer as necessidades de seus clientes e tambem fazer uma merceiaria que servira para reforcar a renda familiar.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros  e saturacao do mercado, diz ainda que tem uma conta onde faz depositos  mensais para poupar o seu dinheiro e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Laura is a general sales assistant and a hairdresser. She's 36 years old and has three children, all of whom study - one is in primary school and two are in secondary school. Aside from her children she also supports her mother and a sister by sending them money. She lives in a house that she owns.
With the amount of the loan she'll purchase cement, rods, zinc plates, beams, planks, and sand so that she can continue building a hair salon.
Her projects and dreams are to finish building her house, enlarge her hair salon as a way of meeting her customers' needs, and also build a grocery store which will improve her family's income.
She states that the main challenges she's been facing are her finances and an overcrowded market. She also states that she owns an account in which she makes monthly deposits as a way of saving her money. She reports that she will apply for more loans in order to achieve her plan.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rods, zinc plates, beams, planks, and sand.

loans.name: Raushan

texts.ru: Раушан 46 лет, замужем, многодетная мать 5 детей, дети для Раушан - главная ценность в жизни. Она в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1995 году. Благодаря упорному труду Раушан, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 3 коровы, 50 овец, 4 бычка и 3 лошади. Также земельный надел общей площадью 5,0 ГА, где Раушан выращивает фасоль и клевер. Дополнительно она продает молоко местным жителям. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Раушан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец, корма для скота на сумму 70,000 сом (KGS), 4,000 сом (KGS) будет направленно на сбор урожая фасоли. Доходы от кредита Раушан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Raushan is 46 years old, married, and the mother of a large family: she has five children, who mean everything to her.  Raushan has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture since 1995, and these two activities constitute her family's main source of income.  Thanks to her very hard work, Raushan currently owns three cows, 50 sheep, four young bulls and three horses.  She also grows beans and clover on five hectares of land and sells milk to the local residents.  She makes an average monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners and requested a loan of 120,000 som (KGS).  Most of the money will be used to purchase 10 sheep, but she will also allocate 70,000 som (KGS) to the purchase of livestock feed and 4,000 som (KGS) to the beans harvest.  Raushan plans to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further developing her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep, some feed for her livestock, and to harvest beans.

loans.name: Deysi Yolanda

texts.es:
Deysi de 49 años de edad, estudió hasta 5º grado ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y no podían darle mas estudio, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a comprar y vender mariscos, tienen 3 hijos que ya están casados por lo que nadie depende económicamente de Deysi.


Deysi actualmente se dedica a comprar y vender mariscos y lo ha hecho toda su vida, ya que vive en la zona costera y es una de las principales fuentes de ingresos, ella se traslada ½ kilometro a pie para poder llegar hasta la playa que es donde obtiene los mariscos para la venta, horario de trabajo no tiene ya que se levanta muy temprano a realizar sus actividades diarias.


El dinero del préstamo lo necesita para comprar láminas ya que el techo de su casa esta en muy mal estado.

Sus sueños son tener una vivienda digna donde poder vivir su vejez, además de tener una tienda en su casa y ya no tener que salir a vender a la calle.
texts.en:
Deysi, who is 49 years old, went to school through 5th grade, since her parents were of scarce economic resources and weren't able to give her more education. She is in a relationship, and her partner buys and sells seafood. They have three children who are already married, and so no one depends on Deysi economically.

Deysi now buys and sells seafood, and she has done this all her life, since she lives in a coastal zone and it is one of the principal sources of income. She travels half a kilometer on foot to arrive at the beach, which is where she obtains the seafood to sell. She doesn't have a work schedule, since she gets up very early to do her daily tasks.

She needs the money from the loan to buy metal sheeting, since the roof of her house is in very bad condition.

Her dreams are to have a dignified house to be able to live in in her old age and in addition to have a store in her house, so that she won't have to go out to sell on the street.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, since the roof of her house is in very bad condition

loans.name: Rui

texts.pt:
O senhor  Rui é seguranca de 54 anos de idade  pai de  1 filho a estudar  sustenta 2 sobrinhos enviando lhes dinheiro e vive na casa propria.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, varroes,  chapas de zinco, barrotes, pranchas, areia para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Tem como projectos e sonhos  terminar a construcao de sua casa, fazer dependencia para puder trazer suas sobrinhas e arrendar para reforcar a renda familiar.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros  e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Rui is a 54-year-old security guard. He has a son who's in school, and he supports two nephews by sending them money. He lives in a house that he owns.
With the amount of the loan he'll purchase cement, rods, zinc plates, beams, planks, and sand in order to continue his construction work.
His projects and dreams are to finish building his house and build more rooms. That way he can bring his nieces to live with him and rent out rooms as a way of improving his family's income.
He states that the main challenges he's been facing are financial. He also states that he'll apply for more loans so that he can achieve his plan.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rods, zinc plates, beams, planks, and sand.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 44 years old and has three children, all attend school. Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

She has run a general store for 2 years and requests 5,000  PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo, sugar, and salt to sell.

In the future Rosita would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, sugar, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 21 years old and  has two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She has run a general store for 1 year and requests 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy  shampoo, sugar, and groceries to sell.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, sugar, and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.pt:
O senhor  Ivan é seguranca de 24 anos de idade casado pai de  1 filho  ainda menor  nao sustenta mais ninguem alem do filho  vive na casa propria.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, varroes,  chapas de zinco, barrotes, pranchas, areia para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Tem como projectos e sonhos  terminar a construcao da sua casa adquirir uma viatura para uso pessoal
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros  e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano e que alem desta actividade presta servicos como tecnico de informatica.
texts.en:
Ivan is a 24-year-old security guard. He's married and has a son who's still underage. He lives in a house that he owns, and he doesn't support anyone else other than his son.
With the amount of the loan he'll purchase cement, rods, zinc plates, beams, planks, and sand in order to continue his construction work.
His projects and dreams are to finish building his house and buy a vehicle for personal use.
He states that the main challenges he's been facing are financial. He also states that he'll apply for more loans so he can achieve his plan. He reports that aside from his job he also provides services as an IT technician.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rods, zinc plates, beams, planks, and sand.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es: Doña Cruz de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 21 años, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la calidad de su trabajo, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Doña Cruz esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de  telas de varios colores, hilos, agujas, zíperes, botones, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Cruz is 49 years old, living in her own home with her life partner, she has worked in dressmaking for 21 years, has a lot of customers due to the good prices and quality of her work. With what she makes from her earnings she manages to meet the costs of her home.

Cruz is requesting a loan to buy fabric of various colors, thread, needles, zippers, buttons, etc. to be able to continue her work and thus have better income.

loans.use: to buy fabric of various colors, thread, needles, zippers, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Katsele

texts.en:
Katsele is 35 years old, married and has no children. She sells fish in Mombasa town and has been in this business for 13 years. 

She will use this loan to buy more stocks of fish to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. 

This is her second loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she successfully repaid her previous loan. In future she hopes to grow her business, make more income and open other businesses.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish fo sell.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Daisy works hard to support her family.

She has a business  selling food supplements in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready to wear clothes. Daisy is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more food supplement products to sell to her customers for her business.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more products of food supplements to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Seynep

texts.ru: Сейнеп 59 лет, вдова, есть взрослый сын. У Сейнеп - среднее образование, сейчас на пенсии. На данный момент пенсии не хватает на содержание семьи, поэтому Сейнеп занимается сельским хозяйством, в качестве дополнительного дохода. Стартовав много лет назад, благодаря упорному труду Сейнеп, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 коров и 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS), однако этих средств катастрофически не хватает Сейнеп на достойную жизнь. Поэтому, в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сейнеп обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец с целью их откорма и дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита позволят Сейнеп развить ее бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Seynep is 59 years old, a widow, and she has an adult son.  She has a secondary education, and is now retired.  At the moment, her pension is not enough to support her family, so she relies on agriculture to make an additional income.  Seynep started in this field many years ago, and thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns five cows and ten sheep.  She makes a monthly income of 5,000 som (KGS), which is vastly insufficient to lead a decent life.  For this reason, and in order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners and requested a loan of 70,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy sheep for fattening and future resale.  The earnings from her loan will allow Seynep to develop her business and to improve the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep for fattening and resale, in order to improve the welfare of her family.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn works hard to support her family. She has had a general store business for 2 years.

She requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase canned goods, eggs, and milk.

In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, eggs,  and milk.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina, a widow, works hard to support her family.  She has had a restaurant business for 14 years.

She requests 20,000 PHP  through NWTF to purchase ingredients .

In the future, Adelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Jomar

texts.en:
Jomar operates a bakery shop and general store. He is 29 years of age and married with one child. The couple has been working hard to increase their profits. Income generated from the business was used to purchased a motorcycle for business purposes. 

Jomar would like his bakery shop and general store to operate in a smooth continuous flow.  That is why he is asking for additional capital of 10,000 PHP to allow him to purchase stocks of grocery items for his store and flours for his bakery business. 

He hopes to borrow the said amount in order to make greater profits. In this way, he could send his child to school and save funds for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for his store and flours for his bakery business.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is 24 years old and  has two children.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Nelfa has run a general store for 2 years. and requests  7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo and  groceries to sell .

She would like to save enough money  to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita works hard to support her family. She is single and has had a candy making business for 15 years.

She requests 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase sugar, cooking oil, and peanuts.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to  purchase sugar, cooking oil, and peanuts.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a widowed woman with twelve children. She is 51 years old and has four children who are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Evangeline has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers.

Evangeline has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 50 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Guillerma works very hard to provide for them.

Guillerma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like coffee, detergent, soap, noodles, shampoo, canned goods, snack foods, juice, etc. to sell.

Guillerma has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, detergent, soap, noodles, shampoo, canned goods, snack foods, juice, etc. 

In the future, Guillerma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of coffee, detergent, soap, noodles, shampoo, canned goods, snack foods, juice, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Salomea

texts.en:
Salomea is 54 years old and married with three children. 

Salomea is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Salomea requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Salomea has been raising livestock for 20 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Salomea would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old and married with one child.

Gloria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Gloria has borrowed and repaid eleven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years and also earns an income from a bakery.

Gloria aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kalys

texts.ru: Калыс 61 год, замужем, все дети взрослые, младший сын живет с родителями и помогает по хозяйству. У Калыс среднее образование, с 1975 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, тогда приобрели одну нетель. Сейчас в хозяйстве Калыс есть: 2 коровы 10 овец и 2 лошади, а также земельный надел мерою 1,50 ГА, где Калыс выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Всю полученную от бизнеса прибыль Калыс старается вкладывать в развитие ее бизнеса, однако появилась необходимость построить сарай для скота, поэтому она и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов для постройки сарая. Доходы от бизнеса Калыс направит на дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, который будет зимой содержаться в построенном сарае.
texts.en:
Kalys is 61 and married. All her children are grown up and her youngest son lives with his parents and helps with the farm. She has a high school education and has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture since 1975, when she bought one heifer. Now she has two cows, 10 sheep and two horses, as well as a 1.5 hectare piece of land where she grows barley. 

Kalys's total monthly income is 20,000 KGS per month, and she tries to put all of her profits back into developing her business. However, a need has arisen to build a barn for her animals, and therefore she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 KGS to purchase building materials to construct a barn. She will put profits from the business into further increasing her head count of livestock, which she will keep in the newly build barn over the winter.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a barn for her livestock

loans.name: Imelda Esperanza

texts.es: Imelda de 40 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 10 y 13 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos dedicándose a prestar sus servicios domésticos para sostener la economía de su familia siendo consciente que es madre soltera por lo que tiene una doble responsabilidad que ha sabido llevar a cabo. Imelda desea seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de los miembros de su hogar por lo que desea solicitar un nuevo crédito a FUSAI ya que con el anterior inicio la construcción de su vivienda por lo que desea adquirir un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava, lamina, y hierro para terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Imelda is 40 years old and lives in her own house along with her two children, ages 10 and 13. Thanks to her effort and dedication, she has managed to get her children ahead by offering her domestic services, an activity that has allowed her to support her family. 

She is aware that as a single mother she has a double responsibility which she has known how to handle. Imelda wishes to keep improving the quality of life of the people living in her home, and that is why she is once again requesting a loan from FUSAI, since with the previous one she started the construction of her house. 

She will use the new loan to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, galvanized sheet and iron to finish with the construction.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, galvanized sheet and iron to finish with the construction of her house.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшод с детства стремился к тому, чтобы поступить в университет после окончания средней школы и получить высшее образование. Благодаря его стремлениям и поддержки родителей, он поступил в Аграрный Университет Таджикистана в этом году. Он данное время является студентом 1 курса. Дилшод изучает аграрную систему, так как его родина является аграрной страной. Он хочет после окончания университета работать в аграрной системе страны и развевать этот сектор. Он обратился в ИМОН за займом, та как он должен оплатить за учебный договор. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Dilshod has worked toward attending university and achieving a higher education since childhood. Thanks to his hard work and the support of his parents, he has enrolled in the Agrarian University of Tajikistan this year. He is currently a first-year student studying agriculture, since his homeland is an agrarian country. After graduation he wants to work in the country's agrarian system and develop this sector. He has turned to IMON for a loan since he needs to pay his tuition. He is requesting a loan to cover his tuition costs. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to pay his tuition at the Agrarian University of Tajikistan

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 19 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la crianza de ganado de repasto, tiene 2 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su padre en casa propia, el joven esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de concentrado y mas ganado de repastos para continuar con la crianza ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man whose face has been pixelated because he is 19 year old and lives in a high-risk zone, works breeding livestock. He has been in this line of work for 2 years, he sells his products in the different markets which are found near his home, he lives with his father in his own home.

The young man his requesting a loan to buy concentrated feed and more livestock to continue with breeding as this is his only source of work and thus have better income.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed and more livestock.

loans.name: Ramilya

texts.ru: Рамиля, 32 года, не замужем, есть сын школьник, образование у Рамили средне-специальное, она прядильщица. На данный момент работает санитаром в местной больнице. У Рамили очень хорошие отзывы от соседей и коллег. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Зарплата Рамили небольшая, в общем около 5,000 сом (KGS) ежемесячно. В этом году Рамиля решила отремонтировать ее дом и обновить систему отопления. Поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 44,000 сом (KGS) на покупку краски, обоев, предметов интерьера и радиатора. Кредит поможет улучшить жилищные условия, а доход от зарплаты Рамиля направит на обучение и воспитание ее сына.
texts.en:
Ramilya is 32 and unmarried with a school-aged son. She has a specialist high school education as a spinner, though at the moment she is working as a cleaner in the local hospital. Ramila's neighbours and colleagues have very good opinions of her. They call her a kind and hardworking woman. Ramila's salary is small, about 5,000 KGS per month. 

This year she has decided to renovate her home and install a new heating system. Therefore she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 44,000 KGS to purchase paint, wallpaper, home furnishings and a radiator. The loan will help her improve her living conditions, and she will put income from her salary toward her son's care and education.

loans.use: to buy paint, wallpapers and other materials for home renovations as well as a new radiator

loans.name: Khursand

texts.ru: Хурсанд одна вырастила своих двоих детей, так как ее муж умер рано, и она осталась мать одиночкой. Хурсанд вместе со своими детьми живет на южной части Таджикистана. Она занимается купле продажей конфет и печенье на местном рынке. Она покупает оптом и продает в розницу. Этим бизнесом она занимается уже более 6 лет и развевает свой бизнес постепенно. Она с бизнесом справляется сама и является основной кормилицей семьи. Ее дети совершеннолетние, но не имеют еще стабильного источника дохода. Она планирует увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом развевать бизнес. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки конфет, печенье и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Khursand has raised her two children on her own, since her husband died young, and she was left a single mother. She and her children live in the southern part of Tajikistan. She works buying and selling candy and cookies at the local market. She buys them wholesale and sells them with mark-up. She has been running this business for six years and has developed it gradually. She runs it on her own and it is the primary source of income for her family. Her children are grown up but don't yet have a stable source of income. She is planning to increase her working capital and in such a way to develop her business. She is requesting a loan of 7,500 somoni to purchase candy, cookies, etc. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy candy and cookies to increase her working capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 42 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Grace has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Grace requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Grace has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Grace would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ma. Nueda

texts.en:
Ma. Nueda works hard to support her family. Ma. Nueda is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Nueda requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

Ma. Nueda has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Ma. Nueda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
Ines is requesting a loan of $800 to improve her business. She will use this loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as cooking oils,  noodles, soy sauce, biscuits and other things to sell including soft drinks. 

Ines opened her kiosk in 2007 with her own working capital of $200. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. And with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she can improve her management of her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cooking oils, noodles, soy sauce, biscuits and other things to sell Including soft drinks.

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Milagrosa is a married woman with five children. Milagrosa is 41 years old and has one children who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Milagrosa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Milagrosa has been in this business for 3 years.  In the future Milagrosa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor de 63 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar y su compañera de vida. Él es un hombre que todos los días se esfuerza por sostener la economía familiar por medio de su trabajo como albañil el cual realiza desde muy joven por lo que su experiencia le permite obtener muchas ofertas de trabajo. El techo de la vivienda de Víctor se encuentra en malas condiciones, por lo que él desea cambiarlo para evitar que sus pertenencias se sigan deteriorando con la lluvia que se filtra, por lo que solicita nuevamente un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que con el crédito pasado no pudo terminar las mejoras.
texts.en:
Victor of 63 years old lives in his own home with his family and partner. He is a man who strives every day to support the family finances through his work as a builder which he has done since he was very young so his experience enables him to have many offers of work.

The roof of Victor's house is in a bad condition, so he wants to change it to avoid his belongs continuing to deteriorate in the leaking rain, so he is requesting a new loan from FUSAI to purchase: galvanized metal, wood and nails to change the roof of his house as with the previous loan he couldn't finish the improvements.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal, wood and nails to change the roof of his house.

loans.name: Luciana Isabel

texts.es: Luciana de 66 años de edad habita en vivienda propia desde hace 30 años. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado salir adelante luego de la pérdida de su esposo se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar. Como se puede observar en la fotografía la cocina de la vivienda de Luciana se encuentra en mal estado ya que todos los materiales se encuentran deteriorados, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera y clavos para reparar la cocina de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luciana, age 66, has lived in her own house for 30 years. Thanks to her effort and dedication she has managed to get ahead after the loss of her husband. 

She makes a living offering her domestic services. As it is shown in the picture, Luciana’s kitchen is in poor conditions since all the materials are deteriorated. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized sheet, wood and nails to repair the kitchen of her home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet, wood and nails to repair the kitchen of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. Evelyn is married and has a business buying and selling oysters in the Philippines.

Evelyn requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of oysters to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 25 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of oysters to sell.

loans.name: Lenny Rose

texts.en:
Lenny Rose is 29 years old and married with one child. 

Lenny Rose runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Lenny Rose has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Lenny Rose would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maybell

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Maybell works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Maybell is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store, such as shampoo and groceries. Maybell has sustained her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Dulcesima

texts.en:
Dulcesima is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Dulcesima requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Dulcesima has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Dulcesima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Romelisa

texts.en:
Romelisa is 30 years old and married with three children currently in school. Romelisa works very hard to provide for them.

Romelisa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell, such as bread, soft drinks, beer, canned goods, coffee, cereals, shampoo. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Romelisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, such as bread, soft drinks, beer, canned goods, coffee, cereals, and shampoo

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a married woman with two children. Rita is 40 years old and has one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rita has a food vending business in the Philippines and she is requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rita has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Rita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Edeliza

texts.en:
Edeliza is 43 years old and married with five children. With three children currently in school, Edeliza works very hard to provide for them.

Edeliza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like candies, biscuits, juice, cooking oil, sugar, detergent, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Edeliza has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, juice, cooking oil, sugar, detergent, soap, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Edeliza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like candies, biscuits, juice, cooking oil, sugar, detergent, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.en:
Marcosa is married, and is  52 year old mother of two residing in Tangub City with her family. Her husband has a transportation services business while she runs a retail store to make a living. She has been in her retailing business for over five years and it helps her to support her husband's income for the family. 

Recently, she took a new loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy more grocery goods for her store to increase sales which will help her to support her children's education costs. 

In the future, Marcosa wants to have a better living and to improve her business as well as to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods for her store.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna, 43, is a married woman with two children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elna has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 6 years. 

Elna would like to build and expand her business to secure for family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara works hard to support her family. She is married and has a selling soft drinks and beer business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more cases of soft drinks and beer to sell. Genara would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cases of soft drinks and beer to sell

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is an artisan from Peru who specializes in tooled leather furniture and decor. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of leather and wood.

Abel has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

Abel has been crafting leather items since he was 16. His older brother, Hector, taught him. "When I was 23, I opened my own workshop in my house. I cut and tool fine leather with a distinct style and skill that you won't find in many workshops. I design many beautiful Inca and colonial motifs, and emboss those upon the leather. I am especially happy and proud that my products are being sold all over the world now through the internet."

"Heartfelt thanks for the opportunity to receive this microcredit. This will allow me to craft more units and develop new designs and styles."

Use the link below to view Abel's tooled leather furniture and decor accents on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/951

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of leather and wood

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, 50, is a married woman with two children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Gloria has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell at her vegetable stall.  She has been in this business for 6 years. 

Gloria would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell at her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Sharon works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling curtains in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.  Sharon is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more curtains to sell.

Sharon has sustained her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more curtains to sell

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 62 años de edad, nunca tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está soltera y tiene 3 hijos pero vive solo con 2 nietos y nadie depende de ella. 

Teresa tiene una pequeña tienda y venta de pupusas, desde que tenía 15 años lo aprendió de su mamá pues siempre se dedicó a dicho negocio, el trabajo lo realiza en su casa y se levanta a las 4:30 AM.

El crédito lo necesita para mejorar el negocio, comprará gaseosas, jugos, jabones, lejía, azúcar, aceite y mas, también para comprar una mesa y 4 sillas. 


Sus sueños son repellar su casa pues es de adobe y hacer mas grande su tienda.
texts.en:
Teresa is 62 years old. She never had the opportunity to go to school. She is single and has three children, but she lives with only two grandchildren, and no one depends on her.

Teresa has had a little store and pupusa  [a typical Salvadoran dish] sales business for 15 years. She learned it from her mother, since she always worked in this business. She does the work in her house, and she gets up at 4:30 am.

She needs the loan to improve her business. She will buy soft drinks, juices, soaps, bleach, sugar, oil, and other items. It is also to buy a table and four chairs.

Her dreams are to plaster her house, since it is of adobe, and to make her store bigger.

loans.use: to improve her business by buying soft drinks, juices, soaps, bleach, sugar, oil, and other items, as well as a table and four chairs.

loans.name: Febe Ann

texts.en:
Febe Ann is 45 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Febe Ann has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fruits and vegetables to sell at her food stall.  She has been in this business for ten years. 

In the future, Febe Ann would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for her food stall.

loans.name: Mannieve

texts.en:
Mannieve is 43 years old and married with one child in school. Mannieve works very hard to provide for her family.

Mannieve runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Mannieve has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Mannieve would like to save enough money to expand her business and to repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria lives in Oecusse and she is a businesswoman. She has been involved in business activities since 2012 when she started with her own working capital of $300.00. 

She is requesting a loan of $1500.00, because she has a kiosk and she wants to add more items, so she is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Mentin. She wants used to buy more goods such as perfume, sugar, water, cigarettes, lighters, cooking oil, eggs, biscuits and other things to sell, including hard drinks.

Maria needs to take a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve the management of her business and she wants to increase her income in the future.

loans.use: To buy perfume, sugar, water, cigarettes, lighters, cooking oils, eggs, biscuits, and other things to sell, Including hard drinks.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is married with an only child and resides in Tangub City with his family. 

He operates a motorcycle transportation service in their community, while at the same time working in a private institution to make a living. He has been doing this for five years and he has been able to provide for his family well. 

He became a member of Gata Daku MPC in 2013 and recently took a loan to purchase construction materials to repair his house in order to provide a safe living space for the family. 

His plan is to expand his business by having more units of motorcycle in order to have savings for his child's future education.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to repair his house in order to provide a safe living space for the family.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 52 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Delia has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, bread, soap, shampoo, and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Shelito

texts.en:
Shelito is 42 years old and married with three children who are all in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Her business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business. She has requested PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to sell.  Shelito is committed to rebuild her business, and in the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of items to sell like shampoo, coffee, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 58 years old, and from Carles town in Iloilo. She is married with one adult son. For 25 years now, she has been engaged in buying and selling scrap items such as empty bottles, steel, cans, and plastic recyclables.

She would like to request a loan to buy more scrap items like empty bottles, cans, and steel. Ma. Luz is aiming to expand her business to include other scrap that she can still sell.

Her income will be for healthy diet and savings

loans.use: to buy scrap items like empty bottles, cans, and steel

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a widow  who lives in Clarin Misamis Occidental with her child. She works in her own farm  that provide for their living. 

She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for her farm. With her generated income from her farm, she was able to maintain her farm and send her child to school. There is nothing like improving her farm--that is her determination for she wants to ensure a better source of income for their needs. 

Recently, she took a new loan from Gata Daku MPC  to buy organic fertilizer as recommended from the local government in order to restore farm nutrients and get good harvest, too.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer as recommended from the local government in order to restore farm nutrients and get a good harvest, too.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores owns and operates a tricycle unit. She has been successful in this business for ten years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income to provide their everyday needs and necessities.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. She is requesting an amount of PHP 15,000 for the maintenance of the tricycle and to pay for the renewal of franchise agreement / permit so she could continue her business operation.

In the future, Dolores wants to buy another unit of tricycle and she hopes that her business will prosper more. She also dreams of good life for her children and that God will continue to outpour His blessings upon them. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts, accessories, and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell at her general store business.

Marilyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Marilyn's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Janice requested a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Janice would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ma. Crispy

texts.en:
Ma. Crispy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of charcoal to sell for her charcoal retailing business.

She has been in this business for four years. Ma. Crispy earns more income from rice retailing.

Ma. Crispy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 58 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Mildred runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future, Mildred would like to save enough money in order to support her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dushirukumwete Group

texts.fr:
Ferdinand fait parti du groupe Dushirukumwete et habite à Bujumbura .Il a 34 ans et est marié à Valérie, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 6 mois à 10 ans, dont 1 étudie.

Il fait le commerce d'habits et de souliers depuis 17 ans.

Il est à  son troisième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu'il obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits et de  souliers à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait construire une maison en matériaux durables et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Ferdinand is a member of the Dushirukumwete group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 34 years old and married to Valérie, a farmer. Together they have 4 children between the ages of 6 months and 10 years, 1 of whom attends school.

Ferdinand has been in the business of selling clothes and shoes for 17 years. He is on his third loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that he obtains, he will increase his capital and purchase many articles of clothing and shoes to resell and increase his earnings.

In the coming years, Ferdinand would like to build a house out of durable material and to see his children educated.

loans.use: to increase his capital and purchase many articles of clothing and shoes to resell in order to increase his earnings

loans.name: Muringanizo Group

texts.fr:
Salvator fait partie du groupe  Muringanizo et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 30 ans et est marié à Anick, une femme de ménage. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant de 2 mois.
Il a sous sa charge ses 2 sœurs qui étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de  pagnes  depuis  2 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de  pagnes  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  construire  une maison, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Salvator is a member of the Muringanizo group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 30 years old and married to Anick, a housekeeper. Together they have 1 child who is 2 months old. Salvator also takes care of his two sisters, both of whom attend school.

Salvator has been in the business of selling "pagnes" (traditional African cloth) for 2 years. He is on his second loan with Turame.

With the Kiva loan that Salvator receives, he will increase his capital and purchase several pagnes to resell and increase his earnings. 

In the coming years, Salvator would like to build a house and see his children educated.

loans.use: to increase his capital and purchase several "pagnes" (traditional African cloth) to resell and increase his earnings

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 63 years old and married, and she has five children. Leonila works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items, such as coffee, snack foods, sugar, canned goods, cereals, milk, juice, soft drinks, and beer.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional items to sell at her store, like coffee, snack foods, sugar, canned goods, cereals, milk, juice, soft drinks, and beer. Leonila would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell at her store, like canned goods, cereals, and milk

loans.name: Odilia

texts.en:
Odilia lives in Oecusse. She is a tailor, and she is happy to do her business activities. She said living in a town is very competitive in earning money, unless a person does some activity which is profitable, in order to survive. Looking for ways to earn money, Odilia came up with an idea, to open a sewing business for all people. She started her sewing for income in 2010, with her own working capital of $300.00.

She is applying for a loan of $800.00 from Tuba Rai Metin. She wants to buy more materials that she needs, like cotton, sewing needles, and others.

loans.use: to buy more materials that she needs for her tailoring business, like cotton, sewing needles, and others.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa, Doña Marta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos como: sopa, detergentes, granos básicos, huevos, golosinas, refrescos, etc. y asi poder seguir con sus ventas que le generan buenos ingresos.
texts.en: Marta is 49-years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband.  Marta has a small store which she has operated out of her home for the last ten years.  She has a large clientele because of the variety of products that she sells.  Doña Marta is requesting the loan to purchase more products, like soup, detergents, staple grains, eggs, beverages etc. so she can continue with her sales, which generates a good income.

loans.use: to purchase soup, detergents, staple grains, eggs, sweets, beverages etc.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona de 54 años de edad, estudió hasta 4° grado en la escuela, está casada y su esposo se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura, tiene 3 hijos y solo uno está estudiando.


Petrona se dedica a cuidar ganado, y fue así como ella adquirió una gran experiencia en este trabajo, además de esto ella también se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura, tiene que viajar 25 minutos a pie para llegar hasta su lugar de trabajo.

Ella utilizara el préstamo para comprar dos terneros de engorde y pagar mano de obra para limpiar un cañal que ella posee.

Ella a futuro sueña con darle buena alimentación a su ganado y sacar buenas ganancias de ello.
texts.en:
Petrona is 54 years old. She went to school through fourth grade. She is married, and her husband does agricultural work. She has three children, and only one is in school.

Petrona cares for livestock, and this was how she acquired great experience in this work. In addition to this, she also works in agriculture. She has to travel 25 minutes on foot to arrive at the place where she works.

She will use the loan to buy two calves to fatten and pay for labor to clean a sugar cane field that she has.

In the future, she dreams of giving good feed to her livestock and getting good earnings from them.

loans.use: to buy two calves to fatten and to pay for labor to clean a sugar cane field that she has

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Maria Luz is a married woman, who has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 30 years old, and two of her children are currrently in school.

Maria Luz has a vulcanizing shop in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to purchase new tools and equipment for her vulcanizing shop.

She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Maria Luz would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and equipment for her vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is single and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF, which she will use to buy more fish to sell, in her fish stall.

Letecia has been in this business for six years, now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
