Su experiencia en el negocio es de más de 20 años, trabajó como ayudante gran parte de su vida para luego independizarse y lograr mejores beneficios. Sus inicios fueron con una máquina casera de costura, la cual sigue funcionando, él desea incrementar su producción y realizar mayor cantidad de prendas porque tiene clientes continuos que le exigen mayores cantidades. Su sueño es tener una fábrica de confecciones y producir a gran escala. Él necesita realizar la compra de una máquina de coser industrial para lograr sus metas.
Es por esos motivos que Francisco solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial y ampliar su negocio de confección.
texts.en:
Francisco is a 56 year old man. He is single and the father of two children, aged 17 and 6. His business is making men's pants. He is independent, reliable, entrepreneurial, responsible and hardworking. He has his business on Max Fernandez Avenue, a route that unites the city of La Paz with the city of  El Alto.

Francisco is dark skinned, and medium height. His mother tongue is Aymara and he uses Spanish for the business. His business is making general clothing but he specializes in men's pants for wholesale. He buys the fabrics in different colors and textures to make men's pants in all different sizes. He also gets orders for and makes skirts for indigenous women and traditional clothing for the area. He has more than 20 years' experience in the business. He worked as an assistant for a large part of his life to later go off on his own and make better profits His beginnings were with a home sewing machine, which still works. He wants to increase production and make a larger quantity of clothing because he has regular customers who require larger quantities from him. His dream is to have a clothing factory and produce on a large scale. He needs to buy an industrial sewing machine to achieve his goals. That is why Francisco is asking for a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine to expand his sewing business.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine and expand his tailoring business.

loans.name: Milton Rodrigo

texts.es: Milton es un señor de 35 años de edad, vive con su esposa y con sus 2 entenados, el es un señor muy alegre y trabajador que se dedica al cultivo de pequeños huertos de papas, ya que es la  fuente de  ingresos  de para el y su familia, el crédito lo necesita para comprar abono y fungicidas para curar sus productor y obtener una buena cosecha, la aspiración de Milton es seguir adelante con sus actividad y de ser posible le gustaría comprarse una casa para su familia.
texts.en: Milton is a 35 year old man. He lives with his wife and his 2 stepchildren. He is a very cheerful and hardworking man who works growing small crops of potatoes. This is the source of income for him and his family. He needs the loan to buy fertilizer and fungicide to cure his products and obtain a good harvest. Milton's goal is to keep going forward and is possible he would like to buy a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicide.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 43 years old, married and has six children. Two of her children are in school.

Jenelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jenelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jenelyn has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 23 years old, married and has one child. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mercy requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mercy has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mercy would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: María Rosalba

texts.es:
María una mujer de 66 años de edad que cuenta con una larga experiencia en el mundo de las confecciones donde labora, suéteres, camisas, camisetas, blusas y todo artículo que le pidan, es una recurrente prestado en la corporación interactuar ya que gracias a los 22 ciclos de crédito ha podido pasar de ser una simple empresaria a una reconocida confeccionista del sector. 
Como bien se sabe la confección paso por un periodo muy crítico donde muchas empresas cerraron pero María sigue en pie con su negocio pero tiene problemas financieros para cubrir los pedidos que le hacen al por mayor.
Solicita un crédito para comprar tela para fabricar prendas para la temporada navideña que esta próxima lo que le traerá muy buenos ingresos. 
Su deseo es ampliar su número de clientes, por eso necesita producir y mostrar al mercado su prendas de gran calidad y tan estéticas.
texts.en:
María is a 66-year-old woman who has a lot of experience in the area of dressmaking. She makes sweaters, shirts, blouses, and any item requested. 

She has had recurring loans with the corporation Interactuar, since with the 22 loans she has gone from being a simple entrepreneur to becoming a recognized dressmaker of the area. 

As it is well known, dressmaking went through a hard time. A lot of enterprises had to close but María is still standing. However, she is having financial problems to cover all the big requests she is getting. 

She is asking for this loan to buy fabric and make the garments for the Christmas season that is around the corner and will give her good incomes. 

Her wish is to increase her number of clients. For that she needs to produce and show in the market her quality and beautiful products.

loans.use: to buy fabric and make garments for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Сайда 50 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. В поиске источника доходов для своей семьи, она 30 лет назад стала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Сайда достигла хороших успехов в работе и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Сайды имеется 3 коровы, 4 овцы. Она реализует молоко среди местных жителей. Сайда обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), который она направит на покупку 2 дойных коров. Доходы от кредита Сайда планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Saida is 50 and married with three children. 30 years ago, looking for a source of income for her family, she started working in agriculture and animal husbandry. Thanks to her constant hard work she has been very successful and achieved a monthly profit of 10,000 KGS. She currently has three cows and four sheep and sells milk to local residents.

Saida has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS, which will allow her to buy two dairy cows. She plans to put profits from the loan back into further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows so she can sell a higher volume of milk

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is married to a farmer in the village of Zamboanga del Sur. She has been helping her husband with their 'lampakanay' weaving business to make a living. Aside from this, they also have a farm of coconuts and bananas which is their main source of income. She has successfully repaid her previous loan that she used for buying more 'lampakanay' leaves. 

To have a greener farm, she took a new loan recently to purchase organic fertilizer in order to restore farm nutrients to have a more productive farm. In the future, she wants to become successful in her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer in order to restore farm nutrients

loans.name: Tito

texts.es:
Tito, continua vendiendo ropa, el préstamo anterior le permitió tener mercadería del gusto de sus clientes, las ganancias han tenido un aumento significativo, es así como puede cumplir con sus obligaciones, por el momento está trabajando  en un taller de mármol como ayudante, en su negocio de venta de ropa le apoya su familia.
Ha optado por un nuevo crédito para comprar blusas, pantalones, camisas, etc., así mantendrá su negocio en el mercado teniendo la oportunidad de seguir mejorando el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Tito continues selling clothes. The previous loan allowed him to have more merchandise appealing to his customers, and the earnings have increased significantly. That is how he has been able to fulfill his obligations.

At the moment, he is working as an assistant at a marble workshop, and his family helps him with the business selling clothes.

He has decided to request a new loan to buy blouses, jeans, shirts, etc. This way he will be able to maintain his business in the market and at the same time keep improving his family’s life style.

loans.use: to buy blouses, jeans, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom, 44, lives with family members in a rural village of Sithor Kandal district, Prey Veng province. She is a mother of four children. She secures the basic needs in her family via rice cropping. Having been in this business for 24 years, she is able to earn about 50,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Mom with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy chickens to raise in order to earn additional income for her family. She hopes to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy chickens for raising

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Sithor Kandal district, Preng Veng province, Savy is 39 years old and a mother of one schoolchild. She earns income to support her family through rice cropping and working for others for a fee. She has been involved this business for ages and it earns her about 25,000 KHR per day. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As a group leader, Savy will spend her loan portion to buy chickens to raise in order to supplement the family's income. She hopes that this new business can improve her family's condition.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a 36-year-old married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. Rowena earns a living through her sari-sari (or variety store) business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. Rowena is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell like noodles, canned goods, soap, shampoo, cooking oil, sugar, biscuits, snack foods, seasonings, and others. 

With a loan, Rowena will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Rowena hopes to make her business a success. She also wants to save more money for the schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store

loans.name: Phary

texts.en:
Phary, 47, is a resident of Kandal province and a mother of three children; one of whom is in university. To struggle for her living, she earns income through growing mangoes and selling snacks. 

This is her third loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she fully repaid her past loans. She will spend her loan portion to pay school fees for her son who wants to pursue his Bachelor's degree, majoring in Finance and Banking. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her son

loans.name: Jargalsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Jargalsaikhan, 49 years old, lives with his wife in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been working as a security officer at steel factory since 2007. His wife has begun working as a cook at a cafeteria. Their younger son studies at university and their elder son lives on his own. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years. So he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as shingles, planks, and fiberglass for house renovation. After renovation, he and his wife will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating and then less pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees and to buy educational equipment for her daughter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition and to buy a computer.

loans.name: Layieng

texts.en:
Layieng is a 40-year-old garment-factory worker and a married woman with four children living in Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. Two of her children attend school. Her husband is 39, a motorcycle taxi driver. Together, they can earn approximately $9 a day. 

Now Layieng would like to request a loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for rice farming. This loan will help her earn more income. In the future, she is going to renovate her house and help her children to pursue bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for rice farming

loans.name: Rea

texts.en:
Rea is a 30-year-old married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been running a small sari-sari or retail store business for more than two years now. Rea sells various goods to the people in her place. For more than two years, this business has provided Rea the income that she needs. 

Rea is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, chips and snack foods, cooking oil, detergents and toiletries. With this, she will be able to augment her inventory which will attract more buyers to her store. In the future, Rea has hopes of making her store more productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, chips and snack foods, cooking oil, detergents and toiletries

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is a 46-year-old fish vendor from the community of Dulag, Leyte. She is married and has six children, ages 11 to 26. 

Marietta has been selling fish in her community for many years now. For a long time, this has helped in raising her children. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. With her income, her priority is the education of her children and nutritious food for her family.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and have other business options.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earning for her family as well.

As a microfinance member of PMPC, she seeks financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

In the future, Rebecca wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

loans.name: Elly

texts.en:
Elly signed up for her membership with Paglaum MPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Elly was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. 

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 42 years old and married. She has two children, both of whom are in school. Jennifer works very hard to provide for them.

Jennifer runs a general store in the Philippines. Jennifer has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future Jennifer would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 43 years old. She has two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Elizabeth has a hardware business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 60,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more hardware to sell.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more hardware to sell.

loans.name: Mungunsuld

texts.en:
Mungunsuld, 25 years old, lives with his wife and child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

He has been breeding and selling dogs since 2011. His wife is a cook and works at a restaurant. Their child stays at kindergarten. 

He is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy an electric car in order to drive his wife to her work, located in the far north of the city, and deliver his puppies to clients. The main advantage of an electric car is that it emits harmless pollutants and wastes less fuel.

loans.use: to buy an electric car.

loans.name: Chang

texts.en:
Chang is 18 years old, a freshman at a university majoring in Management. He lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. 

Because of a lack of financial support, Chang would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fees for four years. This loan will help him graduate. 

In the future, he wants to work at any private company and have his own house.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees and purchase educational equipment for her second daughter

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 45 years old and lives in Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 1 child now of school age.
 
Teodora has been engaged in coconut and copra (dried coconut meat) buying and trading for 10 years already. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional coconuts and copra for resale. 

Teodora has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, Teodora hopes to expand her coconut and copra trading business.

loans.use: purchase additional coconuts and copra for resale

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 49 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Annabelle has a fishing business in the Philippines. Annabelle requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Annabelle has been in this business for 29 years. In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Sosefina

texts.en:
Sosefina is 46 years old and divorced with three children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Sosefina needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new spade, a crowbar, a new wheelbarrow, a watering hose and boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. 

Sosefina will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new spade, a crowbar, a new wheelbarrow, a watering hose and boots

loans.name: Litia

texts.en:
Litia is 29 years old and married with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years.

 Litia needs a loan to buy plants, a new wheelbarrow, a machete, chemicals, fertilizer, boots and a pair of overalls. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Litia will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy plants, a new wheelbarrow, a machete, chemicals, fertilizer, boots and a pair of overalls

loans.name: Mary Bless

texts.en:
Mary Bless started her gardening activities in a very small space. Little did she know she could earn income as well doing her hobby. 

She wants to take advantage of the good return of her gardening activities. She wants to purchase a variety of orchids to grow and sell. Mary Bless is confident that with her venture of orchid growing, she can earn well. 

In the future, she wants to save more for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of orchids to grow and sell

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
In 2011, Pacita learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. She is married and has only one child, and has made a living for 35 years. 

Pacita tried her luck doing a business focusing on her farming activities through banana production. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Pacita took another loan amount to pay for additional seedlings for her banana production. This will help her farming income get a big boost. Pacita looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for additional seedlings for banana production

loans.name: Ana Lourdes

texts.es: Ana, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su conyugue con quien tiene 2 hijos y reside en un Sector de Cofradía, Municipio de San Pedro Sula. Ella siempre a buscado como generar sus ingresos, anteriormente vendía tortillas de maíz, y hace 4 años decidió dedicarse al transporte, ahora tiene una moto taxi donde presta el servicio de transporte de personas en la comunidad y sus alrededores. Este negocio le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 12,000 Lempiras y los invertirá en la reparación de su moto taxi ya que le esta fallando y piensa en darle mantenimiento y repararla para brindar mejor servicio al cliente y obtener sus ingresos. Su sueño es poder comprar otra unidad de moto taxi para ir aumentando el negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is 33 years old and lives in a common-law relationship with her spouse with whom she has 2 children. She lives in the Cofradía sector of the Municipality of San Pedro Sula. She is always looking for how to generate her income. Before she used to sell corn tortillas and four years ago she started to work in transportation. Now she has a motorcycle taxi that she uses to provide transportation services for people in her community and it's surroundings. Her business has helped her get her family ahead.

The loan that she is requesting is for 12,000 HNL and she will invest it in repairing her motorcycle as it is not working well. She is thinking of having maintenance done on it and repairing it to provide better service to her clients and obtain her income. Her dream is to be able to buy another motorcycle to expand her business.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is 73 years old and a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Isabelita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell.

Isabelita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Isabelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Vat's Group

texts.en:
An older woman from Sithor Kandal district, Prey Veng province, Vat is 62 years old and a mother of seven children. To support herself, she earns income via rice cropping. She has been involved in this business for ages and it earns her about 42,400 KHR per day. 

This is her first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is leading a group of three to get a new loan. She will spend this loan to buy chickens and cows to resell. She hopes that she can get more income after she runs her new business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and cows to resell

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Toiata

texts.en:
Toiata is a 57-year-old unmarried woman with five children. She runs a Elei printing business as well as a tailoring business to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 12 years. 

Toiata needs a large loan to renew her house as well as to buy some items for her business. She'll be purchasing roofing iron sheets, timber and bags of cement to renew her house. As for her business she'll be buying new designs and rolls of material. She will use her profits to pay her family's weekly expenses and also to pay for the expansion of her business. Toiata joined SPBD in 2004 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase roofing iron sheets, timber and bags of cement for her house and new designs and rolls of material for her business

loans.name: Fonofili

texts.en:
Fonofili is 46 years old and married with 5 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 6 years. 

Fonofili needs a loan to buy fertilizer, new boots, overalls, chemicals, crops, a wheelbarrow, and a crowbar. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Fonofili will use the profits from her sales to pay for her familiy's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, new boots, overalls, chemicals, crops, a wheelbarrow, and a crowbar

loans.name: Salu

texts.en: Salu is a 55-year-old woman who is unmarried with 12 children. She has a small taxi business to earn an income, and she has had this business for five years. Salu needs a loan to buy new seat covers, renew her taxi's license, buy a new water tank, refill the air conditioner, and get a new paint job. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Salu joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new seat covers, renew her taxi's license, buy a new water tank, refill the air conditioner, and get a new paint job.

loans.name: Elsa Fe

texts.en:
Elsa Fe is from Caniangan, Tangub City, and is married and has five children, all of whom are adult age. 

Last 2011, Elsa Fe joined MPC and is actively participating in all the various programs and services given by the Co-op. Elsa Fe is gaining a profit from her small retailing business through buying and selling of "Tuba" (Coconut Wine). Tuba is one of the favorite past time drinks of men in the barrio, that is why it has promising sales daily. Elsa Fe put aside some of her income into savings and investing for future needs. Recently, she requested a loan to buy more gallons of "Tuba" to sell. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of "Tuba" (coconut wine) to sell

loans.name: Ana Mae

texts.en:
Ana Mae is a married woman and a mother of three children from Concepcion, Iloilo. Ana Mae is engaged in a food-vending business, selling barbecue and others. She also earns a supplemental income through her retail sales of ready-to-wear clothes. Ana Mae has been in these ventures for more than three years now. Ana Mae is asking for a loan to buy more frozen meat products to barbecue, cooking oil and seasonings, and additional stock of ready-to-wear clothes. With this loan, Ana Mae believes that she will be able to sell more to her customers, thus augmenting her sales and profit. 

In the future, Ana Mae hopes of expanding her business so that it will become more sustainable and profitable. Furthermore, Ana Mae wants to save money for the educational expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy more frozen meat products to barbecue, cooking oil and seasonings, and additional stock of ready-to-wear clothes.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 47 years old and married with one child.

Charito works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Charito has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Charito aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 72 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Editha has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. Editha requested a 16,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

In the future, Editha would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Aleyda Marisol

texts.es:
Aleyda de 26 años de edad, soltera vive junto a su mamá quien se dedica a la actividad de ama de casa  y hermano que se encuentra estudiando su educación básica, ella aprendió el oficio de piñatería debido a una oportunidad que obtuvo por medio de una amiga, fue así como ella aprendió y actualmente lo realiza como propio desde hace 8 meses y es una actividad que le gusta mucho y le ha dado buenos resultados.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para la ampliación de su negocio, comprara laminas, madera y clavos;  ya que con la corta edad de permanecer en dicho negocio ya tiene un buen porcentaje de clientela quienes le solicitan algunos productos más que ella no los tiene entre estos tenemos; globos, burbujas, colores, huevos chinbos, entre otros.

A futuro ella tiene como visión tener un mejor local y un negocio que le permita satisfacer la necesidades de sus clientes, como también un lugar propio donde pueda formar su familia
texts.en:
Aleyda is 26 years old. She is single and lives with her mother, who is a housewife, and a brother who is in primary school. She learned the trade of  piñata-making thanks to an opportunity that she obtained through a friend. This was how she learned, and now she has been doing it on her own for 8 months. It is a business that she likes a lot and that has given her good results.

The loan that she is applying for is to expand her business. She will buy metal sheeting, wood, and nails. Even with the short amount of time she has been in this business, she already has a good percentage of customers who ask her for some additional products that she doesn't have; among these are balloons, soap bubbles, crayons, and confetti-filled eggs, among other items.

In the future, she has a vision of having a bigger shop and a business that allows her to satisfy the needs of her customers, as well as a place of her own where she can form a family.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, wood, and nails to expand her store, and balloons, soap bubbles, crayons, confetti-filled eggs, and other items to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is requesting a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is selling gasoline so she is taking this loan to buy more gasoline. She started to sell gasoline a year ago with her own working capital of $50. 

Rosita is earning a good income from this business because she lives near public roads so many people come to buy her gasoline. She is taking this loan because she wants to improve her business and she feel with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin she can get good management for her business.

loans.use: To buy gasoline to re-sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to replace his old one.

loans.name: Perive

texts.en: Perive is a 33-year-old woman who is married with six children. She has a small taxi business to earn an income, which she has been doing for five years. Perive needs a loan to buy new engine spark plugs, a new power steering pump, a new taxi sign indicator, new tires and a rear windshield. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Perive joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new engine spark plugs, a new power steering pump, a new taxi sign indicator, new tires and a rear windshield.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting and earning income as well. Marlyn has helped her husband do this type of work. 

As a farmer, Marlyn has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase tomato seeds which will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. 

Someday, Marlyn hopes to purchase farmland to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding tomato seedlings

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El olor a pan exquisito es el que se siente al pasar por la casa de don Luis, hace 20 años se insertó en el mundo de las panaderías y hoy en día desea seguir creciendo. Tiene 54 años de edad está soltero y tiene dos hijos ya casados. 
Inicio sus actividades como ayudante en varias panaderías con las cuales obtuvo mucha experiencia, hace un año comenzó su propio negocio, le apoya su hijo mayor el cual también va adquiriendo experiencia. Le gustaría comercializar su producto en todas las pulperías de Rivas y lograr así crecer. Solicito el crédito para comprar materia prima tales como: Harina, Levadura y otros ingredientes, logrando así suplir todos los encargos que solicitan sus clientes. Dentro de sus planes futuros se encuentra ampliar su negocio y así poder abastecer todas las pulperías de Rivas.
texts.en:
The odor of delicious bread is what you smell when you pass by the Luis' house. Twenty years ago he entered the world of bakeries and today he wants to continue to grow. He is 54 years old, is single and has two children who are married.

He started in this business as an assistant in various bakeries where he gained lots of experience. One year ago he started his own business. His oldest son helps with the business and he is also gaining experience. Luis loves to sell his product in all the small stores in Rivas and doing this he has managed to grow.

He is requesting the loan to buy raw material like flour, yeast and other ingredients. He can then filled all the orders from his clients. Amongst his future plans are to expand his business and supply all the small stores in Rivas.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like flour, yeast and other ingredients.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 52 years old and a married woman with four children. Two of her children are in school; she is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Marissa has a bakery business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, etc. for her bakery.

Marissa has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, etc. for her bakery.

loans.name: Faatoaga

texts.en:
Faatoaga is 52 years old and married with 5 children. She has a small farm where she raises pigs that she can sell in her community or to the public. She has been doing this for 7 years. 

Faatoaga needs a loan to buy barbed wire, timber, nails, iron poles, pig food, and a new wooden tub for water. She has been a member of SPBD since 2007. Faatoaga will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, timber, nails, iron poles, pig food, and a new wooden tub for water

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a 42-year-old married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has six children. For more than 20 years, Maribel has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband. This is their main source of income. 

Maribel needs a loan for their business, so she is requesting a loan from CEVI, a microfinance partner of Kiva in the Philippines, to buy a new boat engine and to pay for repairs to her fishing boat. With these investments she will be able improve their catch, giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Maribel hopes to make her business more successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy a new engine and to pay for repairs to her fishing boat.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is a 49-year-old widow with one child. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Sina needs a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, gloves, a tiller, a rake, a crowbar, a watering hose and a machete. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Sina will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, gloves, a tiller, a rake, a crowbar, a watering hose and a machete

loans.name: Suheel

texts.en:
Suheel is a 23-year-old single man from a village near Tulkarem City. He lives with his family in a very simple house. Suheel was working in a restaurant as a helper where he got a low income, but he gained very good experience, so he decided to open his own traditional food restaurant.

Suheel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to start his own business which is a traditional restaurant for making falafel and humus. He will buy new tools and cook stove. 

Suheel appears in the photo in his new restaurant.

loans.use: to start his own business, a traditional restaurant for making falafel and humus.

loans.name: Machimbo Group

texts.en:
Modesta is 31 years old, married and has two sons and one daughter, who all are at school. She has been a mamalishe for four years now, serving breakfast, lunch and supper foods. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. each working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

Modesta has been a customer of Tujijenge since 2011, taking several credits, which have since been repaid back successfully. She managed to use the credits to buy cooking pots, charcoal stoves and cooking ingredients like rice, maize, baking flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc. She is so thankful with Kiva's support which enabled her business to expand. Modesta earned extra income which she used to cover school fees and home food expenses. Her desire is to build a house for her family.

With her new credit request, Modestato will buy cooking items like rice, maize, baking flour, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She will share this loan with her loan group, "Machimbo," which totals four members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking items like rice, maize, baking flour, beans, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jhona

texts.en:
Jhona is 62 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children, now adults.
 
Jhona has been engaged in a hog-fattening and hog-raising business for five years. She earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of business activity. At present she has one sow and two piglets. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing two sacks of grower feed for her hog-fattening business. 

Jhona has been a member of PMPC for almost 12 years. In the future, Jhona hopes to expand her hog-fattening and hog-raising business.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of grower feed

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for ten years.

Shiela requested a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell.

In the future, Shiela would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Santos Anabel

texts.es: Santos, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene un hijo, reside en el Municipio de Yoro. Ella siempre a buscado como generar ingresos, antes vendía leña y palillos, y hace dos años estableció su propia pulpería donde vende abarrotes como azúcar, manteca, café, frijoles, pan, churros, refrescos, dulces, huevos, jabón, y otros abarrotes. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para poder surtir la pulpería con productos de la canasta básica como frijoles, azúcar, arroz, harina, manteca, refrescos, pan, café, huevos y productos de aseo. El plan de ella es mantener el negocio como su fuente de ingresos y obtener mas ganancias en cada inversión.
texts.en:
Santos, who is 33 years old, lives in free union with her husband, with whom she has a son. She lives in the township of Yoro. She always has looked for ways to generate income. In the past, she sold firewood and sticks. Two years ago she established her own grocery store, where she sells groceries such as sugar, lard, coffee, beans, bread, churros (a doughnut-like snack), soft drinks, sweets, eggs, soap, and other groceries. 

She has applied for a loan of 15,000 lempiras to be able to stock her grocery store with basic food products such as beans, sugar, rice, flour, lard, soft drinks, bread, coffee, eggs, and cleaning products. Her plan is to maintain her business as her source of income and obtain more earnings with each investment.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, rice, flour, lard, soft drinks, bread, coffee, eggs, and cleaning products to stock her business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 55 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Alma works very hard to provide for them.

Alma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Alma has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, rice, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Alma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nuuuta

texts.en:
Nuuuta is 32 years old and married with one child. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. 

Nuuuta has been doing this for one year. Nuuuta needs a loan to buy a sprinkler, a watering hose, chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow and boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Nuuuta will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a sprinkler, a watering hose, chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow and boots

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en: Eseta is 37 years old and married with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years, and has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Eseta needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a tiller, a crowbar, a new wheelbarrow, boots and overalls. Eseta will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a tiller, a crowbar, a new wheelbarrow, boots and overalls.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en: Tahmina is 51 years old, married and is raising one child. Tahmina works in agriculture, growing mainly onions and carrots (on one hectare). This is a business she has had for more than fifteen years. Her husband helps her with the business by selling the harvest at the local market. She plans to do a fall planting and therefore is requesting a loan of 1,200 AZN to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers and tractor services. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers and tractor services.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, 49, is a married woman and a mother of four children. She resides with her family in the province of Iloilo, in the Philippines. Nenita is a very hardworking woman. In order to support the needs of their family, especially for their children's schooling, Nenita and her husband decided to earn a living through fishing. For almost 18 years now, fishing has provided them the income that they need for their sustenance. 

Now, Nenita wants to borrow a loan from CEVI to buy a new fishing boat. With a new boat, Nenita is confident that they will be able to improve their income from their fishing business.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat.

loans.name: Sabriyya

texts.en:
Sabriyya is 37 years old, married, and has two children. She is a member of a group farm and has been working there for six years. By profession, she is a schoolteacher. In the morning she works on her plot of land, and after lunch she goes to school to teach primary grades. Sabriyya loves both of these activities. 

Currently, she is preparing for the next planting. With the loan amount, she wants to buy quality vegetable seeds, mineral fertilizers, and fuel. She needs support, without which she cannot continue her agricultural work. Please support Sabriyya.

loans.use: to buy quality vegetable seeds, mineral fertilizers, and fuel.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a businessman running a general store selling drinks, a business he has been with for seven years now. He is 37 years old and a father of three kids, two school-aged and the other still a baby. Working from 7:00am to 11:00pm per working day, he is able to make a fair monthly return. 

He is now at Tujijenge Tanzania to request his tenth credit. He used the previous credits, since repaid, to improve his shop with more drinks and bought a motorcycle to support his business. He managed to receive an extra income which he used to cover school fees and household expenses. 

In the coming years, Michael would like to build a house. With his new request, Michael will buy drinks for his store to resell. He will be accountable for paying back the credit.

loans.use: to buy drinks to resell in his store.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie makes a living through her retailing business. She runs a sari-sari store in Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up for membership with Paglaum MPC to gain access to capitalization. She wants to increase her inventory. 

Now, Rosalie has accessed a loan to restock her store with basic items like canned goods, oil, soy sauce, etc. to increase sales. Rosalie hopes to sustain her business and dreams of sending all her children to school.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic goods to increase sales

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 53 years old, married, and has ten children. Four of her children are in school.

Azucena is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Azucena requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Azucena has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Azucena would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is looking forward to the next cropping season. She wants to be well prepared, especially for the much needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer, so she applied a loan from the Cooperative. Editha hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for growing more produce.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en: Albina is from Lumban, Tangub City. She is married with four adult age chidren of whom are all married, Albina makes a living through snack vending. She makes delicious snacks everyday to sell all to her neighbors and neighboring barangays as well. She's been in the business since her early years of marriage. This has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. Recently, she loaned an amount ofPhp4,000 to buy more raw ingredients to make more food snacks to sell. She wants to expand her business and would be happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to buy more raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: María Pastora

texts.es:
María de 31 años de edad,  estudio hasta 3ª grado de educación básica por motivos de escasos recursos económicos,  ella ya no pudo continuar con sus estudios y decidió dedicarse mejor al trabajo de elaboración de hamacas, ella es soltera y  vive junto con su papá ya que es él pasa con ella en la casa, ya que su mama murió hace 3 años.

Ella tiene 17 años de experiencia en la elaboración de hamacas,  ya que en su comunidad esta es la única fuente de ingreso que existe y de este trabajo que realiza es que ella se gana la vida, ella este trabajo lo realiza en su casa ya que ella también está al cuidado de su papá.  

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar hilo, maguillos para elaborar hamacas y comprara ropa casual para niños, jóvenes y  adultos, ya que ella también tiene experiencia en este negocio,


Ella a futuro desea tener un negocio establecido que le permita día a día generar sus ingresos, ya que a futuro desea ampliar más su negocio.
texts.en:
María, age 31, studied until the 3rd grade of elementary school. Due to the lack of financial resources she couldn’t continue with her studies and decided to dedicate to the making of hammocks. She is single and lives along with her dad, since her mother died three years ago.

She has 17 years of experience making hammocks. In her community this is the only source of income, and she makes a living out of this activity. She performs her job in her own house since she has to take care of her dad.

The loan she is requesting is to buy thread, maguillos for making hammocks, and she will also buy casual clothing for kids, teens and adults, since she also has experience in this business.

For the future she hopes she’ll have an established business that will allow her to generate enough incomes to make and expansion.

loans.use: to buy thread, maguillos for making hammocks, and casual clothing for kids, teens and adults.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 43 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Dominga is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Dominga has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new machine for cleaning carpets.

loans.name: Jomalyn

texts.en:
Jomalyn is a 29-year-old mother of one child who lives in Lanao Del Norte with her family. Aside from her swine-fattening business, she also operates a manufacturing business of self-woven lampakanay products and sell them in town. She was able to earn a better income from this activity, which enables her to add more capital to her business. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying lampakanay leaves and products for sale. 

She wants to have more stock, because selling it in volume means higher profits. She took a new loan from GDMPC to buy more lampakanay leaves and to hire her neighbor to help her with weaving. In this way, she is able to create a job and additional income. She plans to renovate her house where she operates her business for a safe and comfortable place to live and to do business.

loans.use: to buy more lampakanay leaves and to hire her neighbor to help her with weaving

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en: Noemi is a 35 year old mother of two children settled for a living in the village of Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She has been operating her business for over four years with the help of her family in order to make a living. Her income from this business enables her to send her children to school. Recently, she became a member of Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a new loan to buy grains and feeding supplies in addition to her grocery goods to increase her sales. She plans to expand her business and create a job in their community and to earn more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy grains and feeding supplies in addition to her grocery goods to increase her sales.

loans.name: Ronelito

texts.en:
Ronelito, a 45-year-old father of three who settled for a living in Gubaan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. 

He has a farm that he cultivates in order to make a living. He is growing and harvesting bananas and selling them in volume. He plans to replant bananas to have more and better farm products. For this, he borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku MPC to purchase additional planting material and manure fertilizer to have a greener farm. 

He is hoping to produce more to help him in augmenting the general living situation of his family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional planting material and manure fertilizer

loans.name: Mariela

texts.en:
Mariela, a 33-year-old micro-entrepreneur from Coron, Palawan, Philippines, has been operating a transportation business for several years, and she makes a good income from this. She is married to Joel, who is a driver, and they are determined to work harder to provide for the everyday needs of their family.

Mariela has two tricycles that carry up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver pays a daily quota to Mariela, and she earns a minimum of 1,200 PHP every day. In her business, the regular customers are the local community. 

Mariela wants to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan to continue operating the business. She will be utilizing the loan to pay for spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of their tricycle.

In the future, Mariela wants to have another tricycle and she hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 27 years old, married and, together with her spouse, is blessed with three children. She has a grocery business that she has been running for the past two years. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more stocks of vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and fruits. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya; she repaid her previous loan successfully. Her future hopes are to grow her business, to be successful, to make more income and to have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma started her small business and is now the owner of a sari-sari store. She has managed to have enough inventory and invests her capital to earn more profit. Every day she makes good sales as she is the only store in their barangay (village). Recently, she approached PMPC for some much-needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce to increase sales

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en: Generosa has a banana farm in Tangub. This is her primary source of income for her family. Generosa makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and earn a good income. Recently, she needed a loan to pay for irrigation costs, which she received from PMPC. Generosa wishes to sustain her business and to supply bananas in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for irrigation costs on her banana farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Faber Alexis

texts.es:
Faber es un joven con toda la energía y disposición para enfrentar el mundo y superarse, tiene un hijo de 4 años y todo el amor del mundo para darle.

Desea iniciar un negocio de venta de productos de peluquería como cremas capilares, enjuagues, maquinas, entre otros.
Es un joven muy aplicado pues estudia y tiene deseos de salir adelante y ser profesional, sin dejar su responsabilidad como padre.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de una vitrina, estantería y compra de inventario en productos de peluquería como cremas y tinturas, así podrá iniciar su negocio. 

Con este préstamo puede cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y darle a su madre todo lo que necesite, además de poder pagar sus estudios y progresar con su familia.

Apoya el proyecto de un joven emprendedor Colombiano!
texts.en:
Faber is a young man with all the energy and willingness to confront and overcome the world. He has a 4 year old son and all the love in the world for him. 

He wants to start a business selling hair styling products such as creams, rinses and machines, among others. 
He is a young man who is determined to study and wishes to get ahead and be professional, while still having the responsibility as a parent. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase a cabinet, shelf and to purchase styling product stock such as creams and dyes, so he can start his own business. 

With this loan, he can fulfill his dream of being independent and give his mother everything she needs, as well as being able to pay for his studies and progress with his family.

Support the project of a young Colombian entrepreneur!

loans.use: to buy a cabinet, shelf and to purchase styling product stock such as creams and dyes, so he can start his own business.

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de Rubén es que ahora su hogar podrá tener unos ingresos extra para sobrevivir.

El se gana la vida con la preparación y venta de comidas rápidas en el municipio de Montería, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Su esposa e hijos son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.

El espera poder impulsar su negocio con la compra de insumos y materia prima para continuar preparando sus alimentos como hamburguesas y demás comidas rápidas populares en esta región.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un restaurante en la misma zona para no perder a sus clientes y poder sacar a sus hijos adelante.
texts.en:
Thanks to Rubén's courage and perseverance, his family has the extra income they need to get by.  

Rubén operates a food stall in the town of Montería.  He learned the business when he needed a new source of income to support his family.

Rubén's wife and children are the reason for his efforts and he's working hard day in and day out to build a better life for them.

Rubén is applying for a loan so that he can buy the supplies he needs to make hamburgers and other prepared foods that are popular in this area.

For the future, Rubén hopes to open a restaurant in the same area where he works now so that he can keep all of his customers. He's working, he says, to make sure his children have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his food business.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita, 50, is a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She and her children manage their own household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Carmelita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages  to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she requests 14,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Carmelita hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of providing  her family with a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and  draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Joerida

texts.en:
Joerida has spent considerable time and energy preparing for the post harvest operations of her business in Liloy. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the  threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another growing season. She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and requested a loan.  Joerida hopes to see all her children finish their degree and have stable careers.

Joerida learned Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. She previously borrowed a loan to jump start her rice production business. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Joerida feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. 

She requests a new a loan to purchase farm supplies and fertilizer for the next growing season. Joerida wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for post harvest operations
